loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline S. is 44 years old, married, and owns a farm as their source of income. She has been blessed with four children, two boys and two girls. Their current income is not enough to support the growing needs of their family. 

When she heard about how CEVI helps small businesses, she applied for a loan to help in funding their farm. Insurance and hospital assistance are also some of the things that she liked about CEVI’s program.

loans.use: farm financing

loans.name: Eugene

texts.en: Eugene is 29, single and provides for other members of his family. He runs a clothing store and employs one other person. He plans to use this loan to buy more stock for his store and to continue to expand his range. He would like to use his profits to re-invest in his business. Once this is stable he would like to use the rest for savings for the future.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Lao

texts.en:
Lao H., 49, resides with her family in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. H. is a farmer, earning an income of USD 1 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of USD 2.5 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 35 on food and USD 48 on other necessary expenses. 

H. is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase a motorbike for her family's use. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for the family's use.

loans.name: Juan Montalvo

texts.es:
Juan Montalvo C. G. tiene 41 años, vive en Unión Libre con la compañera y con los hijos en  el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 1 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  JUNTOS VENCEREMOS se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Matilde Esther  pertenece al Cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla de 12 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas de cultivos de cacao y yuca.

Juan se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao y yuca. Compra sus productos en  Mata de Cacao cada fin de mes y los vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos para los cultivos de cacao y yuca.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es construir la vivienda de hormigón para vivir con la familia.

Le gusta hacer deporte
texts.en:
Juan Montalvo C. G. is 41 years old and lives with his common law wife and their child in the canton of Chillanes in Bolivar Province.

The members of the Communal Bank “Juntos Venceremos” (Together We Overcome) meet at the fairgrounds of Matilde Esther in the canton of Chillanes. There are twelve members in this Communal Bank, all of whom are devoted to growing cacao and cassava.

Juan is a farmer who grows cacao and cassava. He buys his supplies in Mata de Cacao at the end of each month and sells at the fair in Chillanes on Sundays.

Juan is requesting a loan to buy supplies for growing cacao and cassava. The assistance from this loan will help him financially to acquire what he needs. His main challenges are pests, diseases, and weather changes. He dreams of building a concrete house where he and his family can live.

Juan enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for growing cacao and cassava.

loans.name: Georgette

texts.en:
Georgette was born in 1957 in Ouidah, a coastal town in Benin. For the past 25 years she has lived in Cotonou, Benin's largest city. She is married and has six children, all of whom are educated and two of whom are still dependent on their parents.

For the past 15 years, Georgette has run a stall from her home, where she sells various condiments and spices. She sources these from Tokpa, Benin's largest market situated in the heart of Cotonou. 

This is her third loan from 	Alidé following successful repayments in the past. It will enable Georgette to purchase additional stock, with the hope of strengthening her sales and growing her business.

loans.use: to purchase new stocks of spices and condiments

loans.name: Antofagasta Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ANTOFAGASTA” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Juan Pablo II.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes y tiene como presidenta a la señora Elena.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de frutas, abarrotes, venta de comida, venta de cosméticos, venta de libros y revistas, venta de ropa.

La señora Elena, presidenta de la asociación comunal, indica que participa hace diez años en Pro Mujer. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida y atención de baño público, el que ha trabajado hace siete años por iniciativa propia.

El crédito que sacará ahora es para la compra mercadería (para cocinar), el que venderá de lunes a sábado en Villa Dolores (ciudad de El Alto) de 12:00 a 14:00.
Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyarse, pues ella es soltera. 

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y salud.
texts.en:
The “ANTOFAGASTA” community bank is about to start its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Juan Pablo II regional office.  The group has eight members and its president is Elena.  The businesses that the members of the group carry out are varied and include: selling fruit, groceries, meals, cosmetics, books and magazines, and clothes.

Elena, the bank's president, tells us that she has been with Pro Mujer for ten years.  She currently has a business selling meals and working in a public bathroom.  She has been doing this work for seven years and started on her own initiative.

Elena will use this loan to buy supplies (for cooking her meals).  She makes her sales from Monday to Saturday, from 12.00pm to 2.00pm, in Villa Dolores, in the city of El Alto.  This work allows her to make money with which to support herself.  She is single.

When we asked Elena what she likes about Pro Mujer she replied that she likes the training and the health services.

loans.use: to buy supplies (for making meals)

loans.name: Wangnignigbe 2 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupement WANGNIGNIGBE 2 est composé de 19 membres qui se connaissent compte tenu du fait qu'ils cotisent ensemble dans le même quartier. La présidente de ce groupement, du nom de Eugenie, est celle ayant un doigt levé sur la photo. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupement sollicite pour la première fois l'appui financier de ALIDé.
Eugenie est née le 07 Février 1982 à Comè au Bénin. Eugenie est mariée à un soudeur du nom de Désiré et est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés. En plus de ses enfants, Eugenie a un autre enfant à sa charge. Il y a près de cinq ans que Eugenie s'est installée avec sa famille à Ouedo, dans la commune d'Abomey Calavi. Depuis trois ans, Eugenie prépare de la nourriture (pâte de maïs accompagnée de sauce aux poissons, riz, etc.) qu'elle vend dans son restaurant à Ouèdo. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l'aidant à subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Eugenie achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et parfois au marché de Cococodji. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Eugenie sollicite ensemble avec ses autres membres, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Son ambition est de faire de son restaurant une référence dans l'arrondissement de Ouèdo.
texts.en:
The "Wangnignigbe 2" group is composed of 19 members who know each other given the fact that they run their businesses together in the same area. The president of this group, named Eugenie, is the one whose finger is raised in the photo. With the goal of raising the level of their businesses in order to better meet the needs of their clientele, this group is seeking its first loan through ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners).
Eugenie was born on 7 February 1982 in Comè, Benin. She is married to a welder named Désiré and has two children. both of whom are in school. In addition to her own children, Eugenie has one other child in her care. Close to five years ago, Eugenie and her family settled in Ouèdo, in the town of Abomey Calavi. For three years, Eugenie has been preparing food (maize paste accompanied by fish sauce, rice, etc.) that she sells at her restaurant in Ouèdo. This business generates an income that helps her provide for herself and her children. Eugenie buys her goods at Dantokpa, the international market in Benin, and sometimes at the Cococodji market. With the goal of strengthening her business and better satisfying her clientele, Eugenie, along with her fellow group members, is seeking a loan through ALIDÉ. Her ambition is to make her restaurant a landmark in the arrondissement of Ouèdo.

loans.use: to buy maize, fish, vegetable oil, and sauce condiments

loans.name: Muhannad

texts.en:
Muhannad Kitaneh is a young man from Ramallah. He and his wife are employed by the Ministry of Education. Muhannad got married recently and is working on fixing and finishing his home facilities.

Muhannad took out a loan from FATEN to pay for installing sanitary wares and tiles in the bathroom of the house. Even with a decent salary, he stilll can't furnish the house completely all together.

Muhannad, who appears in the picture here, is one of FATEN's committed clients.

loans.use: to install sanitary wares and tiles in the bathroom

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.en:
Leonardo, from the village of Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City, is 40 years old, separated from his spouse, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Leonardo owns and operates a specialized retail store selling seafood products including fish such as sardines and milk fish in the local community. Engaged in his business for over five years, he earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Leonardo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital, he is now requesting his second loan for 8000 PHP to purchase additional fish such as sardines and mackerel. Leonardo plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his store.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish such as sardines and mackerel.

location.town: Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Ori

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion is 33 years old and married with three children.

Consolacion works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and is requesting a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to buy grocery items such as noodles, canned goods, soap and other products to sell in her sari-sari store.

Consolacion has borrowed and paid back 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for four years and earns additional income from buying and selling copra.

Consolacion aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy items such as noodles, canned goods, soap and other products to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: David

texts.es: El señor David trabaja como repartidor de productos lácteos, además en el transcurso de la semana trabaja como voceador de minibús, con los ingresos que obtiene cubre los gastos de su familia. El crédito lo requiere para la construcción de una habitación. Vive en casa de sus padres ubicada en la zona de Villa Bolívar “D”  de la ciudad de El Alto, es soltero y no tiene hijos. Es la primera vez que el cliente obtiene un crédito en IMPRO.
texts.en:
David works as a dairy products delivery person.  Also, during the week he works as a minibus newspaper salesman.  Income he earns covers family expenses. 

He needs the loan to build a room.  He lives in his parents’ house located in the city of El Alto’s Villa Bolívar “D” zone.  He’s single and has no children.  This is his first loan from IMPRO.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Abiner

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Chibuto, Provincia de Gaza, sul de Mocambique casado é pai de 7 filhos de idades entre 8 a 28 anos. Fez a 5a classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras. vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta mais um sobrinho que vive com ele.
Saiu de Gaza para Maputo a procura de emprego, trabalha como cozinheiro permanente a mais de 14 anos e tem um salario de 2.500.00mt por mes que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BCI).
Ja teve emprestimos noutros bancos, conheceu Hluvuku atravez de amigos que tambem sao clientes desta instituiçao. Este é o seu quinto emprestimo no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construçao (blocos, pedra, cimento, barrotes e outros) para a construção da sua casa.
sonha em ver a sua casa concluida para oferecer conforto a sua familia e vai solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Abiner was born in the district of Chibuto in the province of Gaza in southern Mozambique.  He is married and the father of 7 children who range in age from 8 to 28.  He finished studying through the 5th grade but stopped due to the lack of financial resources.  He lives in his own home with his family and also supports one of his nephews, who lives with him.

He left Gaza for Maputo in search of employment.  He has worked as a full-time cook for more than 14 years.  He makes 2,500 meticals a month, which he puts towards his home's expenses.  He also saves some in his bank account at the BCI bank.

He has had loans with other banks.  He became familiar with Hluvuku through friends who are also clients of the institution.  This is his fifth loan in the amount of 15,000 meticals, which he will use to buy construction materials (bricks, stone, cement, beams, etc.) to do construction on his home.

His dream is to finish his house to offer better comfort to his family.  He is going to request more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (bricks, stone, cement, beams, etc.)

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua cooks banku — a fermented corn and cassava based bread usually served with soup or stew — for sale at Elmina. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a mason. Ekua has been selling banku for 7 years. Her loan will be used to buy maize, fish, tomatoes and other foods to cook and sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a better eating place.

loans.use: to buy maize, fish, tomatoes and other ingredients to cook to sell.

loans.name: Cesar Willian

texts.es:
Cesar Willian tiene 37 años de edad, es casado vive con su esposa y sus hijos de 17 y 4 años en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C 	JESUS NOS AMA, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Los Amarillos, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto como siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol Gandul.

Cesar se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol Gandul. Compra sus productos en Agripac y Agroquímicos El Copa y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.
 
Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y compra de abonos e insumos  para los cultivos.   El  crédito le servirá de apoyo para suplir sus necesidades económicas y mejorar sus actividades agrícolas. Enfrenta desafíos como enfermedades en los cultivos como cinta roja en el maíz. Su sueño es comprarse un terreno. 

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Cesar Willian is 37 years old, married, and lives with his wife and children (ages 17 and 4) in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

The members of the Communal Bank "Jesus Nos Ama" (Jesus Loves Us) meet in the neighborhood of Recinto Los Amarillos, which is part of the canton of Ventanas. This Communal Bank consists of short-cycle farmers who grow corn, rice, and pigeon peas.

Cesar is a farmer who grows corn, rice, and pigeon peas. He buys his supplies at AGRIPAC and El Copa Agrochemicals and then sells his products at the wholesale market in Ventanas.

He is requesting a loan for growing corn. He will buy composts and supplies for his crops. With the financial assistance provided through this loan, he will be able to acquire needed supplies and improve in his farming activities. The challenges he faces include diseases that could impact his crops, such as “red stripe” (a strain of virus that attacks corn). His dream is to buy a plot of land.

Cesar enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: to buy compost and farming supplies.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es: El señor Sergio se dedica a la producción de leche que es vendida a la Planta Industrializadora de productos lácteos PIL y su esposa e hijos lo ayudan con el cultivo de papa y otros productos. Con los ingresos que obtienen se mantienen. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de una vaca lechera, para de esta forma aumentar su producción de leche y mejorar sus ingresos. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Laja del departamento de La Paz; es casado y tiene cuatro hijos. Sergio es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2009.
texts.en:
Sergio is dedicated to milk production that’s sold to the PIL Dairy Products Industrializing Plant.  His wife and children help him to farm potatoes and other products.  They support themselves with the income they earn.  He needs the loan to buy a dairy cow to increase milk production and thus his income.  

He lives in his own house located in the community of Laja in La Paz Department.  He’s married and has four children.  Sergio has been an IMPRO client since 2009.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: C5658 Twisungane Group

texts.en:
Odette is 34 years old and is married with 5 children. Her business is well-organized and is well known in the business of selling clothes. Odette is the team leader of this group which is called "TWISUNGANE" in local language. In the picture, Odette is in the middle with a bag in the hands. Her business hours are from 7am until 6pm every day except on the weekend. Sometimes, she works on the weekend and she employs 2 people to help her. 

Odette and her team have requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to improve their businesses by buying various second-hand clothes for sale. With any profits, they will reinvest in their businesses and save for the future.

loans.use: To purchase second-hand clothing for sale.

loans.name: Akouvi  Enyonam

texts.fr:
Akouvi est une femme  âgée de 40 ans. Elle est mariée å un agent de voyage. Elle a 02 enfants, dont 1 à l’école. Le premier a 25 ans et le dernier a 16 ans.  
Akouvi travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2000. Elle achète et revend des poissons pour ses clients à la maison, au marché ou parfois de façon ambulante. Elle est seule impliquée dans son commerce. En ce moment, sa difficulté principale est qu’elle ne dispose pas de moyens de transport. 
Akouvi a requis son deuxième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des poissons. Elle veut investir les  profits supplémentaires dans la vente de céréales. 
Dans les prochaines années, Akouvi voudrait disposer d’un moyen de transport pour convoyer facilement ses marchandises. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit aider son enfant à poursuivre ses études.
texts.en:
Akouvi, age 40, is married to a travel agent. She has two children, out of whom one attends school. One is 25, the other is 16.

She's been working as a reseller since 2000. She buys and sells fish for her customers at her home, at the market, and sometimes door-to-door. She's working alone. At this time, her main challenge is the lack of a mean of transportation. 

Akouvi is seeking her second loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy fish. She wants to invest the additional profits into selling cereals. In the forthcoming years, she would like to have a vehicle to transport her goods more easily. She says that with her profits, she intends to help her child to pursue his studies.

loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: Purificacion

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco “VIRGEN DEL CARMEN DE YUNCAYPATA”; este banco muy simpático está ubicado a 30 minutos de la Ciudad del Cusco en el poblado llamado Yuncaypata, este es un típico pueblito en el que se conserva toda la herencia andina pura, y viven todos en comunidad apoyándose en la época de siembra y cosecha, cuidando a sus hijos y a sus animales, es un pueblo muy bonito y es quechua hablante, está en el departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Purificacion; la socia tiene 25 años de edad, la socia es soltera y tiene 1 hijo  de 6 años de edad;  la socia trabaja en agricultura  y también en artesanía la socia compra textiles en Cusco y los lleva  a vender al poblado siguiente llamado Corao para vender a los turistas que suelen hacer una parada cuando pasa su carro o lo lleva  a Tambomachay que es otro centro arqueológico y aprovecha que ellos están libres y les ofrece los textiles. La socia desea el crédito para invertir en la compra de textiles y mayor artesanía en la ciudad para subir y venderla, ella es padre y madre para su menor hijo motivo por el cual trabaja arduamente para poder dar todo lo que requiere el cuidado y crianza de un niño. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de artesanía en Cusco y subir a Tambomachay y venderlo.
La socia agradece y valora el préstamo mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir disciplinadamente como lo ha ido haciendo con sus anteriores créditos.
texts.en: Purificacion belongs to the "Virgen Del Carmen De Yuncaypata" community bank located 30 minutes from the city of Cusco in a village called Yuncaypata. This is a typical village that maintains all of its pure Andean culture, and the entire community supports each other during the planting and harvest seasons, caring for children and animals. This is a beautiful place where Quechua is spoken, and it's located in the department of Cusco. Purificacion is 25 years old, single and has a 6-year-old son. She works in agriculture and also in handicrafts, buying textiles in Cusco and then taking them to a village called Corao to sell to tourists who often stop while passing in their car. She also takes items to Tambomachay, an archaeological center, and offers the textiles when the workers are free. She is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of textiles and more crafts in Cusco and then go up and sell them. Purificacion is both mother and father to her young son, who is the motivation for her to work arduously in order to give him everything he needs. She is grateful and values the loan through this medium, and she promises to be disciplined in her payments, as she has been with her past loans.

loans.use: to purchase crafts in Cusco and go up to Tambomachay to sell them.

loans.name: Aly

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un soudeur métallique qui est employé dans un atelier de soudure.Il fait néanmoins trés souvent de la consultance pour des particuliers. Il entretient avec son activité toute sa famille.Pour ouvrir son propre atelier, il sollicite un pret de 250000F .Il compte acheter des machines de soudure ainsi que des consommables.
texts.en: The borrower is a metal welder who works in a welding workshop.  He also very often does private jobs for clients on his own.  He is supporting his entire family with his business.  In order to open his own workshop, he is requesting a loan of 250,000F.  He plans to buy welding machines as well as materials.

loans.use: to buy welding machines and materials.

loans.name: Force Plus Group

texts.en:
Kisita is the leader of the community bank named “Force Plus,” which is composed of 28 micro-entrepreneurs. These members are united for the same goal: to grow their businesses through loans received from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC. 

Kisita started her business in 1971, selling corn and cassava flour. Today, she operates a restaurant. She is 51 years old, married and has seven children between the ages of 27 and 32. From 2002 to 2004, her restaurant prospered thanks to good management and accumulated profits. Today, her business makes about $65 per week. Currently, Kisita is happy to be part of one of Hope’s groups. With this loan, she is planning to reinforce the inventory of her restaurant by buying flour, beans and charcoal in order to increase her profit. Her ambition is to someday open a charcoal facility in her area. She sells in the mid-eastern area of Kinshasa.

loans.use: to reinforce the inventory of her restaurant by buying flour, beans and charcoal in order to increase the profits.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 58 years old and single.  She is a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She owns a variety store where she sells groceries such as canned goods, condiments, milk, sugar, and primary commodities that are needed in every household. She enjoys running her store that provides for her daily needs and expenses. 
 
Juanita earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. She is also involved in the direct selling business and rug making. These businesses allow her to have additional income. 

Juanita's store is located adjacent to her house.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

Juanita is requesting a loan for 22,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more groceries and other products that will accommodate the demands of her customers. More items displayed at the store helps her to attract more customers and increase her profits, which will help her save money for her future.

Juanita hopes that her business will grow and become more successful. She dreams of having her own bakery that will enable her to extend help to her family who are in need. She is active in attending the weekly fellowship* as the words from the Bible inspires her to be stronger and also allows her to grow more spiritually. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Bible, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items and other products for her store.

loans.name: Magogoni Group

texts.en:
Malaki, who is in his mid 30s, is married with two children who go to school.  He has had a motorcycle business for one year now.  He works from 6 am to 8 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be his second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan to start building his house and has paid back his loan successfully.  He wants a loan to finish building his house.  His dream is to one day be able to buy another motorcycle and "bajaji" (automated rickshaw),  

He will share this loan with his loan group "Magogoni" which has a total of 16 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to finish building his house.

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
Ana María
Comercio
500000
	Ana María  tiene 42 años de edad, vive en la comunidad de Puntarenas, en la costa del Océano Pacífico de Costa Rica llamado Fray Casiano, es una comunidad con pobreza y problemas sociales, en el cual doña Ana vive con su esposo tiene  4 hijos de ellos solo 1 es menor y los otros trabajan en la zona de Puntarenas. Ella se dedica a actividades de comercio vendiendo perfumes, ropa y zapatos, que distribuye en su bicicleta, además los fines de semana preparan  comidas que vende a sus vecinos.
	Con este préstamo se pretende adquirir mercadería para la temporada de navidad, aprovechando esta época para obtener mayores ganancias y pasar así junto a su familia una mejor situación.  Ella se comunica con sus clientes que son amigos y vecinos ofreciendo sus productos los cuales da a pagos, los visita semanalmente para cobrar y así recuperar su dinero, pagar sus obligaciones y comprar más mercadería o productos para preparar sus comidas.
	Tiene como meta seguir trabajando y apoyando a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y tratar de superarse en una zona donde esto es muy difícil. Tuvo que superar problemas de salud causados por la diabetes, ya que estuvo internada en el hospital, en este tiempo el apoyo de su familia fue muy importante para mantener activa su microempresa.
texts.en:
Ana María
Comercio
500000

Ana María, 42, lives in the community of Puntarenas on the Pacific Ocean coast of Costa Rica called Fray Casiano.  It is a community with poverty and social problems where Ana and her husband live with their four children; only one of them is still a minor and the others work in the Puntarenas zone.  She’s a merchant selling perfume, clothes and shoes that she distributes on her bicycle; on weekends she prepares food that she sells to her neighbors.

She intends to use this loan to buy merchandise for the Christmas season taking advantage of the season to earn higher profits to improve her family’s situation.  She communicates with her customers who are friends and neighbors offering her products which she sells and gets paid in installments.  She visits them weekly to collect payment and recuperate her money, to pay her debts and to buy more merchandise or the products to prepare her meals.

Her goal is to stay in business helping her husband with household expenses and trying to improve herself in a zone where to do this is very difficult.  She had to overcome health problems caused by diabetes for which she was hospitalized.  During that time her family’s support was very important to keep her micro business active.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, clothes, shoes and perfume.

loans.name: Herlinda Mariuxi

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Inmaculada se reúne cada quince días  en La parroquia La Sequita de Montecristi (Portoviejo), cantón conocido  por los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla que son apreciados dentro y fuera del país.

En este lugar vive la señora Herlinda, tiene 22 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un hijo  de seis meses de nacido. Su esposo trabaja en una fábrica en Manta.

Ella tiene un pequeño local en su casa en el cual vende pollos por libras y en pie,  también se dedica a la cría de pollos pero como no tiene muchos pollos les compra a los vecinos de la zona y con esto les ayuda y se ayuda ya que les compra a muy buen precio con lo cual le queda buena ganancia, trabaja todos los días y a toda hora ya que su negocio lo tiene en su casa, lleva cinco años en su negocio y  le va bastante bien.
 
Este crédito es para comprar pollos para la cría y alimento para los mismos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace cuatro ciclos  y le gusta porque se lleva muy bien con todas sus compañeras.
 
Ella está repitiendo el crédito y ha solicitado este crédito para comprar más pollos y tener bastante  para las fiestas que se avecinan ya que en estos días se venden muchos de sus animalitos y a muy buen precio, desde que recibe estos créditos todo se le ha facilitado ya que no tiene que preocuparse por pedir dinero a otras personas que se  llevaban la mayoría de sus ganancias, lo que es  ahora le queda más para arreglar su casa y darle lo mejor a su hijo.

Su sueño es seguir aumentando su negocio.
texts.en:
The María Inmaculada Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the La Sequita de Montecristi parish. The canton is known for their famous Panama hats, which are valued inside and outside of the country.

Herlinda lives in this area. She is 22 years old and married. She has one seven month old son. Her husband works in a factory in Manta. 

She has a small part of her home where she sells chicken by the pound and by the feet. She also raises chickens. However, since she does not have many chickens, her neighbors buy them. That way, she helps them and she helps herself since they buy them at a good price.  She’s able to earn a good profit. She works every day and all day because her business is in her house. She has had this business for 5 years and it is going well. 

This loan is to purchase chickens for raising and food for those chickens. She has been a part of the communal bank for four cycles.  She likes it because she gets along well with the other members.

She requested the loan to purchase more chicken in order to have lots for the upcoming holidays and parties. Nowadays, she is selling lots of her animals at very good prices. Since she started receiving these loans, she does not have to worry about asking other people for money and then taking the majority of her earnings. Now she has more money to repair her house and give the best to her son.

 Her dream is to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: purchase chickens and food for those chickens.

loans.name: Moussa

texts.fr:
Moussa est un tailleur qui  exerce le métier depuis 11 ans. I l est  marié et père de trois enfants.
Son activité consiste à acheter des tissus  à la mode, à les coudre pour les mettre dans le marché.
Avec le crédit il envisage d’acheter des tissus et de la garniture. Il s’occupe de sa famille et de leur besoin au quotidien.
Elargir son activité ,fait parti des plus grand projets de Moussa.
texts.en: Moussa has been working as a tailor for the past 11 years. He is a married father of three children. His business consists of purchasing fashionable fabric to sew together and put on the market. With this loan he will buy fabric and lining. He takes care of his family and their daily needs. Growing his business, is part of Moussa's larger plan.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and raw materials to sew together for resale.

loans.name: Bendera

texts.en:
Bendera is a 49 year old fish monger and livestock keeper in Mariakani. She is a married mother of three children and has been in this business for the past seven years.

She was introduced to KADET by one of our credit staff and this marks her first time borrowing to finance her business. She plans to purchase more fish for sale in her business. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children. 

She hopes to purchase a piece of land from the accumulated profits.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for sale.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 29-year-old single businessman. He has been running a hotel for the past three years with a monthly income of KES 18,000 which he uses to meet his basic needs.

He is applying for his fourth loan with KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. James will use the loan to purchase tables and chairs for his hotel. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will increase his stock of sugar, rice and cooking oil. 

His hopes and dreams are to open a restaurant which will increase his income and to pay for his school fees and continue his education.

loans.use: To purchase tables and chairs for his hotel

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Angelina has a food shop or "sari-sari" store that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Angelina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Angelina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 30-year-old, married woman. She is married to a businessman.

To earn a living, Jane owns and operates a restaurant, which she has been running for 15 years.

She is requesting this loan to add more foodstuffs for resale purposes and to purchase equipment for her restaurant. With the profits she expects as a result of the loan, she would like to construct a house because she is tired of renting. In the future, she would like to establish a supermarket.

loans.use: To purchase equipment and supplies for her restaurant

loans.name: Raya

texts.en:
Raya is married with five children. She lives in the Mbagala area of Dar es Salaam. She owns a retail shop selling different consumable items.

She needs her business to run smoothly by having enough stock of goods and this is a great challenge right now. The demand for general items has risen in her area, partly caused by the month of Ramadan. She needs USD 750 to facilitate her mission.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Salima

texts.en:
Salima was born in 1964 in Salyan region, Yenikand village. She is  married and has 2 children. She likes animals. She breeds chickens, ducks and turkeys.
Her neighbors know her and buy animals from her. She has a lot of customers.  Every day she goes to the market and stores to offer her products.
She has run her business for 10 years.
Now Salima needs a loan of $1000 to buy 10 sheep and  60 chickens.
This is her only sources of income. With this business she supports her family.

loans.use: To buy 10 sheep, 60 chickens

loans.name: Alpha Naniwatamo

texts.en: Alpha has been engaged in selling food since 1994. She started her business with a working capital of $72. Through hard work and determination to succeed, and with the help of Hope’s loans (a Microfinance organisation), Alpha increased the working capital to $1,100. She needs a loan of $1,000 in order to buy sacks of rice, sugar, boxes of salted fish and beans. Alpha was born in 1969 and she is married with seven children. She works very hard to make additional profit to support the children’s studies.

loans.use: To buy food goods such as rice, sugar, salted fish, and beans in bulk for resale.

loans.name: Nushaba

texts.en: Nushaba M., a 29-year-old woman, is married and has a child. She has her own orchard in Yenikand village in the Salyan region and has been in this business for five years. Now she needs a loan of $475 to buy pesticides to improve her orchard.

loans.use: To buy pesticides for her orchard

loans.name: Elshad

texts.en: Elshad Q. is 35-year-old farmer who owns a sheep herd and lives with his three children and wife in small Otuziki village in the southern part of Azerbaijan, in the Saatli region. Elshad has seven years of experience in sheep breeding and mutton selling to the local and capital traders. Elhsad`s business going very well because mutton is in high demand all across Azerbaijan and people eat fresh meat at home and cafes. Elshad decided to expand his business and purchase one milk cow and seven sheep. The estimated cost for cow is $700-800 USD and for one sheep is $60-70 USD.

loans.use: To enlarge his sheep herd and purchase one milk cow

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en:
A. is a 29 year-old mother of three, a native resident of the Vituka area. She has done various businesses for the past five years but recently, she has been selling garments and bed sheets. She also sells clothing used in making wedding gowns, kanga and vitengi (traditional attires).

She knows she wants to buy her own tailoring machine and design the gowns. She also wants to open up a shop in any nearby trading center to target additional new customers for the expansion of her business. She is requesting USD 350 for the expansion of her business.

loans.use: To expand clothing business

loans.name: Emas

texts.en: Emas is 32 years old, a mother of a 15-year-old son. She produces and sells fermented cake made from soybean sediment, with her husband. She usually sells them to the market and can earn $8 per day. She requests a $50 loan to expand her business, and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To add production capital

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth is a 22 year old young woman who has a small grocery store where she sells basic need items such as rice, sugar, oil, drinks, and fruit. Elizabeth inherited this small but well-stocked grocery store from her mother, who makes beautiful sweaters and together they help provide an education to her three younger siblings. Thanks to the excellent customer service she provides and the great variety of merchandise her little store offers, it is very popular with the neighbors. For this reason she wants to expand her store, making it more comfortable and convenient for her customers with new items that she wants to acquire. She is asking for a loan that she promises to repay in six months. Elizabeth anxiously awaits your favorable response.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Elizabeth, es una joven de 22 años de edad, tiene una pequeña despensa de artículos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, aceite, bebidas y frutas en general, esta pequeña pero surtida bodeguita la heredó de su madre quien actualmente realiza hermosas chompas, y junto a ella trata de sacar adelante y brindar educación a sus tres hermanos menores.Gracias a la buena atención que brinda y a la gran variedad de mercadería que ofrece su tiendita es muy concurrida por sus vecinos; es por esa razón que desea ampliar su local, con el fin de brindar mayor comodidad y satisfacer a sus clientes con los nuevos artículos que desea adquirir, con ese fin desea recibir un préstamo de dinero que se compromete a reembolsarlo en un lapso de seis meses. Elizabeth espera ansiosa tu favorable respuesta.

loans.use: Expand her store

loans.name: Socorro Del Rosario

texts.es:
Socorro lives in the neighborhood called Laureles Sur, a place where it's difficult to live due to the lack of drinkable water and electricity. Socorro is 32 years old and the single mother of 4 children. Her oldest daughter is now studying at university, and helps her mother with the care and maintenance of the household.

Socorro has a business selling small quantities of condiments and various plants which the Nicaraguan families use for medicinal purposes. This business has enabled her to provide an income for her family. The loan will be used to purchase more plants so she can continue running her business.

Socorro habita en el barrio Laureles Sur, lugar donde la subsistencia de las familias se hace muy dificil debido a la falta de agua potable y luz electrica. Tiene 32 años de edad y 4 hijos, es madre soltera. Su hija mayor quien se encuentra estudiando en la universidad es quien le ayuda con el cuido del hogar y los oficios de la casa. Doña Socorro tiene un negocio de ventas en pequeñas cantidades de condimentos y algunas plantas buscadas entre las familias nicaraguenses ya sea para hacer té o para medicamentos, como los son canela, achote, mostaza, y éstos los obtiene de pequeños siembros que tiene en su casa de habitación. Este negocio le ha servido para generar los ingresos de su familia, es por eso que desea obtener más arboles pra sembrarlos y poder seguir vendiendo estas plantas.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MORE PLANTS FOR HER BUSINESS.  AS A SINGLE MOTHER, SHE PROVIDES THE ONLY INCOME FOR THE FAMILY.

loans.name: Bweyogerere B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Florence B.. She is currently in the business of used clothing sales and is requesting a loan to expand business. Florence is 29 years old and is single. Each week, Florence makes approximately UGX 60000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to save it for her sisters' and brothers' education. Florence has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 400000 in order to invest in the business and the loan was paid back on time.

Florence is joined in her small group by Josephine N., Perusi N., Sarah N., and Eva N.. Josephine N. has a business selling matooke and wants to add working capital. Perusi N. is currently operating a business selling vegetables and wants a loan to increase stock. Sarah N. operates a business of charcoal selling and wants to add to the business. Eva N. is currently in the business of selling clothes and is requesting a loan to purchase more clothes for sale.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Fatmata is 33 years old and married with 3 children. Fatmata owns a small grocery store and needs to purchase a variety of different items to attract new customers. Her business is the main source of income for the family because her husband is unemployed.

With her previous loan from Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), she expanded her business, and her income also increased. This enabled her meet most of the family expenses. She is requesting a loan of Le.1,500,000 to increase her grocery stock.

loans.use: To increase her grocery stock

loans.name: Masoli

texts.ru:
Masoli is a 44 year old man who is married and has six children. He is a professional house builder and works on private construction sites as a part of a work team. In his free time Masoli raises cattle. His son Azam, who is 18, helps him with this task. Currently the two have 5 rams and 2 cows in their barn. Masoli is planning to use the loan to purchase more animals, since he believes that raising more animals will increase his profits.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Масоли мужчина в возросте 44 года женат имеет 6 детей , по профессии строитель, работает на стройке на заказ с бригадой.В свободное время занимается уходом за скотом.Также ему помогает сын Азам ему 18 лет.Сейчас у него 5 баранов и 2 коровы.Взяв займ он хочет купить еще скот.Он считает что чем больше скот тем больше прибыль.

loans.use: Purchase and sale of cattle

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda is a loving mother who has dedicated the majority of her lifetime to caring for her children. Now that they have each left their parents’ home to form their own families, she has decided to open a small grocery store at home to spend more time with her loving husband. Her need to increase the number of items she offers leads her to request a loan to accomplish her objective.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Yolanda, es una amorosa madre que ha dedicado el mayor tiempo D. su vida a cuidar a sus hijos, ahora que cada uno D. ellos ha abandonado el hogar D. sus padres para formar su propia familia ha decidido aperturar una pequeña bodega en casa para compartir mayor tiempo con su amado esposo.Su necesidad D. incrementar la cantidad D. artículos que oferta en este espacio la conducen a solicitar un préstamo para cumplir su objetivo.

loans.use: Purchase a variety of items for her grocery store.

loans.name: Maruf

texts.ru:
Maruf is 26 years old, married and lives with his parents. After graduating from the university three years ago he started his own business. He started out with renting out of a small kiosk where he provided services in cellular phone activation, sales of prepaid phone cards and printing of documents. By gradually increasing business cash flow he expanded his business. He bought another printer and scanner. He uses parts of the profits to support his family and the rest of it invests into his business. When he heard of Kiva, Maruf has decided to apply for a loan which he will use to buy wholesale SIM cards and prepaid phone cards.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Маруфу 26 лет, он женат и живет вместе с родителями. 3 года назад он закончив университет стал заниматься предпринимательством. Начал с аренды маленького киоска, где занимался подключением к сотовым операторам, продавал карточки пополнения счета, распечаткой текстов. Постепенно увеличивая свой оборотный капитал расширил свою деятельность. Приобрел дополнительно принтер и ксерокс. Получаемый им доход частью он использует для содержания семьи, другую использует для дальнейшего расширения бизнеса. Узнав про КИВА Маруф решил обратиться за займом который собирается использовать для оптового закупа симкарт и карточек пополнения счета.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Mama Emilia A. is a 56 year old widow and the mother of six children. Since her husband’s death, she has had to care for herself and her children single-handedly, which is not an easy task. She joined GHAPE in 2002 and since that time, she has successfully borrowed and repaid four loans, totaling $590. A farmer for all her life, Mama Emilia used her previous loans to begin a pig farm, to clear and work her farmland, and most recently, to start a business selling corn, groundnuts, and beans in the market. With her growing profits, she has paid for her children’s education and supported  her household.

Mama Emilia is now requesting a loan to buy her market items in bulk: corn, beans, and groundnuts by the bag. She is confident in her success because her business experience is growing, she doesn’t have to pay any rent for her market space, and she has the support of her children, who are more than happy to assist her because she has given them a good start in life.

Her loan will be repaid in 24 months, with the first installment repayment due on the fourth month following disbursement.

loans.use: Purchase of groundnuts, beans and corn

loans.name: Nestor

texts.es:
Mr. Nestor is 32 years old and has maintained a relationship with Marlene for the past 5 years.

Nestor has been working in his neighbors wood shop since he was a young boy. In 2005 he decided to start his own wood shot with a some economic support offered by his parents. Currently he makes all types of furniture such as: dresser drawers, storage boxes, and shelving units. Nestor has a solid client base.

His personal wish is to make is wood shop bigger and to have an exhibit salon for his furniture.

The client is applying for the loan in order to purchase wood, wood pieces and nails.

Translated from Spanish by Sandy Juárez, Kiva volunteer.

El Señor Néstor de 32 años de edad, está en pareja con la señora Marlene hace 5 años.

Don Néstor desde pequeño trabajaba en la carpintería de un vecino. En el 2005, fue cuando decidió emprender su propia carpintería con un pequeño apoyo económico que recibió de sus padres. Actualmente esta fabricando mubles de todo tipo como; roperos, fiambreras y modulares. Néstor ya cuenta con una clientela bien formada.

Como sueño personal desea ampliar más su carpintería y poner un salón donde pueda exhibir sus muebles.

El cliente solicita el crédito para la compra de madera, terciadas y clavos.

loans.use: To buy wood, wood pieces and nails.

loans.name: Esiawonam

texts.en: Esiawonam S. sells fish that she buys from the fishermen. She brings them home for processing and preservation, and then sends them to the market for sale at Bantama in Elmina. Esiawonam has received no formal education.  She is married and has three children. Her husband is a sugar cane syrup distiller. Esiawonam has been selling fish since 2006. She is responsible for paying for the feeding of the family and the utility bills. Her loan will be used to to buy more fish for sale. She hopes to use the new profits to reinvest into the business to increase her sales which will eventually increase his income.

loans.use: To buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Luz Angelica

texts.es:
La señora Luz Angélica pertenece al Banco Comunal “Manos Unidas”, vive en la Región y provincia D. San Martín, distrito D. Tarapoto. Es jubilada del sector salud y ahora se dedica a la venta D. comida y refrigeR. tipo delivery, no tiene un puesto o un local. Ella prepara los alimentos en su casa y luego los reparte a sus clientes, quienes en su mayoría son trabajadores D. diferentes instituciones. Se inicio gracias a la iniciativa D. sus colegas D. trabajo, le va bien y ya tiene 5 años en este tipo D. negocio. Solicitan sus servicios cuando hay reuniones sociales y todo tipo D. eventos. 

Con este crédito D. S/.3,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará productos como arroz, azúcar en saco, aceite en galón, fideos, leche en cajas,  y otros ingredientes que necesita para la preparación diaria D. los platos que oferta a sus clientes, ya que la variedad D. platos le garantiza sus ventas y le permite cumplir con sus pedidos.

La señora Luz Angélica tiene 59 años D. edad, sólo vive con su esposo porque sus hijos ya son mayores e independientes. Es una mujer decidida, alegre y buena administradora. Tiene como meta poner un local para la venta D. refrigeR. en su casa, así como ahorrar para tener una vejez tranquila.
texts.en:
Mrs. Luz Angelica belongs to the communal bank "Manos Unidas" (United Hands) and lives in the San Martin region and province, Tarapoto district. She is retired from the health sector and now sells food and snacks on delivery. She does not have a stall or a locale. She prepares the food in her house and then takes it to her clients, the majority of whom are workers in different institutions. She started out thanks to the initiative of her work colleagues. It is going well and she already has 5 years in this type of business. They solicit her services when there are social meetings and all types of events.

With this 3,000 Soles loan, which will be paid off in 6 months, she will purchase products such as rice, sacks of sugar, gallons of oil, noodles, boxes of milk, and other ingredients that she needs for the daily preparation of the plates that she offers her clients, since the variety of the plates guarantee her sales and allow her to meet their requests.

Mrs. Luz Angelica is 59 years old. She lives alone with her husband because their children are already grown and on their own. She is a determined and happy woman and a good administrator. She has the goal of setting up a stall to sell snacks from her house, and therefore save in order to have a calm old age.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will purchase rice, sugar, oil, noodles, milk, etc.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra is a member of the Proyección Village Bank.  She is 40 years old and married with five children. 

Alejandra sells sweets from a tricycle cart, which she usually stations outside of a local school or at the inter-provincial transport agency. She works every day along with her 12-year-old daughter, who goes to school in the afternoons. Alejandra also buys and sells prickly pears at the Ayacucho bus station.   

Alejandra needs a loan of 600 soles to buy cookies, candies, prickly pears and boxes to transport them in. Her dreams are for her children to go to school, to have her own investment capital, and to improve and expand her business.



Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Alejandra es socia del Banco Comunal Proyección. 
Alejandra es casada, tiene 40 años y 5 hijos, Alejandra vende golosinas de manera ambulatoria en un triciclo, diariamente se ubica cerca de un colegio y una agencia de transporte interprovincial, actividad que realiza todos los días con el apoyo de su hija de 12 años, que estudia por las tardes. Además Alejandra en temporadas de cosecha compra y vende tuna en el terminal terrestre. 
Alejandra necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de galletas, caramelos, cajones para tuna y tuna.

Los sueños de Alejandra son que sus hijos estudien, tener capital propio y mejorar, ampliar su negocio.

loans.use: Buy cookies, candies, prickly pears and boxes

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
La señora Sabina es nueva integrante del Banco Comunal “Espíritu Santo” del Centro Poblado de Chimbo, distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno. 

Tiene 34 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos pequeños, es casada y su esposo trabaja junto con ella en la crianza de animales menores. Sabina nos cuenta que no pudo estudiar porque sus padres decían que las mujeres debían dedicarse a los cuidados de la casa.

Con este préstamo de S/. 500, el cual será pagado en 4 cuotas, comprará ganado ovino y porcino para engorde.

Su deseo es comprar más ganado y así continuar con la crianza de animales.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sabina is a new member of Banco Comunal “Espiritu Santo” of Centro Poblado de Chimbo, in district and province of Yunguyo, and department of Puno. She is 34 years old and is mother of three little ones. She is married and together with her husband she breeds young animals. Sabina tells us that she could not study because her parents told her that women should dedicate themselves to household work. With this loan of 500 Peruvian Sol, which she will pay in 4 increments, she will buy sheep and pig for fattening. She hopes to buy more livestock and continue with breeding animals.

Translated from Spanish by Christina Stoddard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy livestock to fatten

loans.name: Tuy

texts.en:
Mrs. Tuy S., 44, is married and has six children. Three of them are enrolled in school and three work as laborers. 
S. and her husband have a seasonal fruit reselling business. She has a lot of business during mango season because mangoes are very popular in Cambodia. S. and her husband travel a lot to purchase large quantities of mangoes to sell to other resellers, wholesale and retail. This month, bananas are in season, and S. and her husband are traveling to the banana plantations to purchase as many mangoes as possible.
S. and her husband make around $15.60 per day selling fruit. However, she has many monthly expenditures of around $65 on food, $15 on utilities, $10 on transportation, $15 on her children’s tuition, and other assorted expenses.
S. is requesting a loan to be able to purchase more fruit so she will be able to sell more of it and make a larger overall profit.

loans.use: To purchase more fruits to increase her inventory

location.town: Tboung Kmum district, Kampong Cham province, Cambo

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
La señora Juliana es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Brisas del Rio Blanco”, en el sector cuatro, comunidad D. Sucano, distrito D. Pilcuyo, Provincia D. El Collao, Departamento D. Puno; D. 40 años D. edad, tiene tres hijos, es casada y posee estudios D. secundaria incompleta (tercero D. secundaria).
Trabaja hace cinco años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos e inicio su negocio D. compra y venta D. ganado, su primer préstamo fue D. S/.300.00 nuevos soles y se siente contenta porque le permitió comprar ganado ovino para poder engordarlo y venderlo.
Con este préstamo D.  S/. 3000 Nuevos soles, monto que destinará a compra D. mas ganado (ovinos) para poder engordarlos y venderlos en las ferias ganaderas D. Pilcuyo; asimismo ella se dedica a la compra y venta D. quesos; para lo cual requiere el préstamo para poder acopiar mas quesos y venderlos a pedidos en las ferias D. Cusco y Arequipa, D. esta manera contribuirá a mejorar la calidad educativa D. sus hijos; asimismo se compromete a pagar puntualmente su préstamo sus cinco cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Ms. Juliana is a member of the village bank “Las Brisas del Rio Blanco”, in the fourth sector of the community of Sucano, district of Pilcuyo, province of El Collao, Department of Puno. She is 40 years old, married, has three children and completed three years of secondary school. For the last five years she has worked with Manuela Ramos and began her business buying and selling cattle. Her first loan was for 300 Peruvian Nuevos Soles and she feels content because the loan allowed her to buy sheep to fatten and sell. This loan of 3000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles she will put towards the purchase of more cattle (sheep) to fatten and sell in the cattle markets of Pilcuyo. She also purchases and sells cheese needs this loan in order to acquire more cheeses and sell them by order in the markets of Cusco and Arequipa. In this way she will contribute to the improved education of her children and also punctually pay back her loan in five monthly installments.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kahn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle (sheep) to fatten and sell in the markets of Pilcuyo

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort N. sells used clothing at Abura. Comfort has received junior high school education. She is married and has 5 children. Her husband is a building painter.

Comfort has been selling used clothing for about 2 years. She is responsible for paying housekeeping expenses. Her loan will be used as additional capital to enable her to increase the sale of used clothing to meet the increase in demand by her customers. She hopes to use the new profits to reinvest for the expansion of her little business.

loans.use: additional capital to enable her to increase the sale of used clothing

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia sells foodstuffs, provisions and drinks. She has been in this business for a long time. She is 48 years old and married with five children.

She hopes for the loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and drinks to sell

loans.name: Kusi Killa Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Kusi KilL. inicia su tercer ciclo con 20 socias. 

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como L. venta D. frutas, comidas, mercerías, abarrotes en general, lácteos, panes, animales menores, tubérculos y tejidos D. chompas.

Como es el caso D. Yovana que es viuda, tiene 41 años y 5 hijos, Yovana se dedica a L. elaboración D. yogurt, sus ventas los realiza a pedidos. Además Yovana realiza bordados D. manteles, entre otros.

Por otro lado Rosa es soltera, tiene 42 años y 3 hijos, Rosa se dedica a L. compra y venta D. maní, actividad que realiza en L. feria D. Las Américas.

Mientras que Elizabeth es conviviente, tiene 21 años y 1 hijo, Elizabeth venD. cosméticos por catálogos que ofrece a amigos, familiares, sus ventas son al crédito.  

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 450 soles, 600soles, haciendo un total D. 10,350 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en L. compra telas, hilos, utensilios D. cocina, cosméticos, arroz, azúcar, leche, frutas, panes, animales menores.

Los sueños D. las socias son que sus hijos culminen sus estudios, tener capital propio, ampliar sus negocios y construir su casa.
texts.en:
The Kusi KilL. Community Bank is beginning its third loan cycle with twenty members. The members have businesses that sell a variety of items, such as fruit, food, notions, general merchandise, dairy products, bread, small animals, root vegetables, and woven sweaters. For example, Yovana is a 41-year-old widow with five children. Her business is making yogurt, which she sells by taking orders from customers. Yovana also embroiders tablecloths, among other things. On the other hand, Rosa is a single 42-year-old with three children. She buys and sells peanuts at the “Las Américas” market. While Elizabeth, a 21-year-old mother of one son who lives with her partner, sells cosmetics from catalogs. She sells them to friends and relatives on credit. The group's members need differing loan amounts, 300, 450, or 600 Peruvian nuevos soles, for a grand total of 10,350 nuevos soles to be loaned to the community bank. The loans will be invested in the purchase of fabric, thread, cooking utensils, cosmetics, rice, sugar, milk, fruit, bread, and small animals. The members of the group hope that their children will complete their studies. They also dream of having their own financial resources, expanding their businesses, and building homes.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabric, thread, cooking utensils, cosmetics, rice, sugar, milk, fruit, bread, and small animals.

loans.name: Bola

texts.en: Bola is 33 years old and married with 4 children. She has a shop where she sells shoes and bags. She hopes to own a big boutique in the future. She is requesting the loan amount of 100,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase more shoes and bags to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes and bags to sell

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es:
S. C. D. A. PILAR 
90001727


La señora Pilar  es socia del Banco Comunal “Aswancaris II” en la  provincia D. Azangaro, departamento D. Puno, tiene 56 años D. edad, es casada con 06 ya independientes, vive en el Jr. Julia Paredes, Barrio Vilca Apaza, ella posee estudios D. superior incompleta, (trabajo social). 

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 10 meses, la actividad a la que se dedica es la compra y venta D. productos veterinarios, su primer préstamo fue D. S/ 500.00 nuevos soles, a fin D. comprar mas productos veterinarios  para su tienda.

Actualmente ella desea un préstamo adicional D. S/ 800.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que piensa pagar en 06 cuotas; el mismo que le servirá para poder adquirir mas mercadería productos veterinarios (vacunas, vitaminas, alimento balanceado),  su esposo es veterinario y los dos manejan el negocio; su deseo seguir trabajando para poder en el futuro vender al por mayor sus productos.

Le gustaría  comprarse una casa en Arequipa, y continuar apoyando a sus hijos. 

Asimismo ella refiere que le gusta mucha la puntualidad  y la facilidad con que dan los préstamos, y esta muy agradecida a Manuela Ramos por  el apoyo que les brindan.
texts.en:
Pilar S. C. D. A.
90001727

Pilar is a member of the Community Bank "Aswancaris II" in the province of Azangaro, in the Puno region. She is 56 years old and she is married and has 6 children who are already independent. She lives in Jr. Julia Paredes, in the Vilca Apaza colony. She earned a post secondary degree in social work.

She has been involved with the Manuela Ramos program (Kiva Field Partner) for the past 10 months. Her business is the buying and selling of veterinary products. Her first loan was in the amount of S/.500 nuevos soles and it was invested in purchasing veterinary products for her store.

She requires a new loan in the amount of S/.800 neuvos soles, to be repaid in 6 payment installments. The funds will be used to acquire more verterinary products merchandise (vaccines, vitamines, balanced food). Her husband is a veterinarian and they both manage the business. Her dream is to keep working towards her goal of one day being able to sell her products on a wholesale basis.

She would love to be able to purchase a home in Arequipa and to keep supporting her children.

She mentione that she really appreciates the expediency and ease of receiving loan funds, and she feels very grateful towards Manuela Ramos for the support they have provided her.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase veterinary products such as vitamins, vaccines, and food.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort Q. is married with four dependants and has no formal education. She is a fish monger who sells smoked fish in small quantities in Duakyenim. She has been in this business since 1999. Her husband is a salt miner whose income is insufficient to meet the family’s expenses. Comfort uses all her income to support her husband in paying her children’s school fees. Comfort will use the loan to purchase more smoked fish for resale. She plans to save and reinvest the new profits earned from her expanded business.

loans.use: To purchase more smoked fish for resale

loans.name: Ernelyn

texts.en: Ernelyn B. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 40 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. Ernelyn owns and operates a general store, primarily selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Ernelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her first from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.es:
"La señora Bernardina F. C., tiene como actividad la venta de ají y condimentos esta actividad la realiza en Caranavi, poblacion a unos 200 kilometros de la ciudad de La Paz, los días lunes, martes, miércoles, y jueves.
La cliente actualmente es una persona muy responsable, con sus obligaciones, siendo cliente antigua de Emprender quien trabaja cumpliendo con nuestra institución.
texts.en:
Señora Bernardina F. C. works at selling chili peppers and condiments in Caranavi, which is located some 200 kilometers (125 miles) from the city of La Paz. She works Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday. This client has thus far been very responsible with her payments, and is a long-term client of Emprender who works to meet the requirements of that institution.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace D. C. is from the village of Barangay Poblacion, Iligan City. She is 55 years old. Grace is widowed and has 10 adult children. To make a living, Grace owns & operates a specialized retail business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from operating a sari-sari (variety) store and selling barbecue (grilled meat) and bananas in the local community. Grace has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 1,500 Philippine pesos (about $31 US) a month for these activities.

In July 2009, Grace joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Grace is requesting a loan of 5,000 pesos which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Grace from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of her family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand the business

location.town: Poblacion, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es:
Rosmery vende galletas y dulces los días lunes, miércoles y viernes; el resto de los días vende chicharrón (cerdo frito en pedazos acompañado con maiz y chuño) en la tranca de la misma zona; su esposo es contratista de obras de albañilería, a la vez Rosmery cría gallinas chanchos y los comercializa en la ferias, es de donde proviene los ingresos económicos para la manutención de sus dos hijos, vive en casa propia su domicilio esta ubicada en la Zona San Roque de la  Ciudad de el Alto.
 
El préstamo lo destinara para la compra de material de construcción, para terminar la obra fina  de su departamento.
 
Es primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Rosmery.
texts.en:
Rosmery sells crackers and sweets on Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays. The remainder of the days she sells chicharrón (fried pork rind accompanied with maiz and potato starch) in the bar of the same zone. Her husband is a bricklaying works contractor. At the same time, Rosmery raises young chickens and markets them at the fairs. This is how she earns the income for the maintenance of her two children. She lives in her own home located in the San Roque zone of the city of El Alto. The loan will be used to purchase building material, to finish the detail work on her home. This is her first loan with Impro. The evaluation carried out qualifies her for the approval of the loan requested by Rosmery.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy stucco, paint, electrical sockets, etc. to finish the detail work on her house.

loans.name: Yusup

texts.en:
K. Yusup is 23 years old and lives with his wife and two children. He owns a minibus which generates the income necessary to support his family. Yusup needs this loan to buy spare parts to keep the vehicle in good working condition, as this is how he makes his living. This will allow him to perform his work better, so as to save more money in order to provide for his family.  
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase spare parts in order to repair his minibus

loans.name: Wanambwa 2 Lesiya Namudila Group

texts.en: Lesiya N. is the group’s chairperson and she is forty years old, married, with two children both attending school. She sells new clothes and has been doing this since 2002. She is requesting a loan to add capital to her business as well as purchase more new clothes, such as dresses, trousers, t-shirts, skirts, socks, etc. for sale. She is works hard, and her future hope is that through this hard work she will be able to obtain a plot of land and live a good life.

loans.use: To add capital to her business as well as purchase more new clothes to sell.

loans.name: Kil's Group

texts.en:
This small loan is being requested by four low-income people. Mrs. Kil N., 54, has been selected to be the leader by the group members. Kil N. sells a few cakes to her neighbors for a daily profit, while her husband works at carrying loads at a local fish market. The couple has given birth to six children; one of them sells souvenirs to tourists.

Kil N. will be using her first loan to repair her existing house that is in poor condition. The other three borrowers who have jointly requested this loan are:

S., who requests a loan to buy ingredients continue selling cakes; N., who will be using her loan to repair her old house;

R., who is applying for a loan to decorate her house.

loans.use: To repair her existing house that is in poor condition

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en:
Rose K. is 35 years old and the leader of her group in Mukono. She is divorced and cares not only for her own two children, but for several orphans as well. Rose has operated her own boutique for three years and generates profits of over 80,000 USH per week from it. One of the big challenges of her business is to stock appropriate amounts of clothing during periods of seasonal change.

Rose would like to use her loan of 300,000 USH to buy additional amounts of clothing. She believes that if she continues to work hard by offering fair prices and excellent levels of customer care her business will continue to grow and she will be able to better support her family.

loans.use: to buy more inventory

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a 37-year-old single mother of two teenage children. She has been hawking (selling door-to-door) shoes along the streets of the slums of Mathare for four years. She is requesting a loan of Kes. 20,000 to purchase more shoes and sandals to sell. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and import her own wares. She describes herself as ambitious and hardworking and says that, since becoming a member of Faulu, she has begun keeping records.

About Faulu Kenya:
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell

loans.name: Epripras

texts.en:
Epripras L. is from the town of Magcamiguing, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 59 years old, is married, and has four adult children. Epripras owns and operates a "sari-sari" or general store, selling a variety of products like shampoo, milk, candies, canned goods and others in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 2,100 PHP a month. In 2009, Epripras joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products for sale. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.
