Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional goods for sale

loans.name: T. Danielle

texts.fr: H. T. Danielle est née le 10 Février 1966 à Brazzaville au Congo, Etat voisin du Bénin. Danielle vit à Attakè à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin, depuis 29 ans. Mariée à GBODOGBE Luc un transformateur, Danielle est mère de trois enfants tous scolarisés. Danielle vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. Danielle est allée à l’école jusqu’au cours secondaire. Pour se prendre en charge, Danielle vend des divers (papier hygiénique, sucre, sardine, conserves, insecticides, enveloppes, etc.) du riz, maïs et de la farine de manioc devant son portail à Attakè. C’est depuis 20 ans que Danielle mène cette activité. Danielle s’approvisionne à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, et au marché Ouando à Porto-Novo. Danielle a bénéficié de deux crédits à ALIDé, crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. En vue d’augmenter son fonds de roulement et d’accroître davantage son activité pour faire face à la demande de la clientèle en période des fêtes de fin d’année, Danielle sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Danielle ambitionne acheter plus tard, une parcelle et construire sa propre maison.
texts.en:
T. Danielle H. was born February 10th, 1966, in Brazzaville, Congo, a country next to Benin. For the last 29 years Danielle has lived in Attakè of Porto-Novo, administrative capital of Benin. She is married to Luc GBODOGBE, who works in a cashew nuts' transforming factory, and she is mother of three children, who are all attending school. Danielle supports her husband with family's expenses. She attended secondary school. To provide for her household she sells in Attakè, by her door, different items (toilette paper, sugar, sardines, cannery, insecticides, envelopes, etc.) as well as rice, corn and manioc flour. Danielle has run this business for twenty years. Danielle buys her supplies in Cotonou, financial capital of Benin, as well as at the Ouando market in Porto-Novo. Danielle was granted from ALIDé two previous loans, that she fully repaid. In order to increase her operating fonds and to be ready to satisfy her customers for the end of the year business, Danielle requests a third loan to ALIDé. Danielle wishes to be able in the future to buy a piece of land and build her own house.

Translated from French by MONICA URBAN, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy different items (sugar, cannary, rice, corn, etc.)

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina is a 45-year-old woman. She is widowed and the mother of two children, both of whom are schooling. She works very hard to support her children’s basic needs.

Faustina is a food vendor who sells rice and stew in the community where she lives. She started her operation about three years ago in order to take care of her entire family.

Faustina’s food production is on a low scale because of inadequate funds to support her business. She wants to use the loan to buy more meat, vegetables, and bags of rice to produce in larger quantities and to increase her efficiency. She believes this will help expand her business to raise more income.

Faustina also wants to make her children happy as we enter into the Christmas season.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, vegetables, meat, firewood, etc.

loans.name: Nubia Carina

texts.es: Nubia Carina es soltera, habita junto a su familia compuesta por su mamá, 2 hermanos y 2 sobrinitos, trabaja como maestra de computacion en el Centro Cultural Juigalpan desde hace 5 años, ademas se dedica a vender ropa usada con el apoyo de su hermana, pues a pesar de no ser casada ni tener hijos, es muy trabajadora y le brinda su apoyo a su mamá y a su hermana que es madre soltera de 2 niños (el varon de 2 añitos y la niña de 7 años con problemas de aprendisaje),  y con este negocio obtienen ingresos adicionales que le permiten el sustento de su familia. Esta solicitando su 2do credito para invertirlo en su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa usada comprando  paca de ropa juvenil, de varon y ropa de cama. El mayor sueño de Nubia es estudiar una especialidad para compartir sus conocimientos con otras personas, seguir apoyando a su mamá y hermana y ademas poder tener su propia familia.
texts.en:
Nubia Carina is single and lives with her family, composed of her mother, her 2 brother and her 2 young nephews. She has worked as a computer science teacher in the Juigalpan Cultural Center fo 5 years. Additionally, she and her sister sell used clothing. Despite being single without children of her own, she is very hardworking and supports her mother and her sister, who is the single mother of 2 children: a 2 year boy and a 7 year old girl with learning disabilities. Through the business they earn the additional income that allows them to sustain the family. Nubia is requesting her second loan. She will invest the loan in her used clothing business, by buying children's clothing, men's clothing and bed linens. Nubia's dream is to study a specialty in her field, so she can share her knowledge with others, continue supporting her mother and sister, and one day have her own family.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy used clothing

loans.name: Unicas Por Siempre Group

texts.es:
Banco D. Emprendimiento LAS  UNICAS POR SIEMPRE esta en su segundo ciclo D. su credito en el primer ciclo sacaron un monto D. 18000 Bolivianos con 12 socias, y actualmente en fecha del 22 D. Diciembre del 2009 se desembolsó un nuevo crédito a 13 socias,  con pagos quincenales y para 12 cuotas, es un banco que tiene un historial crediticia bueno desD. el primer ciclo, toda las socias asisten puntualmente a las reuniones que se realizan en la oficinas a horas 15:00 PM. D. la tarD..

La señora Evelin vive en el Barrio Noel Kemf Mercado en la Zona del Plan 3000 en la casa D. su padre, es concubina y tiene 2 hijos, en la misma casa tiene una venta D. abarrotes, que D. esta manera ella cuadyuba en el bienestar D. su familia tiene muchas perspectivas D. hacerles estudiar a sus hijos y con el primer prestamo invirtio en su tienda mejoro mucho donD. compro 3 estantes y con el segundo credito lo utilizo para la compra D. productos como arroz, fideo, jabon hace,.etc,.etc.

La Señora Ruth que es la presidenta del Banco D. emprendimiento, que  se dedica a la venta D. Ropa interior, compra D. la Feria del Barrio lindo al por mayor y lo venD. anbulando Bario por Barrio y casa por casa y deja al credito D. esta manera invirtio el credito que se lo otorga, segun lo que manifiesta que lo ayudo mucho por que ya no tenia capital por que se lo habia comido y con la ayuda D. la institucion nueva mente recobro su negocio.

La señora Sonia  es una socia antigua que se dedica a la venta D. verduras que lo compra del abasto, ella tiene un puesto en el mercadito  bien venido D. la Villa primero D. Mayo tiene su concubino, dos hijos D. esta manera ella ayuda a su familia sus hijos aun son pequeños, con el segundo credito que se lo otorgo aumento a su capital; ahora ya compra en un volumen mas granD..   							

Estan muy agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The Las Unicas por Siempre (The Only Ones Forever) Enterprise Bank is in its second loan cycle. In the first cycle the 12 members took out a loan of 18,000 bolivianos. The group's current loan was disbursed on December 22, 2009 to 13 group members. They will repay this loan in 12 bi-weekly installments. The bank has had a good credit record since the first cycle. The members are punctual in their attendance at meetings held at the office at 3:00 p.m. Evelin lives in the Noel Kemf Mercado section, the Plan 3000 Zone, in her father’s house. She has 2 children from a common-law marriage. From that house she sells groceries, so as to help support her family. She has plans for her children to study. She invested the first loan in her store, making improvements such as the purchase of 3 shelving units. She used the second loan to buy commodities such as rice, pasta, soap, etc. Ruth is president of the Enterprise Bank. Her business is selling underwear. She buys wholesale at the Barrio Lindo bazaar, then goes house to house through the neighborhoods selling on credit. This is how she spent the loan given her, which was a great help, since her working capital had been used up. With the help of the institution, she recovered her business. Sonia is a long-time member who sells produce she buys from the El Abasto Market. She has a place in the little market in May 1st Villa. She has a common-law husband and two small children. She helps her family this way. She used the second loan to increase her working capital, and she now buys in greater quantities. They are grateful to Emprender and Kiva for their trust in extending credit.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Avelino

texts.en: Avelino A.'s main source of income comes from providing motorcycle services to local community members. He is 59 years old, married and has four adult children. He is from the village of Dinas, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. Avelino has been in business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2007, Avelino joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. Avelino has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from GDMPC. Avelino is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide his service. This will be his sixth loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand his business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Gwenotwom A Lawino Teddy Group

texts.en: L. Teddy is the group representative of seven members of the group. She is 35 years old and married with three children, all in school. She also has five dependants. Two of her dependants go to school. She makes local brew for sale. She has been in her business for over 20 years. Her business is seasonal due to the scarcity of the ingredients (millet, sorghum, and so forth). So she is using the loan to purchase millet and sorghum in large quantities for her business. She hopes to obtain livestock like goats and cows in the future.

loans.use: To purchase millet and sorghum

loans.name: Mariana De Jesus

texts.es:
La señora Mariana S. es socia del banco comunal Haciendo un mundo mejor, es una socia luchadora y siempre ve por el porvenir de su familia, este es su tercer crédito con la  fundación y se enteró de la existencia de la institución  gracias a un vecino de su comunidad y por su hija que se integró al grupo antes que ella y la invito a ser partícipe del banco.

Mariana se dedica a la crianza de animales como vacas, pollos, borrego, cuyes  que los vende los días jueves en la feria del ganado o en la  feria libre de Cuenca, en ocasiones los vende  en su propia casa a sus vecinos de la comunidad, además  se dedica a la agricultura cultivando sus propias tierras.

Ella vive en la parroquia Turi en la comunidad Santa Anita, tiene 43 años de edad, es casada y tiene cuatro  hijos que se encuentran de 25, 24, 23, 10 años,  su primer  y tercer hijo ya son casados y viven  independientes con la familia que formaron, su hija de 24 años es soltera trabaja y le ayuda un poco económicamente tanto para los gastos de la casa como para el estudio de su hermana menor,  su esposo trabaja en la rama de la construcción, profesión que le ha permitido sacar adelante a su familia  y con mucho sacrifico lograr construir su casa propia.

Con el nuevo crédito que reciba de la fundación va a comprar cría  de pollos, maíz, balanceado y vitaminas  para el crecimiento de sus aves y agrandar su negocio. Tiene como  meta ir incrementando poco  a poco pollos y cuyes  para contar con  un criadero grande y ser distribuidora de los mismos.
texts.en:
Mariana S. is a member of the “Haciendo un Mundo Mejor” (Building a Better World) communal bank. She is a tenacious woman who is always looking after her family’s future. This is her third loan with the foundation. She became aware of the institution thanks to a neighbor and to her daughter, who became a member before she did, and invited her to participate in the bank. Mariana raises farm animals like: cows, chickens, goats, guinea pigs. She sells them on Thursdays at the Cuenca free cattle market. Sometimes she also sells them from home to her neighbors; she also farms her own farmlands. She lives in Turi parish, Santa Anita. She is 43 years old, married, and has 4 children, who are 25, 24, 23 and 10 years of age. Her first and third sons are married and live independently with their own families. Her 24-year-old daughter is single and is employed; she helps out economically both with household expenses and with educational costs for her younger sister. Her husband is in construction, an occupation that has made it possible for him to get his family ahead in live and, through much sacrifice, to build their own home. She will use the new loan to buy chicks, corn, nutritionally balanced feed and vitamins for the birds and to enlarge her business. Her goal is to gradually increase her chicken and guinea pig production so that she can have a large nursery and become a distributor of them.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chicks, corn, nutritionally balanced feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Bawanguzi Development Group, Mukono

texts.en:
N. Felista, shown in the small photo at the top left, also appears in the group photo. She is the leader of her lending group in Mukono. She is a 35-year-old friendly lady who is married with four children, all in school.

Felista owns a school in Nabuti that has been operational for four years and she is grateful that the loans have helped her in running it. She hopes to continue improving the academic standards of her school so that her pupils can be good and successful citizens.

Felista also hopes to expand her school further but needs a loan to help with buying more foodstuffs in bulk for the school.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs in bulk for her school

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy additional animals for resale

loans.name: Qasabha Group

texts.en: Ziaulhaq is a member of the Qasabha group. He lives in district three of Nangarhar province. He is married and has 6 children, three sons and three daughters. He has a butchery shop where he sells meat from sheep. He wants to take out a loan to buy more sheep so as to increase his business income and expand his business capacity since this is the only source of income  through which he supports his family members. He is grateful to all Kiva lenders around the world for helping this small loan process in Afghanistan.

loans.use: to grow their working capital or inventory

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is married with 4 children. Her children are in primary and secondary school. She sells groceries, foodstuffs and drinks. She has been in this business since 4 years. Victoria has been able to support her family with part of the profit she gets from her business. She is requesting for a loan of NGN 70,000 to purchase a deep freezer and also rent a big stall for her business. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a deep freezer and rent a bigger stall

loans.name: Justine

texts.fr: Née en 1974 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, K. Justine est mariée à AKODE Benoît. Le couple a deux enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. La famille vit au quartier Agbodjèdo à Cotonou, depuis environs six ans. Justine  assure avec son mari les différentes charges de la famille. Justine n'a jamais fréquenté l'école. Pour assurer ses besoins, Justine vend depuis environs sept ans, de l'huile de palme à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Justine s'approvisionne également à Dantokpa. Justine a déjà bénéficié de deux prêts de ALIDé, prêts qui ont été tous bien remboursés. Justine désire renforcer davantage son activité et augmenter sa part de marché, ce qui lui permettra de se faire plus de revenu. C'est dans cette optique que Justine sollicite un troisième crédit.
texts.en:
Justine K. was born in 1974 at Cotonou, the business capital in Benin. She is married to Benoit Akode. The couple have two children who have attended school. The family has lived in the Agbodiedo neighborhood of Cotonou for the past 6 years. Justine and her husband, together, share meeting the family's living expenses and responsibilities. Justine has never attended school. To insure that their needs are met, Justine has engaged in selling palm oil at Dantokpa, the international market in Benin, for the past 7 years. She also buys her supplies at the Dantopa market. Justine has already made two loans with ALIDe, loans that have been duly repaid. She would like to strengthen her business advantage and increase her market share, which would enable her to generate greater revenues. For this reason, she would like to make this third loan.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy containers of palm oil for resale

loans.name: Benkelema Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe BENKELEMA II sont des femmes mariées  avec une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 5 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles polygames à SOKOURANI un des villages de la commune de KADIOLO préfecture  de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur quatrième collaborations avec l’institution, les prêts passés se sont bien dénoués.
Les spéculations cultivées sont : le riz, l’arachide (par MAMOU O.), et le haricot. 
Avec son nouveau prêt, MAMOU O. compte acheter des intrants et des petits matériels pour entretenir 1Hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de KADIOLO et de ZEGOUA après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 80.000 FCFA après la campagne, qui sera utilisé pour soutenir les frais de scolarité des enfants et les soins de santé de la  famille.
Cette femme du groupe BENKELEMA II souhaite entretenir  sa collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’exploiter son champ au mieux pour en tirer plus de gains.
texts.en:
The ten members of the BENKELEMA II group are married women who, on average, are 40 years old and have five children. Most are part of polygamous families in SOKOURANI, a village of the KADIOLO commune, in the Sikasso prefecture (Mali's 3rd administrative region). They work with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to carry out their agricultural activities during the winter. This is their fourth experience with the institution and the past loans went well. The crops cultivated are: rice, peanut (by MAMOU O.) and beans. With the new loan, MAMOU O. plans to buy supplies and small tools to maintain 1 Hectare. After harvest, the production will be sold in the village and in the KADIOLO and ZEGOUA markets to both men and women. She plans to make an average profit of 80.000 CFA after the crop year, which will help pay for the children's schooling and family health costs. This woman from the BENKELEMA II group wishes to maintain her partnership with Soro Yiriwaso so as to make the most of her field and make more profit.

Translated from French by Loïc Haméon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying small supplies and small agricultural tools.

loans.name: Phoebe Ma. Rosario

texts.en:
Phoebe Ma. Rosario V. is from the city of Dawo, Dapitan. She is 42 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living she owns and operates a business venture in the services sector providing room rental to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately $340 a month from this activity.

In 2008, Phoebe Ma. Rosario joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 5th loan rom PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita A. is from the village of Camanga, Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 31 years old. Conchita is married. Conchita owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as biscuits, candies,shampoo, soap, & toothpaste in the local community. Conchita has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2010, Conchita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Conchita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Conchita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Srom's Group

texts.en:
Fourteen people comprise this village loan located in Prek Raing village, Kandal Province and led by Mrs. Srom M., 33, the village bank president  selected by the members. Each group member will use their portion of the loan to support their various businesses.

Srom is a Khmer cake seller in the local market while her husband, Mr. T. Tuy, is a fisherman, both occupations providing a small income that allows them to support their family. They have three children, two of whom are attending the local school while the other, age 3, is not yet in school.  In order to support her husband's fishing business, Srom is requesting a loan from AMK to buy a fishing machine.

loans.use: To buy a fishing machine for fishing

loans.name: Martha Isabel

texts.es:
Martha de 45 años, ella tiene una pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa, vive en el Guasmo de Guayaquil (zona urbana, la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes informales). 

Desde hace 2 años atrás, comenzó a comprar víveres para venderlos a sus vecinos, poco a poco con esfuerzo y dedicación pudo comprar suficiente mercadería para ubicar una pequeña tienda, ahora ella trabaja desde las 06h00 hasta las 22h00pm todos los días con ayuda de sus hijos. 

Para poder seguir con su tienda ella quiere comprar con el préstamo arroz, bebidas, confites. En el futuro quiere tener un Minimarket que cumpla con todas las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Martha is 45 years old. She has a small store in the front of her house. She lives in El Guasmo in Guayaquil (a section of the city where the majority of the residents are informal merchants). Two years ago she started buying groceries to sell to her neighbors and little by little, with effort and dedication, she was able to buy enough merchandise to start a small store. Now, with the help of her children, she works every day from 6:00 in the morning until 10:00 at night. In order to be able to maintain her store she will use the loan to buy rice, drinks and candy. In the future, she would like to have a mini-market so that she can satisfy all her customer's needs.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, drinks and candy for her store

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia E. is from the village of Nungnungan, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 40 years old. Virginia is married and has 3 school-age children. To make a living, Virginia owns & operates a business venture in the food sector running a food stall business. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling fruits and vegetable in the local community. Virginia has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 12000 PHP a month for these activities.
In 2007, Virginia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virginia has successfully repaid a previous loan  from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 25000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Virginia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: Emily L. is from the village of Molugan, El Salvador City. She is 35 years old and is married. Emily owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling personal products such as ready-to-wear clothes and cosmetics in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month. In 2010, Emily joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Molugan, El Salvador City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer L., 33 years old, has been a farmer for quite a long time now. She is seeking funds to help her buy farm supplies like fertilizers and seeds. She is working very hard to be able to help buy the basic needs of her family.

She needs a loan of PhP 9,000. She will use the loan to improve her harvest.  In that way, she will be able to send her children to school. She said she likes the services of CEVI. She likes it because she has also micro-insurance coverage.

loans.use: purchasing farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Jose Wilfredo

texts.en:
Jose is 22 years old, single and has no children. He lives along with family members in Pedregal Grande in the district of Catacaos to the south of the city of Piura. It is a rural area with a high quantity of arable land in agricultural production. The region is poor and the majority of the homes are constructed of adobe with earthen floors.
Jose's home operates as a center for the sale of a number of different goods. He raises animals for sale and also maintains a small store selling flour, firewood and beer. He has been running the store for three years.
This will be Jose’s first loan with our institution. He doesn’t have any debt outstanding with other institutions. He is requesting a loan in order to purchase additional flour and beer. He finds that the demand for these goods is well above his current supply and he would like to take advantage of the market in order to increase his sales. He hopes that this will further increase his business as his neighbors and friends spread the word about the availability of products at his store.

loans.use: To purchase additional flour and beer

loans.name: Larch

texts.en:
Larch I., 50, is married and resides with her husband and one child in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. I. is a grocery seller and a Christian missionary, earning an income of USD 17 per day. I. has to spend USD 50 on food and USD 20 on other necessary expenses every month.  

I. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase more groceries to stock her store.  In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her fifth loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy more groceries to stock the store

loans.name: Tula

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MOSOC RUNA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Tula; tiene 52 años de edad, y es casada y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa y también trabaja en un hotel desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 2:00 p.m, la socia quiere tener una tienda para vender ropa. La  socia solicita el préstamo para comprar ropa como pantalones, casacas, chompas y polos.


La socia agradece el préstamo solicitado  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Tula is a member of the Communal Bank “Mosoc Runa”, which is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

She is 52 years old, married, and has one child. Tula divides her time between her daily activities and her business of selling clothes. She also works at a hotel from 6am to 2pm. Tula wants to have a store where she can sell clothing. She is requesting a loan in order to buy clothes such as trousers, jackets, sweaters, and polo shirts.

Tula is grateful for the loan she requested and promises to complete her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase trousers, jackets, sweaters, and polo shirts

loans.name: Cristian

texts.es: Cristian , de 24 años de edad, es un hombre soltero y trabajador, que junto a su mama luchan por salir adelante. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de Sanchirio (selva central peruana). A su corta edad, Cristian tiene muchas ambiciones. Hace 4 años que comenzó en la agricultura, pues según afirma desde niño sus padres le enseñaron todas las técnicas de cultivo. Recientemente adquirió su propio terreno agrícola, donde sus sembríos de plátano y café, ya tienen buenas cosechas ya que el dinero que invertía en el arriendo de sus terrenos, ahora los invierte en el cuidado de sus cultivos, cuidándolos constantemente. Es por ello que la cooperativa de su comunidad, le compra su grano de café a buen precio. Pero las aspiraciones de Cristian es estudiar manejo de maquinaria pesada. Es el primer crédito con MFP y agradece la oportunidad que le dio el banco comunal al que ahora pertenece, ya que según afirma, tiene el apoyo que le faltaba para lograr sus objetivos. Es por ello que ya ha pensado invertir el crédito en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico entre potasio y guano (excrementó de animales), los que esparcirá en sus sembríos de café y plátano.
texts.en:
Cristian is 24 years old.  He is a single and hard-working man who, together with his mom, works hard to get ahead in life.  He and his mother live in their own home in the community of Sanchirio (central Peruvian jungle).  At his young age, Cristian has many ambitions.  He started farming 4 years ago since he tells us that his parents had taught him farming techniques since he was a boy.  He recently acquired his own plot of land where he grows bananas and coffee.  He has good harvests since the money that he used to invest in renting his land is now invested in caring for his crops, looking after them constantly.  For this reason the cooperative in his community buys his coffee beans for a good price.  However, Cristian's aspirations are to study the use of heavy machinery.

This is Cristian's first loan with MFP and he is grateful for the opportunity which his community bank has give him since he says that he now has the support to achieve his goals that he was previously lacking.  He plans to invest his loan in buying several sacks of organic fertilizer - potassium and guano (animal excrement) which he will spread on his coffee and banana crops.

loans.use: To buy sacks of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida N. lives in the Kawala neighborhood of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has three children all of whom are in school. Farida has a retail business selling second-hand clothing at the market. She has had this business for eight years, and works seven days a week. She also generates additional income through a restaurant where she employs two girls. 

The main business challenges for Farida are transportation and seasonality. Her goals for her business are to start selling wholesale only, and also to build her own house. Farida lives in a home that she rents with access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, food, and rent

loans.use: TO buy more bales of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
As the saying goes, opportunity knocks only once. Edna E. knows this truth and grabs every opportunity that comes her way. Edna, 43, reached high school and is married to Emelito, a driver. Together they are raising three children, of whom one is in high school, one in elementary, and the other one already working. Together, they live in Pasay City, Philippines.

Edna presently runs a sari-sari (variety) store, in which she sells items that are needed daily by neighbors in her community. Products on her shelves range from soap bars to candies and energy drinks to rice. Having been at least 15 years in business, she knows to pay her dues on time. She also has an excellent reputation with her fellow community partners in CCT* and, most importantly, her customers. Monthly she is able to earn an average of Php 8,800.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a Php 20,000 loan. She intends to use this money to purchase more products for her store, all the more now that the Christmas season is fast approaching. Edna plans to take this opportunity to drive her businesses toward more profitability.

Edna's life is never without challenges, both in her business and personal life. Nonetheless, she stays focused on the opportunities that lie ahead, and not on the failures of yesterday or the worries of today.


*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: additional stock to replenish current inventory

loans.name: Richmei

texts.en:
Richmei B. is from the village of Centro napo Tudela. She is 25 years old. Richmei is single. To make a living, Richmei owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from service based like motor transport services. Richmei has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Richmei joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Richmei has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20000 PHP from GDMPC. Richmei is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to repair existing engine. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Richmei from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing engine

loans.name: Utushike Group

texts.fr: Masika Maombi J.  est entrepreneur, trésorière du groupe Utushike, âgée de 51 ans, mariée, mère de 6 enfants.  Son conjoint est chômeur, sans emploi. La cliente Masika Maombi J.  est vendeuse des  souliers plastics  localement appelés bodaboda  à son domicile et  au long de la rue ambiante. Elle  commença son business  avec son fonds propre reçu de son mari. Avant de joindre cette activité, jadis, elle vendait ambulante des arachides  dans le lieu public, dans les rues commerciales, dans les hôtels, au café resto-bars, etc. Son capital d’affaire fut 100$. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le premier crédit de l’IMF Hekima de 50$ au début de  2010. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner  avec  des nouveaux produits (20 pairs de souliers, 5 pièces des pagnes à revendre, etc.).  En plus, elle ambitionne voir ses enfants  finir leurs études. La cliente Masika Maombi  J.  remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres exclus de banque classique. Le groupe Utushike est constitué de 26 membres. Cette photo fut prise à l’intérieur de la chapelle qui leur sert de lieu des réunions d’affaire.
texts.en: Masika Maombi J. is an entrepreneur, the treasurer of Utushike Group, 51 years old, married and the mother of six children. Her husband is unemployed. Our customer Masika Maombi J. sells plastic shoes (called "bodaboda" in the local language) from her home and along the street. She began her business with working capital that she had received from her husband. Before starting this trade, she was a street peddler, selling groundnuts in public space, shopping streets, hotels, cafés, restaurants, snack bars, etc. Her initial working capital amounted to $100. Later, early 2010, she was granted a loan of $50 by the microfinance institution Hekima. She will use her new loan to buy new merchandise for sale (20 pairs of shoes, 5 units of pagnes, etc.). She told us that her goal is to see her children finish their studies. Our client Masika Maombi J. thanks Hekima for supporting poor people excluded from the traditional banking system. Utushike Group is composed of 26 members. This photo was taken in the chapel, where the group has its business meetings.

loans.use: To buy 20 pairs of shoes and 5 units of pagnes

loans.name: Yolande

texts.fr:
Commerçante de 46 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants dont l'age varie entre 4 et 29 ans, elle se lance dans la vente des chaussures en 1980 pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
Avec le premier , elle a acheté des culottes , habits, sandales et chaussures pour enfants , ses ventes étaient  de 20000frs a 45.000frs par jour.Elle a eu a faire des ventes considérables avec beaucoup plus de bénéfices , elle a épargne, c'est pour cela qu'elle a pense prendre le deuxième prêt pour renforcer et élargir son activité.
Tres entreprenante, elle veut ouvrir des stands de ventes dans des différents endroits et recruter des jeunes femmes a la longue qui vont travailler pour elle.
texts.en:
Yolande N., age 46, is a merchant. She's married and the mother of six children, aged 4 to 29. In 1980, she started selling shoes to provide for her family. She used her first loan to buy panties, clothes, sandals, and children's shoes. Her daily sales amount to XOF 20'000 to 40'000. She had considerable sales and increased profits and savings.

She's seeking a second loan to bolster and expand her business. A real entrepreneur, she wants to open selling booths at various locations in the future, and recruit young women to work for her.

loans.use: To buy children's shoes, panties, and sandals

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
L. Nguyễn Thị (20211040023) is a 31-year-old female living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. L. is the group leader of a 5-member group L. offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual L., they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Tiên Trà 1 - nhóm 07 (nhóm 07).


L. is married and has 1 school-aged child. She owns & operates a business, manufacturing & selling wood products to local businesses and community members. She has been engaged in this business for over 7 years and earns approximately 5.000.000 VND a month.


In 2008, L. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. L. has successfully repaid a previous L. of 2.016.000 VND from SEDA. This previous L. was used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. She is now requesting a new L. of 5.152.000 VND which will be used to purchase additional raw materials to expand her product range. This will be her 4th L. from SEDA. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Ngô Thị P. (0) is a 46-year-old female who is requesting a 4.704.000 VND L. to support her livestock business.


2.  Nguyễn Thị H. (0) is a 34-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND L. to support her livestock business.


3.  Nguyễn Thị H. (0) is a 29-year-old female who is requesting a 6.048.000 VND L. to support her waste management business.


4.  Nguyễn Thị H. (0) is a 24-year-old female who is requesting a 6.048.000 VND L. to support her manufacturing business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this L. was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


L. Nguyễn Thị (20211040023) là 31 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  L. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Tiên Trà 1 - nhóm 07 (nhóm 07).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán các sản phẩm bằng gỗ cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  L. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 7 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, L. kiếm được khoảng 5.000.000 VND.  Vào 2008, L. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  L. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 2.016.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua nguyên liệu thô để sản xuất các sản phẩm bổ sung.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Ngô Thị P. (0) là 46 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.704.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  Nguyễn Thị H. (0) là 34 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  Nguyễn Thị H. (0) là 29 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.048.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là cung cấp dịch vụ quản lý chất thải.


4.  Nguyễn Thị H. (0) là 24 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.048.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh sản xuất.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: to purchase additional raw materials to expand her product range

loans.name: Jose Vicente

texts.es:
Jose Vicente A. N. tiene 33 años, es soltero vive  con el hijo en  el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 1 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  JUNTOS TRABAJADORES AGRICOLAS se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Matilde Esther  pertenece al Cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla de 9 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas de cultivos de cacao, café y naranja.

Jose se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao, café y naranja. Compra sus productos en  Mata de Cacao cada fin de mes y los vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos para los cultivos de cacao, café y naranja.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es mejorar en el trabajo.

Le gusta bailar y ver la televisión.
texts.en:
Jose Vicente A. N. is 33 years old. He is single and lives with his son in the Chillanes canton, province of Bolívar. He has 1 son.
 
The members of the community bank JUNTOS TRABAJADORES AGRICOLAS [Farm Workers Together] are located in the community of Matilde Esther, which belongs to the Chillanes canton. This 9 member bank is dedicated to agricultural work in growing cacao, coffee and oranges.

Jose works in farming cacao, coffee and oranges. He buys his materials in Mata de Cacao at the end of every month and sells his products at the Sunday market in Chillanes.

He is asking for the loan to buy materials for growing cacao, coffee and oranges. The loan will give him financial support to meet his needs. He faces challenges such as pests and disease and weather variation. His dream is to improve his work.

He likes to dance and watch television.

loans.use: to grow cacao, coffee and oranges.

loans.name: Festus

texts.en: This is 43 year-old Festus.  He is married and has 2 children, aged 5 and 14 years. In 1998, Festus established his slipper and shoe business. He started because he wanted to be a responsible man and to provide adequately for his family.  Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about 300,000 from this business every month.  He would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000. Festus requires a loan to buy different types and sizes of slippers and shoes. In the future, Festus plans to establish a similar business in another location for his wife.  He hopes to educate his children to university level. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more plastic slippers for his business

loans.name: La Fe Group

texts.es:
El grupo la Fe lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras una de ellas es Meyling Alelis G. de 20 años quien se dedica al comercio de cosméticos desde hace tres años. El negocio lo inicio con los productos Avon, luego invirtió en otras marcas y su negocio fue creciendo poco a poco. 
Las otras integrantes son Francisca Flores C. de 31 años quien vende productos Avon y Martha Argentina Vásquez quien comercializa ropa desde hace 2 años.
texts.en: The Faith Group is composed of three hard-working and enterprising women. One of the members is Meyling Alelis G., 20, who has been selling cosmetics for the past three years. She started the business with Avon products, then invested in other brands as her business grew bit by bit. The other members of the group are Francisca Flores Calera, 31, who sells Avon products, and Martha Argentina Vásquez who has been selling clothing for two years.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is currently in the business of selling bananas. She is 30 years old and married with eight children, two of whom go to school. Agnes borrowed a loan to stock more bananas to sell. She hopes to expand in the future with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Salem

texts.ar: سالم له من العمر 54 سنة متزوج وهو اب 3 اولاد يعمل في الحدادة الافرنجية (الفرفورجيه)له في عمله 35 سنة يحب عمله وهو مميز به كثيرا حيث انه مقصد لمعظم زبائنه اذ يتميز عمله بالدقة والابتكار والاسعار المدروسة له زبائن من المحيط والجيران وغيره ولكن ما يعيق تقدمه في العمل ومواكبة ما هو جديد من عدة وغيره هو النقص في رأس المال حيث انه يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء عدة جديدة للعمل و شراء مولد كهرباء للعمل وقد واجه بعض الصعوبات المادية ولكن بفضل الخبرة الكبيرة في العمل والرغبة في التقدم ادة الى تحسين الوضع طموح يسعى الى امتلاك عمل خاص ثاني يؤدي الى زيادة المدخول
texts.en: Salem is a 54 year old married father of three children. He works as a blacksmith and has 35 years experience. He loves his work, is very distinguished in it and is the sole service provider for most of his customers. He is known for his precision, innovative work and reasonable prices. He has customers from his local area and his neighbours, but his progress and his ability to keep up new developments is impeded by lack of financial capital. With this loan he wants to purchase new tools to work with, and a new electricity generator. He has faced a number of financial difficulties but due to his vast experience and desire for progress he aspires to own a second business in order to help increase his income.

loans.use: to purchase new tools to work with and a new electricity generator.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en: Brenda is from the village of Sinayawan, Valencia City, Bukidnon. She is 41 years old. Brenda is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Brenda buys and sells different kinds of dried fish in the local community. Brenda has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month for these activities. In 2008, Brenda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Brenda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 16,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Brenda is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional dried fish and squid. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Brenda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional dried fish and squid.

loans.name: Jekadi  B Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe JEKADI  B sont toutes  des femmes mariées qui  vivent à KAPALA , dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs enfants, maris, beaux-parents, belles-sœurs  etc. Elles ont en moyenne 30 ans, au moins 3 enfants. Le village est un chef lieu de commune situé à environ 17 km  de la ville de Sikasso troisième  région administrative de la république du Mali.  
Elles exercent comme  la plupart des femmes du Village de KAPALA, la culture du pois sucré, ce produit est très consommé actuellement par des industriels de la région qui font sa transformation en jus et son exportation. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs activité agricoles, les membres du groupe ont donc décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y’a maintenant deux ans. 
MADIALIA, la présidente du groupe, compte utiliser son prêt de la façon suivante: achat d’un sac d’urée, 2 sacs de complexe céréale et le reste comme frais de labour et de sarclage. Ces intrants seront achetés au grand marché de Sikasso. A la suite des récoltes en fin de campagne, les produits sont stockés pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendus  au grand marché de la même ville en détail (souvent en gros) à divers client.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 60.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the Jekadi B group are all married women who live in Kapala in large, traditional, and extended households with their children, husbands, in-laws, etc. They are on average 30 years old and each have at least 3 children. The town is an administrative centre situated about 17km from the city of Sikasso in the 3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali.
Like most of the women in the town of Kapala, these women farm tiger nuts, a product consumed in large quantities currently by regional industries, which convert it to juice and export it.
With the goal of making their farming businesses more profitable, the group members decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program two years ago.
Madialia, the group president, intends to use her loan in the following manner: to buy one bag of urea and 2 bags of complex cereals, and to use the rest to pay for labour and hoeing. These inputs will be bought at the grand market in Sikasso. Following the harvest at the end of the season, the products are stored for a certain while so that they will be worth more when sold at the grand market in Sikasso and at retail (often in bulk) to various customers.
She foresees realizing an average profit of 60,000 FCFA, which will be used to pay the interest on the loan and to provide for her family's daily needs.

loans.use: To buy farming inputs and pay for labour costs.

loans.name: Santos Adan

texts.es:
Santos tiene 54 años, el vive con su esposa en una zona rural del distrito de Cayalti, el cuenta con casa propia, que se encuentra aproximadamente a una hora de la ciudad  de Chiclayo

El cuenta con un terreno agrícola en la zona donde reside. Allí el suele dedicarse a labores agrícolas,realizando una cosecha continua, así como también ala comercialización de animales menores, los cuales al obtener un tamaño y peso ideal los comercializa, el  cuenta con varios años dedicándose a estas actividades y debido a ello conoce mucho del manejo de los negocios, con estas actividades se encarga de sacar adelante a la economía de su familia. 

Santos  desea adquirir fertilizantes para poder asegurarse una buena producción de su cultivo y comprar alimento balanceado para sus animales por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 3000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Santos  es una persona bastante hogareña y estimada por las personas de su comunidad.
texts.en:
Santos is 54 years old and lives with his wife in a rural area of the Cayalti district.  He owns his own home, located approximately one hour from the city of Chiclayo.  

He has farm land in the area where he lives. There, he usually works the farm, which yields a continuous harvest.  In addition, he raises small animals that he sells when they reach the ideal weight and size.  Because he has devoted several years to these activities, he knows a lot about business management.  These activities have been responsible for improving his family’s finances.

Santos wishes to purchase fertilizer in order to assure a good yield of his crop and buy feed for his animals.  In order to help him achieve his goal, he believes a loan request of 3000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa is appropriate. Santos is a quite a home-loving person and respected by the people in his community.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and feed for his animals.

loans.name: Sanda

texts.fr:
Femme célibataire  âgée de 51ans, mère  d‘un enfant  âgé est comprise 26ans, elle a un niveau terminal e. en 2000,  par manque de soutient  elle avait préféré de  se lancer dans la vente des fruits de saisons avec un capital de 150.000frs. Ses recettes sont 15000F à 20.000F et elle vend au marché total qui est l’un des plus grands marché de la place.

Avec le prêt de HOPE, elle veut renforcer le stock de ses fruits tel que des pamplemousses, des mandarines, des citrons, des bigarades.

Pour le bien de sa famille, elle compte construire une maison. Très gentille, son souhait est de toujours satisfaire ses clients en leur offrant des meilleurs prix.
texts.en:
A single woman of 51, the mother of one child of 26, she completed the last year of high school. In 2000, since she lacked support, she decided to get into selling seasonal fruit with a working capital of 150,000 francs. Her receipts total 15,000 to 20,000 francs and she sells her goods in the Total market, one of the biggest local markets. 

With the loan from HOPE, she wants to expand her stock of fruit such as grapefruit, tangerines, lemons and bitter oranges. For the well-being of her family, she intends to build a house. 

Very pleasant, her wish is always to satisfy her customers by offering them the best prices.

loans.use: to buy grapefruits and tangerines.

loans.name: Zviad

texts.en:
Zviad comes from the village of Kobuleti, seaside of Georgia. He is 30 years old, married and lives with his big family: his wife Natia, two sons (5 and 1 year old) and his parents. 

The family earns a living with a family agricultural business. In particular, they own 4,000 sq. meters of citrus garden and 7,000 sq. meters of maize cornfield. Zviad became involved in the family business seven years ago. Harvested corn and citruses are sold locally to the retailers. The total average monthly income of the family is 600 Laris. 

With the requested credit, Zviad plans to purchase fertilizers for the citrus garden and cornfield. After fertilizing, the family will get more and better quality corn and citrus. The family will sell more products for a higher price, which will cause significant increase in the family’s income. 

Zviad plans to use the increase in profit for renovation of the house.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Maria Virgilia

texts.es:
María, se dedica a la elaboración de artesanía de jarcia, vive con su esposo y tres hijos, inicio este negocio al recibir capacitaciones, aprendió a hacer las artesanías de jarcia, ella se ha dedicado a enseñarle a su familia.
Actualmente ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de un pedido en grande de mercadería entre ellas hamacas, lazos, matatas, su inconveniente es no tener el efectivo, por esta razón solicita el préstamo para cubrir el gasto.
Su objetivo es que el negocio crezca para ayudar a sus hijos y proveer para ellos todo lo necesario.
texts.en:
Maria has a business making handicrafts out of string.  She lives with her husband and 3 children.  She started this business after receiving training where she learned to make crafts out of string, and she is teaching this skill to her family.  

Now she is requesting a loan to pay for a big order of merchandise such as hammocks, ties and string tote bags.  The problem is she doesn't have the cash, so for this reason she is requesting a loan to cover the bill.

Her goal is to grow her business so that she can help her children and proviD. them with everything they need.

loans.use: to buy hammocks, ties and string tote bags for her business

loans.name: Acela

texts.es:
Acela es una madre de familia de 44 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia,  cuenta con servicios sólo de luz, ubicada en el distrito de La Matanza que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Toda esta zona sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

Acela se dedica a la elaboración, venta de chicha de jora (es una bebida rica elaborada a base de maíz y  muy consumida en el norte del Perú) y crianza de aves de corral, estas actividades los realiza desde hace 2 años, ya que es una costumbre que ha pasado de generación en generación. Últimamente se ha incrementado las ventas de la chicha de jora, lo que le ha favorecido para poder incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  También comercializa aves de corral, lo que le permite ayudarse con otro ingreso.

Teniendo la oportunidad de crecer Acela a solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar mayor cantidad de harina de maíz para la elaboración de chicha de jora, utensilios y alimento balanceado para sus aves, con la finalidad de obtener mayores ganancias y así sus clientes aumenten, para solventar el crédito otorgado y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Acela is a 44 year old wife and mother. She lives with her husband and children in her own house, which only has electricity. It is located in the district of La Matanza, which belongs to the departament of Piura.  Throughout this area, people work in farming, cattle and artisanal crafts.

Acela works making and selling chicha de jora (a delicious drink made from corn and very popular in northern Peru). She also raises poultry. She has done these activities for 2 years. It is a tradition that has been passed from generation to generation. Lately her sales of chicha de jora have increased, which has helped her increase her income and improve her family's quality of life.  She also sells her poultry, which helps her with another income.

With an opportunity to grow, Acela has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2000 nuevos soles  to buy a large quantity of corn meal to make chicha de jora, as well as utensils and balanced feed for her birds. Her goal is to obtain more earnings and increase her clientele to pay off the loa and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more corn meal to make chicha de jora, as well as utensils and feed for her birds.

loans.name: Aykaz

texts.ru:
Айказу 59 лет, он живет в деревне Ддмашен, Севанского района, вместе с женой. Сыновья Айказa живут со своими семьями, отдельно от родителей. Айказ окончил Севанское проф. техническое училище. 
20 лет Айказ проработал в сельском совхозе механизатором, а начиная с 1993 года он занимается сельским хозяйством на собственной ферме. Жена Айказа помогает ему и, благодаря совместным усилиям, они разводят коров, овец, поросят и кур. Также Айказу принадлежит небольшой участок земли, на котором он выращивает корм для своих домашних животных, а недостаток корма закупает у своих односельчан. Полученную сельскохозяйственную продукцию (молочную продукцию, говядину, баранину, свинину, яйца и курятину) Айказ продает на Разданском городском рынке, а полученный доход использует на содержание своей семьи. 
Айказу необходим кредит на сумму 500,000 драм для приобретения недостающего корма и для ремонта своей косилки. Полученный доход Айказ и его жена намереваются потратить на завершение строительства своего дома.
texts.en: Aykaz is 59 years old and lives in the Ddmashen village in the Sevan district together with his wife.  Aykaz's sons live together with their families separately from the parents.  Aykaz finished a Sevan professional technical college.  He spent twenty years working as a mechanic in the agricultural collective and then started his own farm in 1993.  Aykaz's wife helps him, and thanks to their joint efforts, they breed cows, sheep, pigs and chickens.  Aykaz also owns a small plot of land, where he grows feed for his domestic animals and buys the remaining feed from his neighbors.  He sells his agricultural products (milk products, beef, lamb, pork, eggs and poultry) at the Razdanskiy city market and uses resulting profits to support his family.  Aykaz needs a loan in the sum of 500,000 dram for the purchase needed animal feed and to repair his lawn mower.  He and his wife intend to use the obtained income to finish the construction of their house.

loans.use: to purchase additional animal feed and to repair a lawn mower

loans.name: Ndanu

texts.en:
Ndanu is a committed business woman, aged 42. She is married and blessed with four children. 

For the last 11 years, she has been selling tomatoes to bring up her family. In the next 5 years, she wants to become the distributor of tomatoes in her region. Her dream is to buy a car for transporting tomatoes. She is requesting a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy tomatoes.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Perfect Peach Group

texts.en:
Anita is 31 years old and a single parent of a child. She lives in Takoradi, a coastal city noted for its thriving fishing activities. She describes herself as a hardworking woman.

Anita is the leader of the Perfect Peace Trust Bank group. As the leader of the group, she ensures that all members attend regular meetings and meet their repayment schedule.

For the past six years Anita has sold smoked fish in her community market. She is excited to be receiving a portion of this 1,700 GHS loan from SAT, which she will use to purchase larger quantities of smoked fish to expand her business.

One of Anita’s dreams is to get married and work harder to support her child in school.

loans.use: to purchase smoked fish in bulk.

loans.name: Carlos Rolando

texts.es: El Señor Carlos labora como maestro constructor, lleva trabajando así por más de 5 años, tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar, ha demostrado a lo largo de los años que se desempeña muy bien en su trabajo. El comenzó como peón y ayudante de albañil, poco a poco a ido progresando y hoy en día es ya un maestro constructor, haciendo trabajos de levantamiento de muros, encofrados y ferrería en general; él va a invertir el crédito kiva para invertirlo en otro negocio y es la venta de galletas, golosinas y gaseosas, arreglando también su puesto de madera en su casa. El Sr. Carlos tiene el sueño de tener en el futuro una bodega bien abastecida en donde vender, será su mayor negocio y entrada, por que desea mejorar su condición laboral y con su trabajo como maestro constructor y su espíritu emprendedor lo realizará. El ya es un ejemplo de emprendimiento para sus hijos. Carlos esta muy agradecido por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sr. Carlos works as a master builder and has been in this profession for more than five years. He has two children who are of school age. Carlos has demonstrated over the years that he performs very good work. He began as a laborer and masonry assistant. Over time he has progressed gradually and has now reached the level of master builder. The services he provides include raising walls, formwork, and general foundry work.

He will invest this Kiva loan in another business. Carlos will sell cookies, candy, and sodas so he plans to build a wooden stand at his house. In the future, he dreams of having a well-stocked store where he can sell and become the largest business so that he can improve his working conditions. With his job as a master builder and his entrepreneurial spirit, Carlos will be able to accomplish his goal. Already he is an example of entrepreneurship for his children.

Carlos is very grateful for the support that has been provided.

loans.use: to start another business selling cookies, candy, and sodas.

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
Abdul, 45, is a hardworking man who started his retail business 21 years ago. He sells food and has a grocery store near his home in Agsu where he lives with his three children and wife. 

This is his second loan from AqroInvest in the amount of 1500 Azerbaijanian Manat (AZN). With his previous loan, Abdul bought products for his store with the intent of increasing his business. His main goal is expand his business and in this way to provide a better life for his family. Abdul is happy with the loan and promises to complete his payments.

loans.use: to buy new products for general store

loans.name: Gulnar's Group

texts.en:
Gulnar is the leader of this group. She is 49 and married to a cattle breeder. Together with her husband she has three sons and four daughters. The youngest son is eight (he goes to school) and the youngest daughter is just three years old. In order to earn money for their livelihood the family cultivates agricultural products.  

Gulnar sells apples, pears, potatoes and wheat. The price for apples and pears is 15 soms per kilogram and a kilo of potatoes costs 5 soms. Her monthly profit from this activity is about 5000 soms. With money received from the loan she plans to purchase wheat seeds to grow more wheat. In the near future she wants to finish their house construction.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase wheat seeds.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en: Isaac is married and blessed with one child who is in school. For the last ten years, he has been selling clothes to support his family. His potential customers are his local residents. Isaac has requested a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to add stock of clothes for resale. In the next 5 years, he wants to own a boutique. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to adopt the culture of saving.

loans.use: To add stock of clothing.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina D. 35 años D. edad, hace 10 años se casó con Silverio. Esta pareja tuvo 7 hijos y actualmente vive con 5, siendo el más pequeño el D. 2 años. Catalina y su numerosa familia viven en armonía en una casa propia en el distrito D. San Luis D. Shuaro. Esta mujer trabajadora y ejemplar madre, desD. niña se dedica a las labores del campo. Cuenta con parcelas D. terrenos que sus padres y la propia comunidad les brindaron. 
En esas tierras cultiva plátanos, café, yuca, pituca y maíz. Por la variedad D. productos, Catalina supo negociar cada mes sus productos, D. ese modo mantiene, alimenta y educa a sus menores hijos.
Por su parte, Silverio y sus hijos mayores apoyan en la agricultura y comercialización D. los productos, los que trasladan desD. su distrito hasta la ciudad D. La Merced, a donD. llegan compradores conocidos y representantes D. empresas cafetaleras D. la región. “Nunca falta el trabajo en mi comunidad, a veces mi esposo, mis hijos y yo jornaleamos en otras tierras”, menciona. Catalina espera abrir un negocio en su casa, vendiendo productos D. primera necesidad. Así también piensa instalar más cuartos en su hogar, para ello deberá invertir y continuar con sus labores. Con su apoyo, ella podrá acceder a su préstamo número 5 D. MFP, por esa razón se compromete a  ser puntual en sus pagos. Además comenta sentirse contenta con su banco comunal, por el incentivo al progreso que genera el trabajo en grupo. Con el dinero del crédito invertirá 800 soles en la compra D. abonos. Lo que reste lo destinará al pago D. personal para la época D. cosecha.
texts.en:
Catalina, age 35, married Silverio 10 years ago. This couple had 7 children, of whom 5 currently live with them. The youngest is 2 years old. Catalina and her large family live in harmony in a home that they own in the district of San Luis D. Shuaro. This hardworking woman and exemplary mother has worked in agriculture since she was a young girl. She owns some crop fields that both her parents and her community have given her.

On these fields, she cultivates bananas, coffee, manioc, taro, and corn. Because of the variety of produce that she grows, she has been able to negotiate her products every month, thus helping her support, feed, and educate her youngest children.

Silverio and the older children help out with the farming and selling of their produce, which they transport from their district to the city of La Merced, where well-known buyers and regional coffee company representatives come together. "There is never a shortage of work in my community. Sometimes my husband, my children, and I work as day laborers on other fields," she mentions. Catalina hopes to open a business in her house, where she plans to sell basic need items. She also hopes to build more rooms in her home, but in order to do this, she must invest and continue working. With your support, she will be able to obtain her fifth loan from MFP, which is why she commits to being punctual in making her repayments. Additionally, she states that she feels happy with her communal bank because of the incentives for progress that group work generates. She will invest 800.00 PEN of this loan in purchasing fertilizer. She will use the rest to pay for agricultural laborers during the harvest season.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fertilizer and to hire farm workers.

loans.name: Meoun

texts.en:
Meoun, 58, is married and resides with her husband in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. Meoun is a farmer.

Meoun is requesting a loan of 500 USD to purchase a motorbike for the family's use. By doing so, her family will be able to decrease the expenses for public transportation. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for the family's use

loans.name: Ethel

texts.en:
Ethel 24, is a single woman who lives in a rental house that has both electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is rent. For the past six months, Ethel has operated a business selling clothing materials and hand bags, selling wholesale to her neighbours and passersby. She faces the major challenge of high transportation costs in her enterprise.

Having joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business, Ethel is requesting a loan of Kshs 20,000 to purchase bales of clothing materials and hand bags. She dreams of establishing a boutique business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase bales of cloth materials and hand bags.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is a 29-year-old businessman who offers cleaning services to residents in Mombasa. He is married and has been operating this business for the past two years and he is doing great in the business. 

He was introduced to KADET by one of our staff and this marks his first borrowing to finance his business. He plans to purchase cleaning machines and washing detergents for his business and use the anticipated profits to build capital. 

He hopes to realize more profits from his business and have a settled future.

loans.use: to purchase cleaning machines and washing detergents.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 36 years old and a businessman.  He is married to Jennifer. They are blessed with three children aged 13, 8 and 4 years respectively.  Simon has been in private vehicle transport service for the past ten years with a monthly income of KES 15,000 which he uses to support his family.
