He is applying for his first loan with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Simon will use the loan to service his vehicle. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and venture into mixed crop farming.

loans.use: To service his vehicle

loans.name: Maria Alicia

texts.en:
Maria Alicia is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children.

Maria Alicia has a retail shop that sells clothing like t-shirts, blouses, and underwear. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy stocks of clothing, like shirts and blouses, to sell.

Maria Alicia is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy stocks of clothing, like shirts and blouses, to sell.

loans.name: Jonadamu

texts.en: Jonadamu, age 34, is married to a businesswoman. They have two children between one and seven. The oldest attends school. Professionally, Jonadamu is a carpenter, which he is very interested to specialize in even though he has been running a small boutique for the past years. With this new loan, he wants to buy table saws and expects to use the profits to build a house.

loans.use: to buy table saws.

loans.name: Gs San Jorge Group

texts.es:
La señora  María  de 36 años de edad vive con su pareja  en unión libre  y   tiene hijos, tiene casa propia,  se dedica desde hace 8 años a la venta y elaboración de desayunos, almuerzos, cenas ,todo lo relacionado con alimentación.
Doña María su negocio está ubicado en la venta al sur francisco Morazán, sus ventas son en el comedor san Jorge, por la mañana y por la tarde. Ella es conocida por los amigos y vecinos como una mujer luchadora, su lugar de residencia esta ubicado en aldea la venta al sur de Honduras.
Doña María y su grupo solidario esta solicitando 5, 000.00 lempiras cada uno para compra  de maíz, carnes, condimentos, arroz y otros . Con las ganancias y el apoyo de este préstamo.
 Doña maría desea seguir  invirtiendo en su negocio al igual que su demás compañeros de grupo  quienes  elaboran, tortillas, venden ropa, hacen tamales,  ellas  son  Doña Edis, Doña Adela  y Doña Marina,  Doña Ana y Doña Dora, todas residente en el municipio la Venta, al sur de Honduras,  quienes desean salir adelante y seguir mejorando sus ingresos.
Doña María su sueño es seguir obteniendo mejores clientes y con las ganancias mejorara sus negocios para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. Doña Dora y Doña Ana no aparecen en la foto ya que tenian asuntos personales y de sus hijos que atender.
San Lorenzo, Honduras – Marzo 2014
texts.en:
Maria, 36, lives with her common-law husband and children in her own house.  For eight years she has been making and selling breakfast, lunch, dinner and everything related to the food business.

Maria's business is located in La Venta in the southern part of the department of Francisco Morazán.  She sells her food in the San Jorge diner in the morning and in the evening.  She is known by her friends and neighbors as a determined woman.  She lives in the village of La Venta in southern Honduras.

The members of the communal bank and María are each requesting 5,000 HNL to buy corn, meat, seasonings, rice and other items.  

Maria wants to continue investing in her business, just like the other members who make tortillas, sell clothing and make tamales.  They are Edis, Adela, Marina, Ana and Dora; and they all live in La Venta in southern Honduras.  They want to get ahead and improve their incomes.

Maria's dream is to continue attracting more customers and earn enough to improve her family's lifestyle.  Dora and Ana do not appear in the photo because they had to attend to personal issues.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - March, 2014

loans.use: To buy corn, meats, seasonings, rice and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase capital

loans.name: Herbert

texts.en:
Herbert is 36 years old, married with two childen aged 4 years and 7 years. He also supporting seven relatives. Six of them are in secondary school and one is completing his first degree at University.

He has been doing the business of printing stationery in the last 10 years. The business is located in the city center on Kampala. He supplies offices and small organisations.

He wants a loan of US $ 1200 to be able to buy inputs in bulk to be able to minimize on the cost of production and supply big institutions.

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Hélène

texts.en: Hélène is 60 years old. She is married and a mother of three children. Hélène started her business in 1997. She produces purified water and provides it to her intermediary clients, who sell it to the population. Due to the high demand of purified water from the community, Hélène needs a loan of $1,000. She wants to buy a generator to have a permanent and stabilized power for consistent production. She also wants to buy two faucets and filters. Hélène is a strong woman dedicated to her business. She wakes up at 1:00 am every morning to work. By producing a lot of purified water, Hélène contributes significantly in the fight against diseases spread through contaminated water in her community.

loans.use: To purchase a generator, faucets, and filters.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Business Description

Julio has 30 years of experience in business. He started out selling seafood, but he had to switch products because of increasing competition. By his own initiative, he decided to start selling fruit. With this product, things have gone very well for him, and little by little he has been able to make some improvements to his home. He works every day of the week from 5 a.m. until 3 p.m.

Loan Use

This loan will be invested in the purchase of fruits, since he is a little low on capital. He will stock his business with a variety of fruits, and in that way give better service to his customers.

Personal Information

Julio is 64 years old. He has 4 children who are adults and who help him with his needs. His wife works as a seamstress, and earns income for that activity. Julio's desire is to be able to start constructing his little house out of concrete, since now it is made of cane, and in the winter time it gets damaged. He knows that, with this investment, he will be able to realize his dream.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Descripción del Negocio

Julio tiene una experiencia de 30 años en la actividad del comercio. Se inicio vendiendo mariscos. Pero tuvo que ir cambiando de productos ya que la competencia iba aumentando. Por iniciativa propia decide comenzar a vender frutas. Con este producto le ha ido muy bien que poco a poco ha ido realizando algunos cambios a su domicilio. Trabaja todos los días de la semana en horario de 5 a.m. hasta las 3 p.m.

Uso del Préstamo

El crédito lo invertirá en compra de frutas ya que esta un poco bajo de capital. Surtir su negocio con variedad de frutas y de esta manera darle un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

Información Personal

Julio tiene 64 años. Tiene 4 hijos los cuales ya son adultos y lo ayudan en lo que el necesita. Su esposa se dedica a la costura teniendo ingresos por esta actividad. El deseo de Julio es poder comenzar a construir su casita de cemento ya que actualmente es de caña. Y en época de invierno sufre sus estragos. Sabe con la inversión que realizara podrá cumplir sus sueños.

loans.use: To buy a variety of fruits

loans.name: Tauese

texts.en:
Tauese P. is the mother of seven kids. Most of her children are in school. Her husband is unemployed, and she is the only breadwinner in the family.
She is a good tailor and , and wants to purchase another sewing machine. She has been involved in the South Pacific Business Programme for unemployed women for some time now and used her first loan of $750.00 to purchase a sewing machine. She is now on her 6th loan of $3000ST which was used for home improvements and to help purchase equipment and agricultural chemicals for her husbands’ plantation, which also helps her in her loan repayments. She is very thankful and proud of her involvement in the program.

loans.use: Business expansion & home improvement

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena is married with two children – a 9-year-old son and a 6-year-old daughter. She lives in Kherson and owns two vending facilities in the central city market where she sells baked goods, sweets and chocolate. Yelena has been in this trade for 8 years. Her turnover capital has doubled since she started her small business.

Yelena has a perfect credit history with Nadiya Ukraine. She has fully repaid all of her loans without any delinquencies. Yelena believes that a loan of $1000 will help her increase her working capital and profits as a result. She wants to purchase different varieties of candy to sell, increase the number of products she offers and expand her marketing area. Yelena has become a successful entrepreneur through hard work and dedication which we believe will help her succeed in the future as well.

loans.use: Yelena would like to increase the working capital for her small bakeries.

loans.name: Antonia Mota

texts.en:
Antonia is 38 years old and has four children (ages of 20, 18, 13 and 12).  They all attend school.

Antonia sells vegetables and ripe fruits, a business that has been her principal source of income for the past four years. She is requesting a loan of $225 to purchase more stock of vegetables and fruits. This will enable her to supply more customers, earn more income, and better support her family.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and ripe fruits for her produce business

loans.name: Albertina

texts.es:
Senora Albertina has one son who attends school. Her son has been her reason for living, She has worked very hard to give him a stable family and an education for his future. For 19 years Albertina has been selling dyed rope. She longed to find a better opportunity to care for her son and provide him with a better quality of life. This business is one of the most well recognized in the area. Her sales have grown over the years, allowing Albertina to expand her business and build her savings slowly.

She has worked with Ceprodel for three years. She is very satisfied with the loans she has received, as they've enabled her to build her business and meet the daily needs of her customers. She has repaid already 20 micro loans with Ceprodel.

La señora Albertina es una mujer acompañada y madre de un hijo el cual se encuentra en la edad escolar. Su hijo ha sido su razón de vivir y por el es que ella se ha esforzado, brindándole así una familia estable y una educación para el futuro de el.

Desde hace diecinueve años Albertina se dedica a la venta de mecates, sin embargo logro encontrar una mejor oportunidad en su camino y poder cuidar de su hijo, proporcionándole así una mejor vida.

Este negocio es uno de los mas reconocido en el occidente, sus ventas han incrementado al paso de los años, ya que ella ha ido ampliando su negocio e incrementando su capital poco a poco.

Albertina trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace Tres años y se siente muy satisfecha con los créditos otorgados pues les han sido brindados en el momento oportuno, ayudando así a suplir las necesidades del negocio y satisfacer a diario a sus clientes. Ella tiene un record de Veinte créditos.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO INVEST IN HER BUSINESS AND CONTINUE TO GROW HER SALES AND PROFITS, PROVIDING A BETTER QUALITY OF LIFE FOR HER FAMILY AND SAVING FOR HER SON'S EDUCATION.

loans.name: Constantina Nubia

texts.es:
Constantina has worked selling basic grains in the Estación market in the city of León with much strength and sacrifice since she was 12 years old. According to Constantina, her business has grown little by little throughout the year, improving the standard of living of her humble family.

6 months ago, Mrs. M. decided to invest in her business so she turned to Ceprodel, who granted her loans to purchase basic grains such as rice, beans and corn. Nowadays, thanks to Ceprodel, she has been successful in improving her business of selling grains and in addition, has been able to support her household, giving her family a better life. She has had four loans with Ceprodel.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

La venta de granos básicos es el negocio al que con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio se dedica la señora Constantina desde hace 12 años en el mercado la Estación de la ciudad de León. Según comenta su negocio ha ido creciendo poco a poco a medida que han pasado los años y por tal razón ha mejorado el nivel de vida de su humilde familia

Desde hace 6 meses la señora M. se decidió invertir en el negocio y para esto recurrió a Ceprodel quien le brindo créditos para la compra de granos básicos como arroz, frijoles y maíz. Hoy en día, gracias a Ceprodel ha logrado mejorar su negocio de venta de granos y además ha logrado mantener su hogar dándole un mejor nivel de vida a los suyos. Su record crediticio es de 4 créditos con Ceprodel.

loans.use: Purchase of basic grains.

loans.name: Hadžira

texts.en: Hadžira was born in  1950 and she is married. She is from Moštre, a suburb of Visoko. Her husband is a pensioner and his monthly pension  is 370 KM. They have two children, 31 and 37 years old. This is her second loanof 1500 KM and she wants to invest it in agriculture. Hadžira  wants to expand  her business in order to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: Invest in agriculture.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy works as a seamstress in a workshop. She also makes ‘rellenos de papa’ (meat-stuffed potato balls) and desserts, food which her mother sells in markets in Rió Seco, El Alto City. These two activities are her main source of income, which she puts towards caring for her mother and her two young daughters. She lives in Zona Villa Yunguyo in El Alto City. She requires this loan to purchase a sewing machine so that she can become an independent worker and have her own sewing workshop, her own mini-business. This is her first loan with Impro and the evaluation has approved her application, given her experience and her determination to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Nancy trabaja como costurera en un taller particular; también elabora rellenos de papa y postre, comida que comercializa su madre en la ferias populares de la zona de Rió Seco de la Ciudad de El Alto. Estas dos actividades son su principal fuente de ingresos con las que mantiene a su Madre y a sus dos pequeñas hijas que dependen de ella; vive en la Zona Villa Yunguyo de la Ciudad de El Alto. El crédito requiere para comprar maquinaria de costura para de esa forma independizarse y tener su propio taller de costura como microempresaria independiente. Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada permite otorgarle el préstamo, en vista de su experiencia y de su afán de superación.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine so that she can become independent and work for herself

loans.name: Bisaboat

texts.ru:
Bisaboat S. has opened her shop by the bus station in order to attract a lot of clients. She sells cigarettes, bubble gum and matches. She has a lot of experience in sales. Before opening her own store Bisaboat was a saleswoman in a large department store. With time she learned a lot about commerce and started her own business. Bisaboat knows which goods are popular and will sell in large quantities. When she herself is away from the store, either buying more goods or due to personal reasons, her mother takes care of the store for her. Her mother also helps her expand this business and when Bisaboat was short on money her mother helped solve her financial problems. But her mother is old now and instead of borrowing fm her, Bisaboat decided to turn to Microinvest and has not regretted it.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Шокирова Бисабоат открыла точку возле остановки для привлечения множества клиентов. Она торгует сигаретами, жвачками и спичками. Она хорошо знает свое дело. Перед тем как открыть свое дело, она была продавщицей в большом магазине. Со времен она научилась коммерции и начала свое дело. Она знает, какие товары покупают в большом виде. Когда она отлучается- ездит за товаром или по своим делам, ее замещает мама. Мама помогает в развитии бизнеса, когда у нее не хватало денег мама помогала решить эту финансовую проблему. Теперь, когда мама состарилась, она решилась обратиться в Микроинвест и не пожалела.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of beauty products, kitchen items and other goods for a small business

loans.name: Albertina Paulino

texts.pt:
Albertina is 36 years old and was born in the district of Namaacha, a district bordering with Swaziland. She is divorced and the mother of 4 children. Her oldest is 15 and is in the 9th grade, her second is 13 and in the 6th grade, her third is 9 and in the 3rd grade, and her last is 22 months.

Albertina supports only her family of 4 children, but sometimes she sends money to her mother to help her with the bills. Albertina studied until the 6th grade and stopped because of the war and because her family did not have the ability to send her to the city to study. In 1993 she left the district of Namaacha with her marriage and went to the district of Boane where she lives today. She lives in her own home. She is an instructor in a small school in Mafuiane, an administrative post in the district of Boane, with an indeterminate contract. She has worked 16 years at this school.

Albertina learned in this same school accumulating experience and was later enabled to improve her teaching techniques. She has a monthly salary of 2,500MT and saves 1,500MT. This is Albertina's second loan in her life and the first through Kiva. The first was with GGLS and was obtained through the group system. She discovered Hluvuku from some conversations with neighbors and friends. She has the dream to see her house finished and her children educated.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

Albertina tem 36 anos e nasceu no distrito de Namaacha, distrito fronteriço com Swazilandia. Divorciada e mãe de 4 filhos com idades entre 15 anos o primeiro e estuda na 9ªClasse, 13 anos o segundo e estuda na 6ª classe, 9 anos o terceiro e estuda na 3ªclasse e 1 ano e 10 meses o ultimo. Albertina sustenta apenas a sua família que são os seus 4 filhos as vezes manda algum dinheiro para sua mãe para ajudar nas despesas. Albertina estudou até 6ªclasse e parou por causa da guerra e por não ter condições a sua família para lhe deixar na cidade para estudar. Albertina saiu do distrito de Namaacha através do seu casamento até o distrito de Boane onde vive até hoje em 1993. Vive numa casa própria. Albertina é monitora numa escolinha em Mafuiane um dos posto administrativo do distrito de Boane com um contracto indeterminado e trabalha a 16 anos nesta escola. Albertina aprendeu nesta mesma escola acumulando experiencia e mais tarde foi capacitada para melhorar as técnicas de ensino. Tem um salário mensal de 2500,00mt e poupas 1500,00mt. Para Albertina este é o segundo empréstimo na vida e primeiro na Hluvuku e Kiva, o primeiro foi na GGLS obtido no sistema de grupos. Albertina conheceu a Hluvuku a partir de conversas com vizinhos e amigas. Albertina tem como grande sonho ver a sua casa concluída e formados os seu filhos.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Timotea

texts.es:
Mrs Timotea is a member of the Communal Bank Nuevo Norizone in the Centro Poblado of Caritamaya in the sector of Marquiri, in the district of Acora, in the Province and Region of Puno.

She is dedicated to the fattening of livestock (preferably cattle). Previous loans were used to increase her capital and economic gains, thus bringing about more work with these loans. With this loan of S/. 500.00 Peruvain Soles ($200.00), which will be repaid in four months, she will purchase 2 better cows in order to fatthen them and sell them within the next three months at the livestock market of Acora.

She is vey happy, and is little by little increasing her capital and living a better life than previously. She no longer is lacking money to purchase provisions for cooking. She is currently 55 years old, completed primary school, married and is a mother of four children, as takes care of a niece who is dependent on her. Her greatest wish is to live happily, to expand her business and to proviD. an educaiton for her niece.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Timotea, es socia del Banco Comunal Nuevo Horizonte del Centro Poblado D. Caritamaya sector Marquiri, del distrito D. Acora, Provincia y Región D. Puno. Ella se dedica al engorD. D. ganado ovino mejorado, con los préstamos anteriores logró incrementar su capital e ingresos económicos, lo cual sigue motivando trabajar con los préstamos. Con este préstamo D. S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que será pagado en cuatro meses, comprará 2 ovinos mejorados para el engorD. y venderá D. aquí D. tres meses en la feria D. ganado D. Acora. Ella, está muy contenta, poco a poco está incrementando su capital y también esta viviendo mejor que antes, ya que no le falta dinero para comprar sus víveres para la cocina. Actualmente ella tiene 55 años D. edad, estudió hasta primaria completa, madre D. cuatro hijos, es casada y a su responsabilidad solo está una nieta. Por ello su deseo granD. es vivir feliz, ampliar su negocio y estudie su nieta.

loans.use: Purchasing of livestock, cattle.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María T. G., 36 years old, lives in the Pacanal Uno hamlet. Her current occupation is agriculture (production of Maxan), which is considered a very productive activity and she dreams having larger harvests such as maxan, coffee and bananas. She is known in the community for her collaboration, participation and the work that she does. María is a person that will be able to, with her efforts, realize her dream of have more products. Previously, she worked doing domestic work to be able to work in the house and also traveled to the farms to pick coffee. She and her family suffered, especially in the winter, which is why she came up with the idea of becoming involved in the cultivation of maxan. However, she doesn't have the necessary capital to buy the maxan seeds and for the labor needed. To continue generating more income she saw the necessary to come to the offices of Asociación ASDIR to request a loan to be able to improve the living conditions of her family as well as to be able to generate sources of work.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

En el Caserio Pacanal Uno se encuentra ubicado doña María T. G. de 36 años de edad, unida, ocupación actual se dedica en la Agricultura (Cosecha de Maxan) el cual se considera una actividad muy productiva, porque dia a dia sueña con tener cosechas mas grandes como cultivos de maxan, café, banano, etc. Se le conoce en la la comunidad por su colaboracion, participacion y por su trbajo que realiza, Maria es una persona que dia a dia con sus esfuerzos podra realizar sus sueños de tener mas cultivos, en los tiempos pasados se dedicaba en oficios domésticos para realizar trabajos en la casa, por otra parte viajaba en las fincas en cortes de café, sufrieron con su familia especialmente en tiempo de invierno, por lo tanto surgió ésta idea para dedicarse en siembra de cultivos de maxan por la misma razón no cuenta con el el capital suficiente para comprar semillas de maxan y para la mano de obra para seguir generando mayor ingreso se vio en la necesidad de acudir en las oficinas de la Asociación ASDIR para solicitar un crédito para poder dar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia, tambien para poder generar fuentes de trabajo.

loans.use: Purchase of Maxan seeds

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose S. sells soya beans at Bantama in Elmina. Rose has received no formal education. She is married and has 1 child. Her husband is an electrical repairer. Rose has been selling soya beans since 1998. She is responsible for helping her husband in the payment of the children's school fees and other utility bills. Her loan will be used to increase her capital to buy more soya beans for sale to meet the demand of her ever increasing customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest in the business to increase sales, which will eventually increase her income.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to increase her capital to buy more soya beans for sale to meet the demand of her ever increasing customers.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana tiene 59 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos.  Tiene muchos deseos D. trabajar, la necesidad D. solventar a su familia, junto a su esposo durante muchos años, a surgido en ella la voluntad D. esforzarse cada día más, y lo viene haciendo desD. hace más D. 30 años,  hasta el día D. hoy se la ve en todas las ferias  comerciales, eventos sociales y fiestas patronales, ofreciendo gaseosas, refrescos y algunas golosinas, sale D. lunes a viernes en la plaza D. su localidad para que pueda  obtener una venta diaria, considera esta actividad como una distracción y satisfacción, ya que con este negocio aportó durante muchos años a la economía del hogar, sus hijos pudieron recibir la educación que necesitaban, adicionado a esto, Juana también se dedica a la crianza D. animales.  Sigue realizando estas actividades para continuar con el ritmo D. vida que le agrada, desea mejorar, abriendo una tienda D. abarrotes. Juana solicita este préstamo con el que podrá incrementar su mercadería, también comprará un torete más.
texts.en:
Juana, 59, lives with her husband and 2 children. She really wants to work; she and her husband have worked for many years to keep the family going, she is motivated to work even harder every day, which she has been doing for more than 30 years. Up to this very day, she can be seen in every street market, social event and office party, selling sodas, soft drinks, and candy. She goes out Monday through Friday to her town plaza in order to get daily sales, which is both entertaining and satisfying, as well as contributing to the household expenses over many years and giving her children the education they need. In addition, Juana also raises animals. Keeping up with these activities creates a pleasant life rhythm for her, but she wants to improve herself, opening a grocery shop. Juana is asking for this loan in order to increase her merchandise, plus buying another calf.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise sold in the street, such as soft drinks, candy, etc.

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
La señorita Laura pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Águilas ubicado en el PSJ. Montebello Mz. Nº 143-A, distrito de Yarinacocha, distrito de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 27 años de edad y es soltera. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de cosméticos. Tiene 2 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de comidas espaciales para diferentes eventos como 15 años, matrimonios, cumpleaños, etc. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 40 pollos, 5 docenas de platos, 6 docenas de cubiertos y otros.

Laura se siente realizada e independiente y agradece al Banco por la oportunidad que le brinda para tener un negocio propio.
texts.en:
Ms Laura belongs to the community bank Las Águilas located in the PSJ. Montebello Mz. Nº 143-A, district of Yarinacocha, district of Coronel Portillo, department of Ucayali. She is 27 years old and single. With the first loan of S/. 300 which she received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest in the sale of cosmetics. She has been a member of the community bank for 2 years. Currently, she sells specialized foods for various events such as 15th birthdays, weddings, birthdays, etc. She will use this loan of S/. 1,200, which will be repaid in 5 months, to buy 40 chickens, 5 dozen of plates, 6 dozen cutlery sets and other items. Laura feels fulfilled and independent and she thanks the bank for the opportunity it has given her to have her own business.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 40 chickens, 5 dozen plates, 6 dozen cutlery sets, and other items.

loans.name: Beatris

texts.en:
For almost two years, Beatris has had a business raising hogs. She lives in Brgy, Magassi Cabagan, Isabela. The town is located along the national highway on the way to Tuguegarao City. The majority of the villagers rely on farming corn and rice to earn an income.

She is married to Venancio, a farmer who manages their corn field. They have five children. Aveline is 30 years old and a high school graduate, Brigette is 28 years old and studied in college, Nino Nito is 25 years old and has graduated from vocational school, and Cliff is 22 years old and studied in college. The youngest child, Eunice, was adopted. She is 8 years old and studies in elementary school.

Beatris would like to improve her backyard piggery from one piglet to five pigs. She currently faces difficulty in maintaining enough food and vaccines to care for the pigs. These supplies are necessary for the pigs to grow healthy, but they are costly. Beatris will therefore need PHP 5,000 so she can buy the supplies.

If Beatris can increase her business, then she believes she can grow her profits and therefore help the future of her family.

Beatris encourages her children to finish their college education. She wants to have a simple and assured life for her children. Together with her loving and hard working husband, she works hard to improve their lives, now and for the future.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Luatasi

texts.en: Luatasi K., 32, is married with 3 children.  She has 2 years of experience in the taro, banana, and vegetable business. She sells to the village people and public 5 days per week. She is a new member and this is her first loan request. She has no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 90 Tala.  SPBD loans are Luatasi’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase fencing to expand her plantation and sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La señora Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Brisas del Rio Blanco”, en el sector cuatro, comunidad de Sucano, distrito de Pilcuyo, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 48 años de edad, de estado civil casada y tiene cinco hijos, asimismo posee estudios de primaria completa.
Trabaja desde hace cuatro años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, posee un negocio de engorde de ganado ovino y venta de cereales (chuño, quinua, cebada etc.); su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, que los destinó a la compra de mercadería para venta en las ferias dominicales de Pilcuyo y de Ilave.
Con este préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles podra adquirir ovinos para engorde y comprar mas mercadería al mayor (habas, chuño, quinua, cebada, etc.), finalmente la ganancias de su negocio lo viene invirtiendo en la educación de sus hijos y el sustento diario y se compromete a pagar puntualmente su préstamo en cinco cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the White River's Breezes Community Bank in Sucano, Peru. She is a 48-year-old married mother of five children and has an elementary school education. She has worked with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for four years. She has a business fattening sheep and selling cereals (potato flour, quinoa, barley, etc.). Her first loan was for 300 soles, which she used to purchase merchandise to sell at Sunday markets in Pilcuyo and Ilave. With the current loan of 500 soles she's requesting, she plans to acquire sheep to fatten and purchase more merchandise at wholesale (broad beans, potato flour, quinoa, barley, etc.). She'll use the earnings from her businesses for her children's education and daily sustenance. She promises to repay the loan punctually in five months.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquire sheep to fatten and purchase more merchandise at wholesale (broad beans, potato flour, quinoa, barley, etc.)

loans.name: Both

texts.en: S. is 41 years old and a resident of the Kompong Tom Province. She is a mother of two children; the first one works as a laborer in the private sector, and the other is a student. S. is married to Khy, 20, who works in housing as a wood provider. S. has been earning her living by raising pigs in the stall behind her house since 2002. She sells them for slaughter in four months time after raising. She gets up every morning to buy the pigs' food and sometimes she buys their food from the market. S. is now looking for a loan to buy a buffalo for her husband's business in transferring the housing wood. She dreams of having a good living, a good house, and a degree for her child.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo for her husband's business in lumber transferring

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther A. is 35 years old, married, and has two children. She sells kerosene in wholesale and retail to her customers. She hopes for a loan of N70,000 to purchase more kerosene to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more kerosene

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel tiene 42 años, vive con sus 2 hijos en casa de su madre. Desde hace 3 años tiene una tienda en su misma casa, esta oportunidad de negocio le permitió generar sus propios ingresos económicos para el sostenimiento de sus hijos. Maribel atiende su establecimiento durante todo el día y todos los días de la semana; por las mañanas tiene más clientes  que por las tardes, sus hijos también le ayudan en la atención de su negocio cuando es necesario. Dependiendo de la época del año la demanda de comestibles sube o baja, por ello que aprovecha los primeros meses de campaña escolar para vender útiles de escritorio. Es la primera vez que Maribel viene solicitando un préstamo con MFP, está muy contenta de formar parte de su banco comunal y tiene deseos de continuar trabajando para su progreso. La cantidad requerida es para la compra de mercadería en golosinas, refrescos y otras bebidas en mayores cantidades.
texts.en:
Maribel is 42 years old and lives with her two children in her mother's house. For three years, she has had a store in her house, this business opportunity has allowed her to generate her own income for the sustenance of her children. Maribel attends her establishment during the whole day and every day of the week; in the morning she has more customers than in the afternoon, her children also help her with the attendance of the business when necessary. Depending on the season the demand for groceries rises and falls, so she takes advantage of the first few months of the school year to sell school supplies. This is the first time Maribel comes asking for a loan with MFP, and se is very happy to be part of the communal bank and has hopes to continue working for its progress. The required amount is to buy merchandise like sodas, soft drinks and other drinks in larger quantities.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing her merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and sell small cattle.

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es:
El señor Marcelino Padrón vive con su esposa la señora Nicolasa Gamez, ellos son padres de dos hijos pequeños los cuales son el motivo de esta pareja para salir adelante. 
El labora para una empresa de ediciones y publicaciones desde hace 6 años, a parte cuenta con otro ingreso ya que tiene su propio taller de soldadura y herrería desde hace 8 años. 
El esta solicitando este crédito para la inversión en la compra de materia prima para seguir produciendo su trabajo.
texts.en:
Marcelino Padrón lives with his wife, Nicolasa Gamez. They are parents of two small children who are the motivation of this couple to move ahead in life. Marcelino has worked for a publications business for 6 years. He also has another source of income from his blacksmith workshop that he has had for 8 years. Marcelino is requesting this loan to invest in purchasing raw materials so that he can continue with his work.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials for his blacksmith business

loans.name: Ermelinda

texts.es: Ermelinda tiene 29 años, vive con su esposo y su pequeño hijo de un año. Se dedica a la agricultura desde que era niña, ya que aun vive en su pueblo natal, todos los días se levanta muy temprano para preparar los alimentos, y posteriormente, junto a su esposo, ir a sus tierras de cultivo, donde debe estar pendiente de que sus plantaciones estén libres de plagas, así como de abonar para que aumente su producción. El producto principal que cultiva es la papa, que luego de 6 meses de larga espera, llegada la cosecha vende en el mercado principal de la ciudad más cercana a su comunidad. Ermelinda vende al por mayor, es decir, es una de las abastecedoras del mercado. Para más adelante, sus deseos son de continuar y mejorar su producción, sembrando otras variedades de papa. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, y también la primera vez que trabaja en un banco comunal, donde se compromete a ser puntual en sus reuniones y con pago de sus cuotas. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de semilla de otras variedades de papa, además de sacos de abono, todo esto, para incrementar su próxima producción.
texts.en:
Ermelinda is 29 years old and lives with her husband and little one-year old son. She has been involved in agriculture since she was a child and still lives in her home town. She gets up early every day to prepare food, and then, with her husband, they go to their land, where they make sure their plantations are free of pests and use fertilizer for increased production. The main product that is cultivated is potatoes, that after 6 months of long wait, are harvested and sold in the main market of the city closest to their community. Ermelinda sells at wholesale, that is, she is one of the suppliers to the market. Later, her wishes are to continue to improve production by planting other varieties of potato. This is his first loan with MFP, and also the first time working in a community bank, where she commits to be punctual at meetings and payment of her dues. The money requested is to purchase seed of other varieties of potatoes and bags of fertilizer to increase the next crop yield.

Translated from Spanish by Tim Hassett, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Asiezo

texts.en: Asiezo J. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and bread and is requesting a loan to buy a motorbike to carry charcoal to the market. She is 36 years old and is married to a husband who is a peasant. She has three children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop. BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to carry charcoal to the market

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma E. owns and operates a business venture running a sari-sari (variety) store and videoke machine. Her main source of income comes from selling a variety of different products in her community. Elma is just starting this business. She is 41 years old, married and has two school-age children. They are from the village of Zone 4, Kabacsanan, Iligan City.

In 2009, Elma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business and to support the education of her children.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products for a sari-sari store

location.town: Zone 4, Kabacsanan, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Bola

texts.en: Bola A. is 34 years old and married with two children. She is a tailor and also sells sarongs. Bola is requesting the loan amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more tailoring materials and sarongs to sell. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials and sarongs to sell

loans.name: Be Ready I Group

texts.en: Princess is a 40-year-old Liberian mother of 4 children. She’s married but has never been to school. She’s been involved in a tabletop marketing business for the past 2 years now. Her challenge has been finance. With LEAP on her side, she dreams of getting fully involved in business, generating more money, educating her children, building a home for her children and herself, as well as sending all of her 4 children to good schools and medically speaking, taking care of them also.

loans.use: buying rice, oil, pepper, salt, etc. for resale

loans.name: Ndeye Coumba

texts.fr: NDEYE COUMBA N. HABITE A CAMBERENE OU ELLE EXERCE L'activité de vente de tissus.elle capitalise une expérience de plus de cinq ans dans ce domaine.elle sollicite un crédit de cent mille(100 000)frs pour augmenter son fond de roulement .l'augmentation de ses bénéfices lui permettra de mieux participer a l'entretien de sa famille.elle est parent bénéficiaire depuis 1998.
texts.en:
NDEYE COUMBA N. lives in Camberene where she does business in selling clothing materials. She relies on over five years past experience in this sector. She is requesting a loan of hundred thousand(100 000) frs in order to increase her working capital.The increase in profit will allow her to contribute better for the upkeep of her family. She's been a recipient parent since 1998.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Trading

loans.name: Enkhtaivan

texts.en:
Enkhtaivan A., a 36-year-old businesswoman, lives with her husband and two children in Arkhangai province in central Mongolia. Both of her children currently attend a local secondary school. Enkhtaivan operates a small milk and dairy products business in her town. She purchases milk and dairy products from local farmers and sells them throughout her community.

Enkhtaivan started her milk and dairy trade business in 1998 with capital of 500,000 tugrugs (approx. 345 USD). She has gained much selling and business experience since she started, and attributes her success to her good business sense and hard-working attitude. Today, her working capital exceeds 2,000,000 tugrugs (approx. 1,381 USD) For the future, Enkhtaivan says, “My plan is to expand my business even more and save for my children's future”.

Enkhtaivan is requesting a 2,314,000 tugrug (approx. $1,598 USD) loan to purchase more milk and dairy products for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more milk and dairy products for her business.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora C. is from the village of Macabayao, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 58 years old, married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Nora owns and operates a business venture in the services sector running a beauty parlor business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing general beauty services. Nora has been engaged in her business for over 45 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2004, Nora joined Kiva partner PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nora has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000 PHP from PMPC. This loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Nora is requesting a new loan of 3,500 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be her seventh from PMPC. Nora plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for her business

loans.name: Dancun

texts.en:
Dancun is a 30 year-old married father of two boys. Dancun runs a woodwork and electronics shop in the Mathare slums of Nairobi. He has been in this business for six years and employs two people. He is requesting a loan for Kes. 20,000 to purchase more timber and electronic items. He describes himself as “determined to succeed” and says that since he became a member of Faulu he has become a better at saving his profits. In the future, he hopes to have a sustainable business that requires no loans and hopes also to expand his business into the building of houses.

Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Add supplies of timber & electronic items

loans.name: Rimber

texts.es:
El socio RIMBER pertenece al banco comunal “MINIBANK”, es natural de la ciudad del Cusco.

El socio tiene 30 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene una hija de 6 meses de nacida. 

El tiene una pequeña agencia de viajes y turismo que brinda servicios turísticos que le ofrece la ciudad Imperial Cusco como el Valle Sagrado de los Incas, Machupicchu, Salkantay, etc.   

EL requiere el préstamo para implementar su equipo de viajes como equipos de camping, carpas, menajeria (utensilios de cocina) para los turistas que llegan a la ciudad del Imperial del Cusco. 

El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Rimber is a member of the Communal Bank named “Minibank”. He is a native of the city of Cusco. Rimber is 30 years old, in a common law marriage, and has a 6 month old daughter.

He manages a small travel and tourism agency that provides tourist services. These include tours of various sites around the Imperial City of Cusco such as the Sacred Valley of the Incas, Machu Picchu, Salkantay, etc.

Rimber is requesting a loan to purchase items to start a travel group such as camping equipment, tents, and cooking utensils for tourists who visit Cusco. He is grateful for this opportunity and promises to make his payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase camping equipment for tour groups

loans.name: Purity

texts.en: Purity is a single lady with two children aged 8 years and 5 years, respectively. In order to raise her family, she sells baby/children's clothes by the roadside. She has done this business for the last five years. She started her business by borrowing KES 20,000, which she has paid successfully. Her business is currently booming and she is requesting a loan of KES 50,000 to buy more baby clothes. Her major challenge is the location of her business, which is not very safe and provides no shelter. Her dream is to be financially stable and be able to move to a better house with her children. In five years time, she wants to open a boutique and venture into the shoe business. She describes herself as a hardworking woman.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en:
Christiana is 35 years old; she is married and has four children. Her husband is a trader. Her children are still dependent upon her and go to school.  She mills palm fruits into cooking oil to sell. Cooking oil is very essential in the preparation of soup in Nigeria. With this business, she assists her husband in meeting the basic needs of their home. 

The Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa, and Christiana is a committed (LAPO) client.  She is requesting a loan of 100,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more palm fruits to mill into cooking oil to sell, in the hopes of expanding her business.  She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more palm fruits to mill and sell.

loans.name: Nurjamal's Group

texts.ru:
Джумалиева Нуржамал – лидер данной группы. Ей тридцать пять лет. Нуржамал вместе с семьёй живёт в г. Карабалта. Муж Нуржамал работает на стройке. В зимнее время стройка везде приостанавливается. Однако муж Нуржамал прилагает всевозможные усилия, чтобы обеспечить себя работой в это нелёгкое время. Вместе с мужем Нуржамал воспитывает троих детей. Старшему сыну четырнадцать, дочке двенадцать лет и младшему сыну три годика. Как только двое старших детей начали ходить в школу, Нуржамал стала думать о дополнительном источнике заработка. В этом ей помогли родители. Шесть лет назад они купили ей корову и Нуржамал начала заниматься животноводством и продавать молоко. С тех пор ей удалось немного увеличить поголовье с кота.  При этом, муж также несмотря на тяжёлую работу всегда помогает Нуржамал ухаживать за скотом. Нуржамал имеет стабильный ежемесячный доход от продажи молока в размере двух тысяч четырёх сот сомов ($56). Она уже стала думать о диверсификации своей деятельности. Теперь она хочет начать разводить коз. Но для этого требуются значительные средства, которых в данное время у Нуржамал нет. По этой причине она и обратилась за кредитом. Нуржамал уверена в том, что в будущем, её нынешнее занятие позволит ей купить дом.

Вместе с Нуржамал в группу входят следующие участники:

Акылай сорок лет. Она мать пятерых детей. Муж Акылай работает пастухом. Сама Акылай также занимается разведением скота. Старшие дети хоть и учатся в ВУЗах, но тоже помогают матери по хозяйству, когда приезжают домой на выходные. Акылай надеется получить кредит, чтобы купить уголь на зиму.

Жибек двадцать восемь лет. Она замужем и имеет троих детей. Муж  работает пастухом. Жибек – домохозяйка. Она также дома разводит скот и продаёт молоко. Разведение скота передалось им по наследству. Жибек обратилась за кредитом с целью купить корову и продавать больше молока. 

Эркайым тридцать семь лет. Она в разводе. У Эркайым один сын. Чтобы прокормить себя и сына, Эркайым занимается животноводством и продаёт молоко. Ей удаётся зарабатывать до шести тысяч сомов в месяц, к тому же родители помогают по хозяйству. Эркайым нужен кредит для покупки овец для разведения.

Мубарахан сорок семь лет. Вместе с мужем воспитывает семерых детей. Муж работает в школе охранником. Мубарахан нужен кредит чтобы купить на зиму уголь.

 --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Nurjamal D. is the leader of this group. She is thirty-five years old. Nurjamal and her family lives in Karabalta. Nurjamal's husband works in construction. During the winter time, building everywhere stops. However, Nurjamal's husband makes every possible effort to find work during this hard time. Nurjamal and her husband are raising three children. The older son is fourteen, the daughter is twelve and the younger son is three. As soon as the two older children started to school, Nurjamal began to think of finding an additional source of income. Her parents helped her with this. Six years ago they bought a cow and Nurjamal has started to work in animal husbandry and to sell milk. Since then she has managed to increase her herd. Her husband, despite working hard, always helps Nurjamal to look after the cattle. Nurjamal has a stable monthly income from the sale of milk at a rate of two thousand four hundred som ($56). She already began to think of diversification. Now she wishes to start raising goats. In order to do this, Nurjamal needs funds that she does not currently have. Therefore, she has applied for a loan. Nurjamal is certain that in the future, her work will allow her to buy a house. Nurzhamal's group includes the following participants: Akylai is forty years old. She is the mother of five children. Akylai's husband works as a shepherd. Akylai also raises cattle. Her older children study in school, and help their mother at home when they come home on weekends. Akylai hopes to take out a loan to buy coal for the winter. Jibek is twenty-eight years old. She is married and has three children. Her husband works as a shepherd. Jibek is a housewife. She also raises cattle and sells milk. Cattle cultivation has been passed down to her in her family. Jibek has applied for a loan to buy a cow and to sell more milk. Erkayim is thirty-seven years old. She is divorced. Erkayim has one son. To support herself and her son, Erkayim works in animal husbandry and sells milk. She manages to earn six thousand som a month, and her parents help out with the household. Erkayim would like a loan to buy sheep to raise. Mubarahan is forty-seven years old. She and her husband are raising seven children. Her husband works at school as a security guard. Mubarahan would like to borrow money to buy coal for the winter. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a few goats for selling goats' milk

loans.name: Nueva Ilusión (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Nueva Ilusión se  formó en la parroquia Cumbe, esta parroquia se encuentra a unos 30 minutos fuera de la ciudad de Cuenca, en el viaje hacia Cumbe  la naturaleza nos regala una hermosa  vista  de la belleza de su tierra en su estado natural, sus habitantes mayores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería ya que los jóvenes han migrado a la ciudad o al extranjero en busca  nuevas y mejores fuentes de empleo. Nuestras socias son personas muy amables y buscan lo mejor para mejorar su situación económica.

La señora  María V. es una de las socias nuevas  del banco comunal Nueva Ilusión, vive en el Sector la Floresta en la  parroquia  Cumbe, tiene 30  años y es madre soltera de una niña de diez años que no es reconocida por el padre, la casa en la que habita es de sus padres y aporta un poco económicamente a los gastos del hogar.

María se dedica a la cría de vacas, borregos, cuyes, pollos, éstos  los vende en la feria de su parroquia los días miércoles, también entrega su producción de  leche a los carros lecheros que pasan por allí.

Invitada por una  amiga formó parte del banco comunal y éste es su primer crédito en la fundación, con el va a comprar una vaca lechera.

Su sueño es tener una casa propia.

Libia Enríquez es otra de las socias nuevas  del banco comunal Nueva Ilusión,  ella vive en la parroquia  Cumbe con sus cinco hijos y su esposo que se dedica a la construcción de casas, juntos han logrado construir su casa propia.


Nuestra socia comparte su tiempo entre los quehaceres del hogar y la cría de cuyes y borregos, y con el crédito solicitado va a invertir en el estudio de sus hijos, pagar  deudas por la compra de útiles escolares que adquirió para el ingreso a clases.

Su sueño es dar a sus hijos una educación de primera hasta que lleguen a ser profesionales porque considera que la educación es la mejor herencia que les puede dejar.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank Nueva Ilusión ["New Hope"] was created in the Cumbe parish. This area is located about 30 minutes from Cuenca city. In the trip to Cumbe nature gifts us with a splendid view of the beauty of this land in its natural state. Its older inhabitants work in agriculture and livestock breeding, while the younger ones moved to the big city or abroad in search of new and better forms of employment. Our Bank members are very nice women and they look for the best possibilities to improve their economic situation. Ms. María V. is one of the new members of the Communal Bank Nueva Ilusión. She lives in the Floresta sector of the Cumbe parish. She is 30 years old and she is a single mom of a ten years old girl that the father would not own. She lives in her parents' home and she contributes a little to the household expenses. María breeds cows, sheep, rabbits and chicken. She sells these in the weekly parish market on Wednesdays. She also delivers her milk production to the milk carts that pass by. She was invited by a friend to take part in the Communal Bank and this his her first loan with the foundation. With it she will purchase a milk cow. Her dream is to have a house of her own. Libia Enríquez is another new member of the Communal Bank Nueva Ilusión. She lives in Cumbe parish with her five children and her husband, who works in construction. Together they have built their own home. Our member shares her time between the household chores and breeding rabbits and sheep. With the requested loan she will invest in her children's education and pay back some debts she owes for the purchase of school material she bought for them to start their classes. Her dream is to give her children a first rate education until they become white collar workers because she considers that education is the best inheritance she can leave them.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a milk cow

loans.name: Heang's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Heang H. is 46 years old. She is a village bank president of a group that consists of 10 people located in Svay Thum village, Takeo province. Mrs. Heang H. is a farmer who owns a two-hectare field she uses to grow rice. Her husband, Mr. Kea S., is a taxi driver who owns a car.  In order to support her husband's business, Mrs. Heang H. is applying for 800,000 Riel from AMK for her husband to change his traffic license and repair his car. Mrs. Heang H. is the mother of three children. One of her children works in the garment factory and the other two are students in the local school.

loans.use: Repair the car.

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en:
Philomena is a widow with two children. One of her children just graduated and the other child is married with children. Philomena is very happy to be a mother and grandmother. She sells drinks, groceries and foodstuffs at retail prices to her customers. She hopes to expand her business. 

She is requesting a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Qarkhun

texts.en:
Qarkhun N. is 31 years old and is married with two children. He is the sole breadwinner for his family and his only income comes from the raising and sale of large livestock at the local market.

Every year, Qarkhun buys young heifers from the farms in adjacent villages. He raises them with the help of his wife and children and then sells the adult cows and bulls to local butchers.

Today, Qarkhun is thinking about expanding his business since the income from his present herd isn't enough to provide for his family. He plans to purchase additional calves and, to do this, he needs to invest an additional 1,600 AZN in his business.

loans.use: To purchase three calves and fodder

loans.name: Felix Antonio

texts.es: Félix Antonio tiene 56 años, tiene más de 20 años de trabajar con Fundación por lo que ha demostrado ser un excelente cliente. Tiene 5 hijos pero todos ellos viven de manera independiente, su actividad es brindar el servicio de reparación de aparatos electrodomésticos. El tiene muchos clientes que recurren a su vivienda para que el repare sus productos, la situación más difícil que ha enfrentado hasta los momentos es la poca afluencia de clientes. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de herramientas, piezas de abanicos, licuadoras entre otros productos. Su deseo es mejorar cada día su servicio.
texts.en:
Félix Antonio is 56 years old and for over 20 years has worked with the foundation (Kiva’s field partner) and has shown to be an excellent client. He has 5 children but they all live independently. Mr. Félix works repairing domestic appliances. He has a lot of customers that go to his home so that he can repair their products. The most difficult situation he has faced is the low influx of customers. The loan that he seeks is for work capital that will be used to buy tools, parts for fans, blenders among other products. His wish is to improve each day his work.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital.

loans.name: Union Estrellas Group

texts.es:
El centro focal Exaltación es relativamente pequeño y se encuentra en una zona alejada del centro de la ciudad de El Alto. En este centro focal se encuentra la Asociación Comunal Unión Estrellas la misma que está conformada por 8 integrantes.  Este grupo se ha conformado recientemente y están motivadas a hacer crecer sus negocios, al respecto, ellas tienen variadas actividades económicas como la venta de medias, poleras, papa y variada ropa deportiva.
Nilda C. de 34 años, vende poleras y ropa interior en la feria 16 de Julio y  desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de mayor mercadería y ofertar productos variados a sus clientes
texts.en:
The Exaltación area is realtively small and is located in a zone far from the El Alto city center. The “Asociación Comunal Unión Estrellas” (Stars Communal Union) is located in this area and is made up of eight members. This group was recently formed and its members are motivated to grow their respective businesses. They are involved in a variety of activities, such selling hosiery, polo shirts, and a variety of sports clothing. Nilda is 34 years old and sells polo shirts and undergarments at the July 16 fair. She would like to use the money from this loan to buy more items to be able to offer greater variety to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Khoja Rawash Group

texts.en:
M. Qasem is the group leader of Khoja Rawash group. He lives in District 9 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and lives in a household with  five family members. His four children are students at secondary and high school. 

He has a stationery shop where he sells different kinds of pens, color pens and notebooks. He needs the loan to purchase more stationery, especially the ones that are not available in his shop. He hopes to expand his business as soon as possible.

loans.use: He hopes to expand his business by expanding his product offering

loans.name: Esther Waruguru

texts.en: Esther is a 33 year old woman who operates a hostel business. She is married to Peter, a businessman. She was introduced to KADET through KADET marketing outreach in her home town of Thika. She has been operating her hostel businesses for the past six years. Esther plans to increase the number of rooms and to add facilities (e.g beds, beddings, etc.) with the loan she has applied for. She intends to add more rooms for her hostel business with the extra profit expected from her business. Her hopes and dreams are to have her own building for a hostel business one day. Esther describes herself as a hardworking person.

loans.use: To increase amount of hostel rooms and to add facilities.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Kouta

texts.fr: Kouta C. est âgée de 43 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 10 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du banc Villageois de DIAOBE MANDING depuis le 20 juin 2003 et a bénéficié de 15 crédits qu'elle a toujours bien géré et remboursé à temps. Elle est productrice et vendeuse de pâte d'arachide depuis plus de 6 ans et son nouveau crédit lui permettra de renforcer son activité et de réaliser plus de bénéfices. Elle soutien son mari dans les différentes charges familiales par exemple la scolarité des enfants, la santé et la nourriture.
texts.en:
Kouta is 43 years old, married, and a mother caring for ten children. She has been a member of the Villagers' Bank of Diaobe Manding since 20 june 2001 and has received 15 loans, which she has always managed well and paid back on time. She has produced and sold peanut butter for more than six years and her new loan will allow her to strengthen her business and to make greater profit. She supports her husband in his different obligations to the family, such as the education of their children, their health and their feeding.

Translated from French by Martha Schmitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen her commerical activities.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita U. is from the village of Tanjay Calatunan, Sindangan Zamboanga del Norte. She is 50 years old, married and has three adult children. To make a living, Teresita has a general store. She has been engaged in her business for 14 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2009, Teresita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from PMPC which was used to purchase additional products to sell. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used for inventory and working capital and for her children's tuition fees. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Teresita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 
      
*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For her children tuition fees and addtional capital for her store.

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem is a wife of G. M. and they belong to a city called Vehari in Pakistan. They have a small house of two rooms and have been living in it for the past 15 years.

A very caring lady, Naseem stays at home and carries out her responsibilities as a housewife and a mother as well. Her husband has a business selling bed sheets. He purchases them from the cities of Faisalabad and Multan (both are famous for textiles) and sells them in different areas of the community. His earnings are good from this business, but due to a lack of stock and the urgent demand of his customers, he sometimes isn’t able to fulfill orders.

Therefore, Naseem has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband. With the loan amount, he will buy bed sheets in bulk, improve his business and generate a good profit on it.

loans.use: Purchase bed sheets for reselling

loans.name: Bunthoeun

texts.en:
Mr. Bunthoeun M. (pictured with his wife on the corn farm) and his wife, Mrs. Houn Duch, married in 1986 and have four children: two sons and two daughters. Three of them married, two of whom live in the family home, one lives in a separate home, and another one attends school. 

Bunthoeun and his wife are farmers. They grow rice and different kinds of vegetables such as corn, potato, jicama and yam. Bunthoeun received a previous Kiva loan, and is now asking for another loan of $1,000 to buy seeds, pesticides, and fertilizer to maintain his rice and vegetable farm. He will also buy piglets for his wife to raise. The couple will be able to earn extra income from the new business.

loans.use: To use for farming and to buy piglets for his wife to raise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy chickens, meat, rice and beans.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Selling women's and children's clothing

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria B. is from the village of Nabannagan West, Lasam, Cagayan. She is 46 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Gloria owns and operates a furniture business, making and selling general household furniture to local businesses and community members. Gloria has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Gloria joined Kiva partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw materials to make additional furniture. This loan will be her first from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to make additional furniture

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: He wants to complete his stocks

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
Felix es un padre de familia de 42 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a su hijo en el caserío La Laja del distrito de La Florida, una zonza rural perteneciente a la provincia de San Miguel y que se encuentra ubicado en la región Cajamarca, a más de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace mas de 10 años a la comercialización de café y guayaquil (principales productos producidos en su localidad), el adquiere los productos a los vecinos de la zona y se encarga de transportarlo desde La Florida hasta Chiclayo, en donde vende su mercadería. Con los ingresos que le brinda esta actividad se encarga de sustentar la economía de su familia.

Felix desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más mercadería para ampliar sus ventas. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles  con los cuales piensa lograr su objetivo.

Felix es un hombre bastante trabajador y entregado a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es ver a su familia progresar y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Felix is a father, he is 42 years old and he lives together with his wife and their son in the community of La Laja in the district of La Florida. It is a rural region in the province of San Miguel, located in the region of Cajamarca. It is more than three hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital city of Lambayeque. 

For the past 10 years he has been a coffee merchant in Guayaquil (the most common product produced in the region). He acquires the products from his neighbors in the region and he transports it from La Florida all the way to Chiclayo where he sells it. With the earnings he is able to provide for his family. 

Felix wishes to expand his business with the purchase of more products in order to increase his sales. To this end he has requested a first time loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 2000 nuevos soles. 

Felix is a hardworking person who is devoted to his family. His greatest dream is to see his family comfortable.

loans.use: To purchase coffee for resale.

loans.name: Ashran's Group

texts.en:
Ashran, 55, is a widow living in Depalpur, a small city in Pakistan. She has lived with her parents since the death of her husband. She has no children. Her brother owns a small piece of land where he grows different seasonal crops. He also operates a fertilizer and seed selling business which he has been doing for over 10 years. He contributes to his family financially from his earnings.

Ashran operates a dairy business from her home. She keeps a buffalo and sells its milk to her neighboring clients in order to contribute financially to her family. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her brother. Her brother will invest the loan money in his fertilizer and seed selling business by buying these items in bulk. Ashran is very dedicated to her brother and wishes for him that he grows his business and becomes successful in his future. This is her first loan from Asasah.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for resale.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “AMAUTA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Elizabeth; ella tiene 52 años de edad, casada  y tiene 3 hijos; La socia es profesora de educación primaria, ella trabaja  desde las 7:00am hasta las 02:00pm , la socia se siente feliz ya que trabaja por sus hijos y desea darles una buena educacion.
  
La socia solicita el préstamo para la educación de sus hijos.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a member of the “Amauta” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Elizabeth is 52 years old, married and has 3 children.  She is an elementary school teacher.  She works from 7.00am to 2.00pm.  She feels happy because she works for her children and would like to give them a good education.

She is requesting a loan to pay for her children's education.

She is grateful to those who will take part in her dream by funding her loan and pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To pay for her children's education

loans.name: Virginia Maria Natividad

texts.es:
Virginia de 54 años, vende cangrejos en su casa y su esposo a las afuera. Vive en una zona periurbana con todos los servicios básicos el lugar está ubicado en la Perimetral de Guayaquil zona rodeada de un estero.  

Comenzó con las ventas de cangrejos porque su esposo quería tener su propio dinero con un actividad económica propia y ella le ayudo para lograrlo. Como vendedor ambulante el esposo de Virginia los vende mientras que ella los vende desde su casa para tener dinero adicional. Trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta terminar su jornada. Diariamente comprar 25 a 30 planchas de cangrejos  (en cada plancha viene 24 cangrejos) para venderlos. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cangrejos para tener mayores ingresos. En el futuro quiere tener más clientela y construir mejor su casa.
texts.en:
Virginia is 54 years old. She sells crabs at home and her husband on the streets. She lives in a peripheral area with all basic services located on the perimeter of Guayaquil, surrounded by an estuary.

She began selling crabs because her husband wanted to earn money through their own economic activity and she helped him to accomplish this. Her husband sells the crabs as an ambulant vendor while Virginia sells from her home to generate extra income. They work from 7 am until day’s end. Daily they buy from 25 to 30 sacks of crabs (each sack contains 24 crabs) for sale.

With the loan she wants to buy crabs to generate higher income. In the future she wants more customers and rebuild her home.

loans.use: Buy crabs

loans.name: Hayat

texts.ar:
حياة في عمر 56 سنة تعمل في محل لبيع الالعاب والهدايا لها في عملها 9 سنوات متزوجة
ولها ولد تحب عملها وتطمح ان تفتتح محل اكبر لكي تتوسع به طموحة  لا تريد ان يعيقها المادة في مجال عملها
تتلقى الدعم من عائلتها وهي تريد من خلال طلب قرض لها من المجموعة الى شراء العاب وهدايا جديدة بمناسبة
الاعياد تاريخها مع المجموعة جيد وميز حيث كانت تتلقى الدعم الكامل من العائلة
texts.en: Hayat is a 56-year-old wife and mother who has been working in a toy store for the past nine years. She is very ardent about her business, which she wants to expand by relocating to a larger shop. Hayat, who enjoys a distinguished credit history with Al Majmoua, is now seeking a loan to purchase games and other presents for the upcoming holidays.

loans.use: Purchase games and other presents for toy store
