loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
As the saying goes, opportunity knocks only once. Mary Grace S. M. knows this truth and grabs every opportunity that comes her way. Mary Grace, 46, reached the college level of education and is married to Rolando, a government employee. Together they are raising three children, two of whom are in high school while the other one is already working. Together, they live in Pasay City, Philippines.

Mary Grace presently runs a direct-selling business, in which she sells items to her neighbors. Her products include fashionable bags, accessories, apparel, cosmetics and footwear, among others. Having been at least 25 years in business, she knows how to pay her dues on time. She also has an excellent reputation with her fellow community partners in CCT* and, most important, her customers. Monthly, she is able to earn an average of 10,000 Philippines pesos (Php).

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a Php 50,000 loan. She intends to use this money to purchase more products for her store, all the more now that the Christmas season is fast approaching. She plans to take this opportunity to drive her business toward more profitability.

Mary Grace's life is never without challenges, both in her business and personal life. Nonetheless, she stays focused on the opportunities that lie ahead, and not on the failures of yesterday or the worries of today.


*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: Stock for her direct-selling business and items ordered in advance by her customers

loans.name: Maria Soledad

texts.es:
María tiene 30 años de edad, es conviviente y reside junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito agrícola de Chulucanas, ubicada a más de tres horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque

Se dedica a vender productos cosméticos por catálogo, realizando dos campañas mensuales, de una empresa que le provee dichos productos. María también se dedica a la crianza de aves de corral como gallinas, pavos y patos, los cuales engorda y comercializa su carne entre los vecinos de la zona.  Los ingresos que ella percibe de estas actividades le sirven para sacar adelante a su familia y fortalecer su economía.
 
María desea adquirir aves, para su engorde y posterior comercialización.  Por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
María is 30 years old.  She lives with her common-law husband and children in the agricultural district of Chulucanas which is located more than three and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of Lambayeque region.

María sells cosmetics through a catalog.  She makes two lots of sales a month for a company that provides her with these products.  María also raises poultry such as chickens, turkeys and ducks which she fattens and then sells as meat to her neighbors.  She uses the profits she makes from these business activities to get her family ahead in life and strengthen her finances.

María would like to acquire birds to fatten and then sell.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to help her achieve her goal.

loans.use: To buy animals to fatten and then sell

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses Z. is a young married man with a one-year-old child. He runs a motorcycle repair business in Kakamega, a region in Kenya known for the production of sugarcane and commonly referred to as the sugarbelt region. Along with repairing motorcycles, Moses also sells tires and spare parts. This business is profitable for him but his major challenge is the lack of financial capital. 

Moses works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep his business doing well. He is requesting a loan of 40,000 KES to buy spare parts to expand his business and meet customer demand. Moses describes himself as determined and focused. In the future, he hopes to expand and have a big auto and spare part shop.

loans.use: to buy spare vehicle parts

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther N. lives in the Nabukalu neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has five children. All her children go to school. 

Esther owns a business of selling shoes. She has been in this business for ten years, and she works seven days out of every week. Esther sells her products door-to-door. Esther has requested a loan of 900,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more shoes and add to her business.

The main business challenge for Esther is seasonality. Esther lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity and doesn’t have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and feeding her family.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second-hand shoes to sell door-to-door.

loans.name: Samera

texts.en:
Samera B. is from the village of Bonbonon, Iligan City. She is 19 years old. Samera is single. To make a living, Samera owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods & beverages in the local community. Samera has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Samera joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Samera has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Samera is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & snack foods. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Samera from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & snack foods

location.town: Bonbonon, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
El señor Luis S. tiene 32 años de edad, es separado y vive en el centro de la ciudad de Caacupe, distante a unos 60 kilómetros de la ciudad capital (Asunción). Tiene 2 hijos y 1 hija (todos en edad escolar).
El señor Luis S. posee en su domicilio una pescadería desde hace 2 años.
Don Luis solicita el crédito para la compra de un cogelador para almacenar los pescados, ya que de esa manera podrá adquirir mayor cantidad de productos y mantenerlos frescos hasta el final de sus ventas.
Agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva el apoyo obtenido para su actividad, ya que mediante ello podrá  ofrecer a su clientela un buen servicio y el mejor producto del mercado.
texts.en:
Luis is 32 years old, separated from his wife, and lives in the center of the city of Caacupe, some 60 kilometers from the capital city of Asuncion.  He has 2 boys and 1 girl, all of school age.

Luis has operated a fish store from his home for 2 years.  He requests a loan to buy a freezer for storing fish.  With this, he will be able to acquire a larger quantity of fish and keep them fresher until final sale.

Luis is grateful to the Paraguay Foundation and Kiva for their help with his activity, because by this means he will be able to offer his clientèle good service and the best product on the market.

loans.use: TO BUY A FREEZER FOR HIS FISH SELLING BUSINESS

loans.name: Joash

texts.en: Joash O. N. is 54 years old, married, and has four adult children, one of whom attends the university.  He runs a butcher shop and his wife is a teacher.  Joash employs one person in his business.  He joined Faulu Kenya so that he would save his money and access loans easily.  He hopes to open another outlet of his business in the future.   He is requesting a loan for 40,000 KES to buy a deep freezer and renovate his business premises.

loans.use: To purchase a deep freezer and renovate his business premises

loans.name: Cristoalina Bernard

texts.es:
Doña Cristobalina T. S. es una señora con 72 años de edad, viuda, humilde y muy trabajadora. Vive con una nieta la cual ve como una hija. Hace cinco años falleció su esposo. Desde ese momento vio la necesidad de trabajar como microempresaria en su casa, para poder generar ingresos y mantenerse. Inició una pulpería y hasta el momento le ha ido muy bien. También tiene otras actividades que desarrolla como es la cria de pollos y cerdos, hace pan y empanadas caseras para la venta en su misma pulpería, además de sembrar ñame junto con un yerno. Su nieta le ayuda en los oficios domésticos y en su negocio.
Éste es el segundo préstamo que solicita y lo va invertir en comprar abarrotes y otros para su pulpería.
texts.en:
Cristobalina T. S. is 72 years old.  She is a widow and a hard working humble woman.  Her husband passed away five years ago and she lives with her granddaughter who she has raised like a daughter.  Since her husband passed away she has seen the need to work as a small businesswoman out of her home in order to generate income and support herself.  She started a small store and things have gone well for her.  She also raises chickens and hogs, bakes bread and homemade empanadas to sell in her store.  She also raises yams with her son in law.  Her granddaughter helps her in the home and in her business.

This will be her second loan and she will use the money to buy groceries and other things for her store.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store

loans.name: Haidi

texts.en:
Haidi has a successful business selling t-shirts, accessories, calling cards and other novelty items out of her own store. She is effusive about her love for her job and the benefits of running her own business. While she had a store prior to joining Grameen America one year ago, she lacked enough capital to fully stock it with inventory and therefore struggled to make the business profitable.

With Haidi’s first two loans, she was able to sell a variety of new products and saw her business begin to thrive. She is now seeking a third loan of $1,500 to purchase additional inventory, such as clothing and accessories, to sell at her shop. Haidi has spent years learning her trade and knows that she can continue steadily growing her business as long as she has access to the necessary loan capital. Haidi is a hardworking, successful microentrepreneur, and a loan of $1,500 is all she needs to work towards making her dreams a reality. Haidi has two young children and looks forward to creating an even more prosperous life for her family.

loans.use: to pay for inventory (clothes, accessories, etc) for her store.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.ar: محمد عمره 37 سنة متزوج وهو اب لولدان يعمل في زراعة الارض ونقل الرمل له في عمله 15 سنة يحب العمل ويرى فيه المتعة لأنه يرى ان زراعة الارض هي اهم الاعمال , يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء سيارة لستعمالها في نقل المواد لزراعة الارض يسعى الى زيادة المدخول وخاصة انه كان عامل واصبح لديه عمله الخاص حيث تمكن من ان يزيد من مدخوله فهو يمتلك الخبرة الكبيرة التي خولته ان يؤمن عمل خاص به زبائنه هم من اهالي البلدة والمزارعين يسعى الى تأمين مستقبل جيد له ولعائلته خاصة انه في طور تأسيس عائلة
texts.en: Mohamad is 37 years old and married with two children. He works in agriculture and transports sand. He has been doing this for 15 years and loves his work. He enjoys what he does as he believes that cultivation of the land is the most important work. With this loan he wants to buy a vehicle to help his work. He aspires to increase his income as he used to just be a worker but now owns his own business. He has the necessary experience for his own business and he has customers both from the city and from agricultural areas. He aspires to secure a good future for himself and his family, especially since he is in the midst of establishing his family.

loans.use: to purchase a vehicle to use in the transportation of sand and agricultural materials.

loans.name: Maritza Magda

texts.es:
Maritza de oficio comerciante, con más de doce años en las venta de lentes, en toda variedad, controles de tv, Dvd y accesorios de celulares. Comenzando con pocos producto y ambulante en los semáforos. Hoy en día sus ventas aumentaron al ofreces más productos de calidad, con financiamiento que Afodenic ha otorgado por medio del crédito.
Ahora cuenta con un lugar fijo en sus ventas, en un centro comercial, en la parte de afuera, logrando vender más. Ya que es un centro muy visitado. y que gracias  a la variedad de productos sus ventas son buenas.

Con este nuevo préstamo comprara; lentes de sol, cartuchera de celular, protectores de celular, controles de tv, manos libres y cargadores de celular. Siendo de mayor demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Maritza is a merchant by trade and she has more than twelve years experience selling all types of glasses, television remote controls, DVDs, and cellular phone accessories. She started out with only a few products and selling at street intersections. Today, her sales have increased and she offers more quality products with the help of loans from Afodenic (Kiva Field Partner).

She now has a fixed store space for her sales, located in the exterior of a shopping center where she can sell more. It is a highly visited shopping center and thanks to the variety of products, her sales are good.

With this new loan she will purchase: sunglasses, cellular phone cases and skins, television remote controls, hands-free devices, and chargers. These products are in most demand by her clients.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of sunglasses and other merchandise to keep her business growing.

loans.name: Sereebaatar

texts.en:
Mr.Sereebaatar, 37, is divorced and lives with his 11 year old son, his mother and his younger brother and sister in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent in the ger district of the city. 

Since 2000, Sereebaatar has been running a transportation business using his family minivan. He has permission to carry passengers on one of the city’s remote bus lanes which lacks bus services. In his family he is the only bread winner. His younger brother works casually at a construction site as a laborer.

Sereebaatar is planning to buy a small family car and to use it as a taxi. His younger brother has a driving license and he wants his brother to drive the taxi to generate extra income for the family. The loan Sereebaatar is taking will be used to buy this car.

loans.use: to buy a small car for his younger brother to use as a taxi.

loans.name: Arcenio

texts.es:
El señor Arcenio es de nacionalidad paraguaya, soltero, con 24 años de edad, reside en una casa de alquiler en la ciudad de Curuguaty, en donde tiene su taller denominado "Taller de motos Rubinho", que está ubicado en el barrio Centro, en la direccion calle Eusebio Ayala, al lado del Super Tigre.
Trabajó en la firma Taller de motos R.D. por 5 años, donde ganó todas las experiencias que hoy los pone en práctica actualmente en su propio taller de motos. Comenzó su taller con la ayuda de sus padres en el año 2009 en el mismo local donde se encuentra actualmente.
Tiene experiencia de 7 años en el ramo, cuenta con clientela formada, un local bastante concurrido por la ubicación que posee, bastante transitado, está ubicado en dirección del Banco Nacional de Fomento y varias firmas Comerciales muy concurridas, que lo favorecen.
texts.en:
Mr. Arcenio is from Paraguay, single, and 24 years old.  He lives in a rented house in the city of Curuguaty where he has a workshop named "Taller de motos Rubinho".  It is located in the Centro neighborhood, on Eusebio Ayala street, next to Super Tigre.

He worked in the R.D. motorcycle workshop for five years where he gained a lot of experience that he now puts to use in his own motorcycle workshop.  He started his business with the help of his parents in 2009, in the same location where he is now.

He has more than seven years' experience in this sector and has a set customer base, and a busy shop because of its location near the Banco Nacional de Fomento and several busy commercial firms.

loans.use: To buy repair parts and tools.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth, es socia del Banco Comunal Despertar, tiene 40 años, es conviviente, con 5 hijos, tiene una tienda de abarrotes en general, el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes para surtir su mercadería como: arroz, azúcar, fideos, harina, huevo, aceite, etc.
Elizabeth tiene una tienda de abarrotes en general en su casa comenzó de poquito, una amiga le habló e invitó a FINCA Perú, ya está hace 14 años, le agrada por la facilidad en los préstamos y se puede ahorrar. Con sus ahorros fue implementando poco a poco su negocio y se compró un terreno en la Selva de Ayacucho, la cual lo destinará para la siembra de cacao, ajonjolí.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a member of the Communal Bank “Despertar” (To Wake Up). She is 40 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has five children. Elizabeth manages a grocery store. The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of groceries to restock her inventory such as rice, sugar, noodles, flour, eggs, oil, and other items.

Elizabeth’s store is located in her home and she started out with very little. A friend spoke with her about FINCA Peru and invited her to join. She has been a member for 14 years and is grateful the convenience of the loans and having the ability to save. With her savings, she was able to establish her business a little bit at a time and also purchase a plot of land in the jungle of Ayacucho. She plans to use it for planting cacao and sesame.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, noodles, flour, eggs, oil, and other items.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba is single and has six children. She sells maize and corn dough at Elmina, which she has done for seven years. Corn dough is mostly used in the preparation of banku. She sees to the well-being of her home. Aba will use the loan to purchase sacks of maize to make more corn dough for sale. Aba plans to reinvest the new profits from her expanded business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of maize to make more corn dough to sell

loans.name: Alexander Antonio

texts.es: Alexander Antonio de 34 años de edad, habita en casa propia con su esposa  Sandra de 28 años y sus cuatro hijos,  tres de los cuales se encuentran estudiando, en una zona muy sencilla del país. Alexander es un hombre creativo, no pierde oportunidad para hacer cosas nuevas y atractivas. Él se dedica a la fabricación y venta ambulante de calzado para todas las edades, gustos y preferencias. Gracias a su carisma ha logrado establecer buena clientela ya que es un hombre amable y también porque cuando de zapatos se trata el siempre tiene lo que los clientes necesitan, además ofrece calidad y buenos precios en su zapatería. Gracias a este negocio ha logrado sacar adelante a su  familia y su sueño es seguir recibiendo los frutos del mismo que hasta el momento han sido muy favorables. Todo esto lo ha llevado a tomar la decisión de solicitar nuevo crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra de la materia prima necesaria como: cuero, pega, agujas, nylon, etc. para seguir elaborando variedad de zapatos que le permitan a traer a mas clientes, Alexander esta muy bien referenciado como cliente de esta institución. De esta manera espera seguir dando a su familia el pan de cada día y poder dar a sus hijas el estudio para que algún día se puedan convertir en grandes profesionales.
texts.en:
Alexander Antonio, 34, lives in his own house with his wife, Sandra, 28, and their four children, three of whom are in school, in a very simple part of the country.  

Alexander is a very creative man.  He does not let an opportunity to make new and attractive things pass him by.  He manufactures and is a street vendor of all sorts of footwear for all ages, tastes and preferences.  Thanks to his charisma he’s managed to establish a regular customer base because he’s a kind man and also because if it’s something to do with shoes, he always has what customers need.  Besides, he offers quality and affordable prices in his shoe shop.  Thanks to this business he’s been able to support his family and his dream is to continue enjoying the fruits of his labor which have been profitable to date.

All this has led him to call upon INTEGRAL to request a new loan to buy raw materials like: leather, glue, needles, nylon, etc. to continue making a variety of shoes that will attract more customers.

Alexander has very good references as a client of this institution.  He hopes this way to continue to provide his family with their daily bread and give his daughters schooling so that someday they can become great professionals.

loans.use: to buy necessary raw materials like leather, glue, needles, nylon, etc.

loans.name: Javier Orlando

texts.es:
Javier de 43 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en casa propia, la cual no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicado en la zona rural del distrito de Santa Cruz que pertenece al departamento de Cajamarca. Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y turismo.

Javier se dedica desde hace 2 años a la crianza y comercialización de ganado porcino (cerdos), su corral lo tiene en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada, una vez que lleguen a su crecimiento óptimo lo puede ofrecer a sus clientes y con los ingresos que obtenga puede solventar las necesidades de su hogar.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para comprar más animales de otras especies y una vez que se engorden los vende a los diferentes mercados de su zona, con la finalidad de que obtenga más clientes y así pueda tener mayores ingresos para brindarle a su familia  una mejor calidad de vida.  Javier es una persona responsable y trabajadora que lo único que desea es que su familia salga adelante y siempre esté unida.
texts.en:
Javier is 43 years old.  He owns the home he lives in with his wife and children.  It does not have electricity and running water.  The home is located in a rural area of the Santa Cruz district, which is in the state of Cajamarca.  This area is known for agriculture, ranching, and tourism. 

For the past 2 years Javier has raised and sold pigs.  He has a corral behind his home.  He feeds the animals with balanced feed, and once they reach the optimal size he sells them to customers.  The income he earns pays for his family's basic needs. 

He has requested a loan from Edpyma Alternativa for 1500 new soles to purchase more animals of other species.  Once they are fattened, he will sell them at different markets in the area, with the goal of gaining more customers and having a higher income, in order to provide his family with a better quality of life.  Javier is very responsible and hard-working.  The only thing he wants is for his family to get ahead and always be together.

loans.use: to purchase more animals of other species to stock his business.

loans.name: C5654 Twizamure Group

texts.en:
Peace is 39 years old and is married with four children between 1 and 12 years old. Her business is well-organized and is well known in this business of selling soft drinks. Peace is the team leader of this group which is called "TWIZAMURE" in the local language. 

In the picture, she is the first person on the right side and she is in the white shirt.  Her business hours are from 7am until 3pm every day except on Saturday, and she currently employs one person to help her.

Peace and her team have requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase their businesses. They will reinvest any profits in their businesses and save for their future. Also, Peace will be able to pay school fees for her children and to renovate her own house.

loans.use: To purchase various soft drinks for resale.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a hard-working businessman aged 39. He is married and blessed with four children. For the last four years, he has  been selling plastic items, including plastic sandals, to make a living. He has another source of income in farming. In the next 5 years, he wants to operate a hardware store. He is requesting a loan of 100,000 Kenya shillings to buy plastic sandals and plates. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his money.

loans.use: To buy plastic sandals and plates.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Jose Antonio se dedica desde hace 20 años al cultivo de maíz para consumo y venta, también el vende leña seca en su carreta de bueyes por las tardes después de su labor en el campo, sale a la ciudad de Nacaome a vender la leña para obtener ganancias para el sustento de su familia, Jose vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos, dos de ellos asisten a la escuela de la comunidad, la mayor parte de su vida, la ha dedicado al campo,  vive en una zona donde esa es la única fuente de ingreso que existe.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de leña seca, desea tener bastante leña porque en estos tiempos de lluvia se eleva el precio de la leña seca, de tanto que llueve es bien dificil secarla.

El tiene un sueño y es que sus hijos sean profesionales y salgan a buscar mejores opciones fuera de esa zona.
texts.en:
Mr. Jose Antonio has been growing corn for 20 years now, both for sale and personal consumption. In the afternoons, after his work in the fields, he also sells dried firewood from his oxcart. He goes out to the city of Nacaome to sell the firewood, in order to earn income to sustain his family. Jose lives with his wife and their three children, two of which attend school in their community. Jose has dedicated the better part of his life to the fields. He lives in a zone where this is the only source of income that exists.

He will use this loan to buy dried firewood. He would like to have enough firewood because during this rainy season, the price of dry firewood increases, since with so much rain, it is difficult to dry it.

Jose has a dream that his children will become professionals and go out to search for better options outside the zone where they live.

loans.use: to buy firewood to resell

loans.name: Moises Edwin

texts.es: El Sr. Edwin trabaja desde muy joven con la confección de prendas de vestir, inicialmente se dedicaba a realizar la confección de chamarras para varón, en la actualidad confecciona chalecos en tela polar, el producto se puede vender durante todo el año a sus diferentes clientes, el Señor Edwin aún es soltero y no tiene deudas en ninguna institución financiera, solamente tiene crédito en Emprender, ya trabajo anteriormente con crédito con montos menores mostrando mucha responsabilidad en sus pagos, a un futuro el quiere tener un negocio muy grande con un taller amplio y bien equipado, ya ahora esta adquiriendo experiencia y conociendo mejor el mercado, para posteriormente tener varios clientes a quien distribuir sus productos ya que el entrega sus pedidos por arriba de las 5 docenas, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la compra de una maquina elastiquera, Esta muy contento por ser un cliente preferencial y contar con el crédito Kiva.
texts.en: Edwin has been making clothes since he was very young.  He started out making men's jackets and currently makes fleece vests.  He sells his products year round to his different customers.  Edwin is still single and doesn't have debts with any financial institution.  He only has a loan from Emprender.  He already received a loan for a smaller sum and showed a lot of responsibility in making his repayments.  In the future, he would like to have a very large business with a large, well-equipped workshop.  He is currently gaining experience and increasing his knowledge of the market so that he will later have a number of customers to whom he will distribute his products.  He delivers his orders above 5 dozen.  Edwin will use his loan money to buy an overlock machine.  He is very happy to be a preferred client and receive a Kiva loan.

loans.use: to invest in buying an overlock machine

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is a thirty-four-year-old married man with four children, and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in mixed farming for ten years starting with one cow and a small plantation but now he has bought more land. His hardship is limited capital and his vision is a big commercial farm and educating his children. Francis needs the loan to buy banana shoots for planting.

loans.use: to buy banana stems for planting.

loans.name: Aijamal's Group

texts.en:
Aijamal is a member of this group. She is 31 years old, married to a mechanic, and has three children, one of whom attends school.  

Aijamal works in a pharmacy; she started this job three years ago. Her monthly salary is 5,000 soms. She is requesting a loan, which she will use  to purchase children’s furniture. In the future, Aijamal hopes to open a private pharmacy. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious, and socially-focused microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly), and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our lending team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase children's furniture.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Jumiltepec Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama Jumiltepec, está conformado por la señora Ana Bertha va a comprar con su préstamo zapatos y catálogos de temporada, la señora Joaquina va a comprar leña, carbón, arroz, aceite, azúcar para elaborar tacos acorazados, la señora Santa Rosa va a comprar flores por mayoreo, la señora Teresita de Jesús va a comprar azúcar, frascos para la venta de miel, la señora María Félix va a comprar aguacate por mayoreo, las señoras María Rachel,  Justina y Esther van a comprar harina, azúcar, el señor Miguel Ángel va a comprar papel higiénico, azúcar, sal, jabón, aceite, refrescos, pan Bimbo, galletas, la señora Aida va a comprar malteada, te, aloe, proteínas. La señora Justina tiene 63 años de edad, ella es viuda tiene 11 hijos, 7 mujeres y 4 varones ya todos trabajan, ella elabora pan de dulce, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar harina, azúcar, manteca, huevo, vainilla, canela y leña para elaborar el pan de dulce, conchas, besos, cemitas, ella inicio su negocio hace 35 años, con los ahorros de su trabajo compro los insumos, ella trabajaba con su tía y veía como elaboraba el pan y aprendió a hacer el pan. Su negocio es importante porque no les hace falta para comer, ella elabora el pan cada 8 días los días jueves y domingos sus hijas le ayudan a elaborar el pan, ella sale a vender sus productos a la ciudad ya tiene a sus clientes de años que ya saben los días que vende, ya vende sus productos y ya tiene dinero para comprar comida y llevarles a sus nietos, ella utiliza las ganancia para pagar deudas, para volver a invertir y para la comida. Sus sueños y esperanzas son vivir bien, tranquila y ser feliz con su familia y lo mejor para sus hijos. Los integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “gracias por sus préstamos, estamos agradecidos con ustedes gracias a su ayuda podemos salir adelante con los negocios”.
texts.en:
This communal bank group is called Jumiltepec. It consists of Señora Ana Bertha who with her loan is going to buy shoes and seasonal calalogues;  Señora Joaquina who is going to buy firewood, coal, rice, oil, sugar to make tacos  'acorazados' (battleship tacos are massive corn tortillas with rice and beef - hence the 'battleship' terminology); Señora Santa Rosa is going to buy flowers wholesale; Señora Teresita de Jesús is going to buy sugar and jars for selling honey; Señora María Félix is going to buy avocados wholesale; Señoras María Rachel, Justina y Esther are going to buy sugar, flour; Señor Miguel Ángel is going to buy toilet paper, sugar, salt, soap, oil, soft drinks, Bimbo bread, cookies; Señora Aida is going to buy milkshakes, tea, aloe, proteins. 

Señora Justina is 63 years old. She is a widow and has 11 children, 7 females and 4 males, all of whom work now. She makes sweet bread. She is asking for a loan to buy flour, sugar, butter, eggs, vanilla, cinnamon and firewood with which to make her sweet bread and pastries (called shells and kisses) and white bread rolls. She started her business 35 years ago and with the savings from the business bought the ingredients. She used to work with her aunt and watched her make the bread and learned how to do the same. The business is important because with it they never lack for food. She makes bread every 8 days. On Thursdays and Sundays her daughters help her make the bread. She goes to town to sell her products as she has customers that date back years and know the days she sells on. She sells her products that gives her the money to buy food for her grandchildren. She uses the profit to pay off debts, reinvest and for food. Her dreams and hopes are to live well, quiet and happy with her family and also wishes the best for her children. The members of the group want to thank Kiva and the Fundacion Realidad: "Thank you for the loans; we are grateful to you. Thanks to your help we can move forwards with our businesses."

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, butter, eggs, vanilla, cinnamon and firewood.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 51 years old and has only one child who is now 30 years old and had settled down and married but still lives with her. At Maria's age, she is thankful for having three lovely grandchildren.

Maria sells fruits and vegetables at the market. She also sells eggs, onions, and vinegars. Maria rents a stall in the market. She has been running her business for almost 10 years and earns about P2,000 each month. She utilizes it well for electric bills, meals, and sometimes providing daily snacks and allowances of her grandchildren. 

Maria is now asking for P25,000 to have additional funds to buy more eggs, cabbage, and tomatoes to sell in her store.

Maria's goal is to also own a stall in the market because paying for the rental is an additional expense for her.

loans.use: to buy more eggs, cabbage, and tomatoes to sell in her store.

loans.name: Hudson

texts.en:
Hudson is age 50. He is married with 8 children. Three are adults with the other five being minors still in school.
He has been in farming in his home area of Kitale,Western Kenya for five years producing and selling maize, milk, vegetables and tomatoes for the local market. 

Hudson has made a loan request amounting to 50,000 KES with Juhudi Kilimo to construct a greenhouse to use in growing tomatoes. He says this will boost his farming income with his supplies being stable throughout the year. He hopes to redouble his farming income especially that from tomatoes and vegetables in the near future.

Huddson notes that high costs of farm inputs coupled with animal diseases remain the major undoing in the farming business.

loans.use: To construct  a greenhouse

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es: La socia continua con su negocio de compra y venta de vestidos y ternos, la socia trabaja especificamente con la ropa americana, ella desea a futuro muy cercano y esta haceindo todo lo mejor posible para tener su propia tienda de venta de ropa y  su propio local para ella atreverse a traer ropa americana al por mayor. La socia en esta ocasión esta deseando invertir el credito en la compra de ropa al por mayor americana y pagar el trasporte.
texts.en: This member continues her business buying and selling dresses and suits. She works specifically with American clothes. She wishes for the near future to have her own clothes store and she is doing everything possible to do this. With it, she would bring in American clothes wholesale. On this occasion, she wants to invest her loan in buying clothes wholesale and paying for the transportation.

loans.use: to invest the loan in buying American clothes wholesale and pay for transportation.

loans.name: Malai

texts.en:
Malai and her husband, Sovann, are rice and lotus farmers. In addition, Sovann is also a fisherman. They have been married since 1988 and have three sons and one daughter. One child is a construction worker, another one is a teacher and the other two attend school. They live in a village about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Malai is asking for a loan of $1,000 to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her rice and lotus farm. 

Photo: Malai is at home, not at the farm.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her rice and lotus farm.

loans.name: Donabel

texts.en:
Donabel is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children. 

Donabel has a food shop or restaurant that sells viands like afritada (a chicken or pork stew with vegetables and tomatoes), fried chicken, and halang-halang (spicy chicken with coconut milk and chili peppers). She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for the food shop.

Donabel is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for her food shop.

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en:
Jamal is a 28-year-old single man who owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for himself. 

Jamal has operated a phone accessories selling business for the past 1 year; his potential clients are local villagers. He dreams of expanding his business.

With the Kshs 30,000 he wants to purchase more phone accessories like batteries, phone covers and other spare parts for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access capital to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more phone accessories like batteries, phone covers and other spare parts for resale.

loans.name: Gnarisso Benkadi 5 Group

texts.fr:
Les  membres du groupe  Gnarisso Benkadi  5 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles  traditionnelles à  Soké, un des villages de San, 4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  Le riz  avec    KARIA  ,2 eme assise de la droite vers la gauche  sur  la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter, des petits matériels agricoles, des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,75 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et au marché de San, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 100.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Gnarisso Benkadi 5 group are married women with an average age of 35, on average 5 children, and who all live in traditional family environments in Soké, one of the villages in San, the 4th administrative region of Mali. They are collaborating with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to be able to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their 2nd loan with the institution. The previous loans have all been correctly repaid.

Karia, sitting second from the right in the picture, farms rice. She plans to use her loan to buy small agricultural equipment, agricultural inputs and seeds, and to pay for the labourers needed to maintain three quarters of a hectare of farmland. After the harvest, the produce will be sold in her village and at the San market, to a clientele composed of men and women. She expects to make an average profit of 100 000 francs per crop cycle. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband with the daily living expenses.

loans.use: to pay labour costs and buy agricultural inputs and small equipment, and seeds.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily lives in Kitale. Emily is married and has five children. She is the chairperson of her constituency’s development committee. She is also engaged in farming. She has been farming for thirty-six years now and she is currently growing maize, beans and vegetables and she also keeps livestock. Emily is excited about beekeeping as it will earn her some income from the sale of honey.

This is Emily’s first loan with Honey Care and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to provide for her family’s needs. Emily’s hope for the future is to live a good life.

Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential beekeeping region.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Ingenzi Group

texts.en: Ingenzi is a group led by Delphine who is 55 years old. The group's name means “Important person” in English. She has been a group leader for six years. She sells soft drinks and has been doing the business for past four years. The group members sell different items and they have the same idea for changing their life. With the loan, she would like to buy more sorghum to make more soft drinks to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children and renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum to make more soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi est une femme mariée âgée de 29 ans habitant à Baguida. Mère de deux enfants, Afi est une marchande de pagnes qui s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché et le revend dans son atelier sis à son domicile. Pour commander des pièces de pagnes, Afi demande ce prêt afin d’acquérir un grand nombre de stock et mieux revendre puis avoir une bonne marge bénéficiaire et soutenir sa famille dans certaines charges et permettre aussi une bonne éducation scolaire à ses enfants.
texts.en: Abla is a 29-year-old married woman and mother of two who lives in Baguida.  She sells "pagnes" (colorful West African fabrics) and stocks up three times per month at the market.  She resells her goods in her shop, next to her home.  She is taking this loan to buy a large stock of fabrics and increase her sales.  Her goal is to get a good profit margin so that she can take care of some of her family's expenses and give a good education to her children.

loans.use: to buy 10 units of fabrics.

loans.name: Walter

texts.en:
Don Walter has successfully repaid his first loan, and he is now looking to extend his credit so that he can buy a freezer and other items used to prepare chicken. His mother and wife help run the business when he goes into town to sell his goods. With 30 years of experience, Walter has definitely grown over the years. Originally, he started out by selling a few select items on a table in front of his parents’ house. Competing lenders in his area charge 20%, and he had to pay daily! There are commercial banks that exist in his area, but they offer consumer loans and production loans if borrowers have guarantees (usually tangible assets). Without these resources, Mr. CasaG. is turning once again to Kiva and Mifex to keep his business growing.

He was afraid of being in debt with a loan. The loan sharks offer money, but the with the steep interest and daily payments, it was impossible for him to have access to credit. He invested the capital in the purchase of new inventory. The capital from Kiva helped him invest high-turnover products in wholesale and, more importantly, in cash. He feels this gave him an advantage in prices, which has helped him financially improve his daily life. Don Walter repaid his loan on time, and is now asking for another loan from Mifex and Kiva to continue investing in his business and providing the services his clients demand like meats and a freezer to keep his goods fresh.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Continue investing in his business and providing the services his clients demand like meats and a freezer to keep his goods fresh.

loans.name: Maurice

texts.en:
Maurice has been in the food business for the last five years. He is single but takes care of his parents. He started the business with $100 which he borrowed from a friend. He has taken a loan from ECLOF and repaid the loan successfully.

He is seeking a loan to expand his business by opening new branches and buying quality cows to slaughter for meat. He currently relies on other traders who do not supply quality meat.

He will use his profit to marry, buy two cows and build a house at home.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Carlos sells small electric domestic applianes in urban zones. Carlos began his business through a loan of $100.00. At the beginning he only sold plastics door to door. Now he offers the same service but also electric devices. His ambition is to adapt his home to a place where he can display his products. He is very sure that his customers will be happier with this new service and that their numbers will grow.Carlos is married. He is 38 and has 3 children, 2 who are in school. He is convinced that this loan will improve the economic situation of his family and his business will continue to grow so that he can save and give a better education to his children.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Carlos vende pequeños electrodomésticos en zonas urbanas. Carlos empezó su negocio prestando la cantidad de 100 dólares a su cuñado. Al principio solo se dedicaba a la venta de plásticos puerta a puerta. Ahora ofrece este mismo servicio junto con pequeños electrodomésticos. El aspira adecuar en su vivienda un local para exhibir la mercadería. El tiene la plena seguridad que con este nuevo servicio sus clientes se sentirán contentos y va ha tener crecimiento. Carlos esta unido. Tiene 38 años tiene tres hijos dos de ellos estudian. El esta convencido que con este préstamo mejorara el nivel económico de su familia y seguirá creciendo en el negocio para ahorrar y darles una mejor educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: Adapt his home to his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in metal and other raw materials for her shop

loans.name: Faapaia

texts.en: Leaving school at a young age did not discourage her to operate a business. She hails from the village of Falelatai, married with three kids. Faapaia operates a Flea Market business selling handicrafts. She just joined the Program last month when she needed help for her business. She earns $150.00-$200.00 per day

loans.use: To buy more stuff for flea market

loans.name: Kehinde

texts.en: "Being a LAPO member is not a mistake for me. I have been with LAPO for a year. I hope to improve my business and standard of living of my family through the US$ 250 loan I am requesting," says Mrs. Kehinde O., who is 38 years old, married with 4 children, and lives in Benin City, Edo State of Nigeria.

loans.use: To buy more garri, plantains, & coco yams

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
Ricardo is 55 years old and has been married for 33 of those to Guillerma López, 52. They have six children, two of whom are married, one who is living abroad, and the other three still live with them. One of their children who lives at home is paralyzed from a soccer accident.

Thirty-three years ago, Ricardo was employed at a private business and, at the same time, was taking a carpentry course that lasted six months. At the end of it, he decided to start his own business with the little savings he had from his work.

Ricardo is very proud of his business because with it he can provide for his family. He's requesting a loan to purchase wood, nails and glue because he has been given a large order and needs these materials to begin the labor.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

El Señor Ricardo O. de 55 años de edad esta casado hace 33 años con la señora Guillerma López de 52 años de edad; el matrimonio tiene seis hijos de los cuales dos ya están casados, uno de ellos se encuentra viviendo en el exterior y los tres últimos aún viven con ellos. Uno de sus hijos que vive con ellos quedó paralítico cuando practicaba football (soccer).

Hace 33 años, Don Ricardo, era empleado de una empresa privada, al mismo tiempo seguía un curso para carpinteros que duró 6 meses, al final de este curso decidió emprender su propio negocio con un poco de ahorro que había juntado de su anterior trabajo.

Ricardo se encuentra muy orgulloso de su trabajo, ya que con el puede solventar los gastos de la familia. El hoy solicita un crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de maderas, clavos, pegamento ya que ha recibido un pedido grande y necesita de estos materiales para empezar su trabajo.

loans.use: Purchase wood, nails, glue, etc.

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es:
Hermelinda is a very cheerful woman who some time ago observed that the places where the members of her community went to enjoy cold, refreshing drinks were very far away. She had the idea to make the most of this and fix up her house to make it a fun, distracting place for people. Today, her small bar is going very well for her. However, an unfortunate accident interrupted her tranquility. Her 16-year-old son left with his father to repair his car, and when he was crossing the street, a car ran him over. Thanks to the fact that they acted quickly, they took him to the nearest hospital and were able to save his life. Now they are recuperating from this painful event and hope to put it behind them. As a result of this, Hermelinda hopes to establish her business and make it prosperous, with the aim of also growing coffee so she can start its production. You can help her, don't forget.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Hermelinda, una dama muy jovial que hace tiempo atrás observó que los lugares en los que los miembros de su comunidad disfrutaban de unas frías y refrescantes bebidas se encontraban muy alejados, concibió la idea de aprovechar este hecho para implementar y ambientar su casita hasta convertirlo en un lugar de distracción y diversión para las personas y hoy le va muy bien en su pequeño bar.Sin embargo un fatídico accidente quebró su tranquilidad, cuando su hijo de 16 años salió con su padre a reparar su automóvil de pronto cruzó el sendero y un auto lo atropelló, gracias a que actuaron con gran rapidez y pudieron llevarlo al hospital más cercano lograron salvarle la vida.Ahora se están recuperando de este penoso hecho y desean dejarlo atrás. A raíz de este hecho anhela establecer su negocio y hacerlo prospero a fin de también sembrar café para poder incursionar en su producción.Usted puede ayudarla, no lo olvide.

loans.use: Injection of capital to increase the products that she offers

loans.name: Manzura

texts.ru:
Manzura S. is 24 years old, she has secondary education, divorced with no children. Manzura has a small plot of land attached to the house. Because the sowing season has almost arrived, Manzura plans to use the loan to buy seeds of wheat for a lower price than they will cost in a few weeks. The loan will give her an opportunity to buy the seeds, sow her crop area, cultivate it and harvest it and keep it for her family as she uses the wheat to make flour for bread for personal use. She has been doing it for the past 5 years.

Manzura plans to pay off the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Шоева Манзура, возраст – 24 года, образование – среднее, разведенная, детей не имеет. Манзура имеет небольшой приусадебный участок. Так как наступает посевной сезон, Манзура на полученный кредит планирует приобрести семена пшеницы по менее дорогой цене, чем она будет через несколько недель. Кредит даст ей возможность приобрести семена пшеницы, засеять свой участок и собрать урожай, который она оставит для своей семьи, так как они использует пшеницу для перемола в муку и выпечку хлеба для личного потребления. Она уже в течение 5 лет занимается этим видом деятельности.

Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy wheat seeds

loans.name: Ida Kokoe Ayi

texts.fr:
At 45 years old, Madame Ida Kokoe Ayi K. is married and the mother of five children. Previously being an operator, she quickly left this job to start her own business selling telephone recharge cards. Being a very friendly person, she quickly attracted many customers and now she is often confronted with diminished stock. In order to improve her business, she is asking for a loan in order to ensure she will always have sufficient stock and be able to satisfy customer demand. With realization of this dream will give her higher revenue and consequently an improved standard of living for her family.

Translated from French to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Agée de 45 ans, Madame K. Ayi Kokoè Ida est mariée et mère de cinq (5) enfants. Etant Opératrice de saisie, elle a vite laissé cet emploi et s’est lancée dans le commerce de vente de cartes de recharge. Très accueillante, elle a su vite avoir plus de clientèle et maintenant, elle est souvent confronté à de fréquente rupture de stock. Pour mettre fin à cette situation, elle sollicite un financement afin d’avoir en permanence de stock et satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle. A travers ce rêve, elle disposera d’un revenu sur pour la satisfaction des besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: Purchase and sale of recharge cards (mostly telephone related)

loans.name: Edilberto

texts.es:
Edilberto has big dreams of become a well-known livestock farmer on his beautiful land and knows that with big dreams comes big effort, so he now works with a definitive goal. He cultivates potatoes to sell at market in the city of Tarma, and he also has cows that he dedicates a lot of care for. His three children help him take them to remote fields to graze. He wants to set up a cow shed and has decided to invest a large portion of his harvest earnings to acquire breeding cows.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Edilberto, tiene el gran sueño de ser un ganadero reconocido en su linda tierra y sabe que detrás de un sueño hay gran esfuerzo, es así que él desde ahora trabaja con un norte definido, cultiva papa que es vendida en el mercado de Tarma y también tiene vacas a los cuales cría con mucha dedicación y en familia, sus 3 hijos son su ayuda los lleva a campos recónditos para pastarlos. Desea implementar su establo y ha decidido invertir gran parte de la ganancia de sus cosechas para adquirir vacas de raza.

loans.use: Acquire breeding cows / Compra de vacas de raza.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Juliana T. is forty years old and the mother of five children. She is a food vendor who sells banku at a local community. Banku is one of the best local foods, prepared from maize, and is enjoyed by most Ghanaians. She used to buy the maize on credit at a very expensive price, but thanks to the loan, she now buys with cash at a moderate price, she says. She wants to use the new loan to buy more bags of maize for keeping, as a result of increasing food prices, which can drain her profit. Alice, one of her children, is in the photo, since Juliana had gone to buy products from the market.

loans.use: To buy more bags of maize, palm fruits, peanut butter, vegetables, frozen foods, etc.

loans.name: Sarwar's Group

texts.en: Sarwar is 36 years old and is married to T. Mahmood, who is 43 years old. She lives in a two room brick house in Kasur, Pakistan. She is a mother of one daughter and four sons, and her daughter is in kindergarten. Her eldest son, who is 12 years old, works in a shoe factory. The next oldest also makes shoes. Sarwar herself sells milk. She has applied for a loan of $1,250 for her husband who wants to lease land on contract and thereby earn the income necessary to educate Ali Ahsan and Danish, their younger sons.  Sarwar has been joined in her loan group by a few more members:  Nasreen wants to expand her business of repairing local busses; Sakina wants to expand her food distributing business; Razia wants to expand her gentlemen's shoe business; and Bismillah wants to buy an auto-rickshaw.  This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses.

loans.name: Nicolaza De La Conce

texts.es:
Mrs. Nicolaza A. owns her own mini market in the city of Chinandega, where she offers her customers all types of groceries.

She is the mother of two school-age children for whom she works arduously in order to provide them with an education and better living conditions.

Now she urgently needs to obtain funds in order to purchase goods. For this reason, she is turning to Ceprodel in order to receive a loan that will allow her to continue selling groceries in her market.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La dama Nicolaza A. se dedica al negocio de pulpería teniendo su propio establecimiento en la ciudad de Chinandega donde atiende a sus clientes ofreciéndole todo tipo de de productos de pulpería.

Es madre de dos hijos en edades escolares y su arduo trabajo es para brindarles mejores condiciones de vida y desarrollo en sus estudios.

La necesidad que ella atraviesa hoy en día es la urgencia de obtener el recurso económico para la compra de los productos . Por esto es que acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con el crédito para que de esta manera continúe comercializando sus productos en su localidad.

loans.use: Purchase goods

loans.name: Creciendo Hacia El Futuro, Groups 1 And 2

texts.en: Anny Belkys T., 35, is married and the mother of three--aged 11, 9, and 5.  She is currently in her 6th loan cycle with her Esperanza Bank of Hope Creciendo Hacia el Futuro ("Growing Towards the Future"), of which she is a group leader. With her future loans she hopes to move her salon into a bigger shop and to one day be able to have paid employees.  Anny's primary goal is, however, to be able to improve the quality of life of her three children.

loans.use: This group would like to improve their various businesses, like Anny who would like to improve her salon.

loans.name: Ya

texts.en:
Mrs. Ya C. is a 30-year-old rice farmer. She earns about $1.60 per day. She lives in Anlong Somnor Commune, Sieap Reap Province. Her husband, Mr. Kren Vu, is a 33-year-old fisherman, and fishes around Tunle Sap Lake. He earns approximately $3.00 per day. They live with their four children and grandparents.

To increase the family's income, Mrs. Ya would like to request a loan of $300 to use for her husband's fishing tools. The loan allows for growing the business and increases income.

loans.use: To use for husband's fishing business, to purchase fishing tools

loans.name: Jairo Rufino

texts.es:
hola mi nombre es Jairo F. me dedico a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tengo mi negocio hace un par de años, tambien trabajo con UNICOMER que es una compañia que distribuye productos de cosumo a nivel nacional esto debido  a que la situacion economica es muy dificil y deseo superarme monetariamente para darles una mejor calidad de vida a mi esposa e hijos que son lo mas importante en mi vida. mi esposa es que atiende la pulperia por las mañanas ya que en la tarde que yo llego atiendo el nogocio y ella pasa a ver las tareas y las necesidades de mis hijos.
en estos momentos necesito un credito para poder sacar adelante mi negocio.
texts.en:
Hello, my name is Jario F.. I work selling popular consumable products. I have had my business for a few years. I also work with UNICOMER that is a company that distributes consumables at a national level. I do this because the economic situation is very difficult and I want to improve my monetary position in order to give a better quality of live to my wife and children, who are the most important part of my life. My wife works in the general store in the mornings and in the afternoon when I arrive to attend the store she goes to check on homework and the needs of my children. At the moment I need a loan in order to move my business forward.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Noeme

texts.es: Noeme tiene 34 años, vive con su esposo Adolfo de 35, el cual se dedica a trabajar en su motocarro, y con sus hijos; Ester de 14 años y Juan José de 5. Desde hace 8 años, se dedica a la venta de comida de forma ambulatoria, actividad que realiza desde las 11 de la mañana hasta las 7 u 8 de la noche, en la plaza dominical de la ciudad de Juliaca.  Es una mujer trabajadora, en busca de un mejor bienestar para su familia, dedica varias horas a su trabajo, el cual es muy cansado, por la cantidad de clientela que frecuenta su negocio, siendo esto al mismo tiempo muy bueno, ya que puede generar más ingresos a la economía familiar. Noeme quiere ofrecerles a sus hijos un mejor futuro, para que hagan sus sueños realidad.  Con el dinero que solicita, comprará mayor cantidad de ingredientes para preparar sus ricos platos y complacer a su clientela que día a día se hace más grande; y en el futuro poner un pequeño restaurante, el cual pueda administrar desde su casa.
texts.en:
Noeme is 34 years old and lives with her 35 year old husband, Adolfo, and her children: Ester who is 14 years old and Juan Jose who is 5 years old. Adolfo makes a living by using his car. For the past 8 years, Noeme has sold food on the streets, working from 11:00 in the morning to 7:00 or 8:00 at night in the main plaza in the city Juliaca. She is a working woman in search of a better life for her family. She dedicates many hours to work, which is very tiring due to the quantity of clients that visit her business; at the same time, this is good because she can generate more income for her family. Noeme would like to offer her children a better future so that they can make their dreams a reality. With the money she is requesting, she will buy more ingredients to prepare her delicious dishes and please her clientele that increases each day. In the future, she would like to have a small restaurant that she could run out of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to prepare food for sale

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Lirio (“Iris”) Village Bank. 
Maria is 42 years old and married with seven children. Maria travels three times per week to regional markets where she buys grains, guinea pigs (a Peruvian delicacy), and pigs, which she then sells in the Ayacucho city markets as well as from her home. She sometimes slaughters the animals herself to sell for meat. Maria needs a loan of 1000 soles, which she will use to buy pigs and grains. 
Maria’s dreams are to have her own investment capital and to build a home of her own. 
Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Lirio. 
Maria es casada, tiene 42 años y 7 hijos, Maria viaja 3 veces a la semana a las ferias de la región en donde compran cereales, cuy, cerdos, que luego los comercializa en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho y también en su casa, en algunas oportunidades beneficia los animales. 
Maria necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cerdo y cereales. 
Los sueños de Maria son tener capital propio para su negocio y construir su casa.

loans.use: Buy pigs and grains

loans.name: Palattao

texts.en:
Mrs. M. Palattao, 33 years old and married with five children, lives in Tuburan, Katipunan, Zamboanga del Norte. At a young age she was forced to earn a living for her family and so started a sari-sari store to support their daily needs. She decided to join Paglaum MPC in September of 2006 and now is requesting a loan to buy load wallets (Electronic Loading) and cases of soft drinks & beverages for her sari-sari.

Mrs. Palattao wants to expand her store into a mini – grocery someday. Seeing her children finish their studies and obtain stable careers is her greatest hope as a mother.

loans.use: To buy load wallets (electronic loads) and cases of soft drinks and beverages.

loans.name: Winifred

texts.en:
Born on the 28th December 1968, Winifred is married with five children; she lives in Musang, a quarter in Bamenda, Cameroon. She intends to invest this loan in her motorbike transport business. She plans to purchase a motor bike and fuel and pay for the documents with her loan of 500,000 cfa.

Winifred has been a GHAPE client since September 9th, 2003 and this is her fifth loan. She has seen that there is a high demand in her community for transport and this is her second time in the motorbike business. She plans to contribute to her community by transporting residents to various destination of their choice.

This loan will help her financial situation by providing her with a quick turnover investment and high profits through her motorbike transport business. Moreover, Winifred sells vegetables in the food market in Bamenda to cover daily family expenses when there less work for motorbikes.

With the profits from this loan, Winifred plans to pay for her daughter to enroll in the university and construct her own house. She also will make sure her family eats well and stays healthy. Finally, she hopes to place much of her profit into her personal savings account that GHAPE provided for her. She is happy to be taking out another loan with GHAPE, and she knows her success will be greater with each loan as she receives more business and life skills training from GHAPE.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Buying a motor bike, fuel, and the documents for the motorbike

loans.name: Mari

texts.en:
Mari M. is 25 years old, married, and the mother of 3 children. Two are in elementary school, while the last born is breastfeeding. She is really dedicated to her work and supportive of her children. By her own effort and hard work through her business, Mari has supported her husband to start a farming business in the area of vegetables.

Mari owns and operates a cosmetics shop in the local market of Abofour, where she lives. She believes she can make her business grow bigger and brighter with loan support and wants to use the loan to buy more assorted cosmetics to increase her stock of goods. She believes this would help her to send her child to a good school next year. Mari belongs to a village bank called Jabaz. She also hopes to receive GH500 to make business progress by restocking her inventory. This would enable her to save more to support her home.

loans.use: To buy more clothing materials and assorted cosmetics

loans.name: Dy

texts.en:
D., 47, raises pigs from her home as well as working as a local rice farmer. She is a widow and the mother of five children, all of whom are single and most of whom are employed. One of her employed sons' name is Him, 27, and to help meet the family's daily expenses, he carves wood from the forest to sell for income.

D. is applying for a loan to buy a water buffalo for her son use to transport wood for sale.

loans.use: To buy a water buffalo

loans.name: Seam

texts.en: Seam P., 42, is married with four children and resides with her husband in Kampong Cham province. She sells fried bananas to earn a living and is able to make about US$ 5 per day, and her husband makes US$ 5 selling wood. All of their children are students. Seam P. would like to request a loan to purchase land so she can start cultivation to have an additional profit to raise their standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase land to expand cultivation

loans.name: Mamunatu

texts.en:
Mamunatu I. is thirty-nine years old and married with two children who are currently in school. She lives with her husband and children in Eguase in the central region of Ghana. She sells local rice. Local rice is mostly harvested in the northern part of Ghana. She is also a food vendor who prepares “waakye” and stew. Waakye is local rice enjoyed by many Ghanaians.

She treks to the northern region to buy her raw materials like bags of rice in bulk, with other needed items like meat, beans, vegetable oil, etc. Mamunatu started this business when she was twenty-one years old. It means she was very young when she started this food production. She is facing a financial crisis in trying to expand her business and she wants a loan to buy more bags of the local rice, gallons of vegetable oil, meat, etc. With the loan she believes she can be fully able to realize this dream of hers to be successful in business. She will be grateful for your assistance. Mamunatu belongs to a village bank called ‘Won som’ which means 'let all help’. She hopes to receive a loan make her business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy more bags of the local rice, gallons of vegetable oil, meat, etc.

loans.name: Inoyat

texts.ru: Иноят открыла маленький  магазин у себя дома. Она живет в поселке, который начал свое существование 3 года назад и, увидев, что открытие магазинчика принесет хорошую прибыль, она решила этим заняться. Муж Иноят находится в России на заработках, а она вместе со своими тремя детьми живет здесь. Иноят решила немного расширить свой бизнес и поэтому решила получить займ на КИВА.
texts.en:
Inoyat opened a small store in her home. She lives in a village that began its existence 3 years ago and having seen that the opening of a store will bring good profits she decided to do this. Inoyat’s husband is in Russia earning money and she together with her three children lives here. Inoyat decided to expand her business a little bit and this is why she decided to take out a loan on KIVA.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Grow business

loans.name: Ni Wayan Sendri

texts.en: Ni Wayan Sendri (DNR.M-0663) is a 49-year-old woman living in the town of Manistutu - Melaya. She is married and has a school-aged child. To make a living, Ni Wayan Sendri raises pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over 19 years and earns approximately 300,000 - 400,000 IDR a month. In 2007, Ni Wayan Sendri joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,000,000 IDR from DINARI. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. Ni Wayan Sendri is now requesting a new loan of 1,500,000 IDR which will be used to purchase additional animals. The loan will be her 4th loan from DINARI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. About DINARI: The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** Ni Wayan Sendri - (DNR.M-0663) merupakan 49 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Manistutu - Melaya. Dia (perempuan) menikah dan memiliki 1 anak usia sekolah. Untuk membiayai hidup, Ni Wayan Sendri memiliki & menjalankan usaha. Bisnis beroperasi di sektor pertanian. Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah memelihara ternak. Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual. Ni Wayan Sendri sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 19 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Wayan Sendri menghasilkan sekitar 300,000 - 400,000 IDR sebulan. Dalam 2007, Ni Wayan Sendri bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. Ni Wayan Sendri meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari DINARI. Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk membeli ternak indukan. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1,500,000 IDR. Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli hewan tambahan. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 4th pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI. Ni Wayan Sendri berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis untuk tabungan sebagai cadangan bagi keadaan darurat di masa mendatang. Tentang DINARI: Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil. *Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva."

loans.use: To purchase additional livestock

loans.name: Santos Del Pilar

texts.es: Santos del Pilar M. Hernández tiene la edad de 43 años, es madre soltera. Tiene 4 hijos y todos estudian. Santos es una mujer con todo el deseo de superarse. Es una vendedora de mercadería en general. Hace más de 19 años que se dedica a este negocio. Y por medio de un sobrino fue que decidió ingresar en este negocio, es mujer muy activa ya que siempre esta pendiente de lo que sus clientes solicitan. Por lo que su vida ha cambiado ya que de esta manera obtuvo estabilidad económica. Este dinero le ayudara a la compra de calzado, bolsos, ropa interior, cosméticos. Su mayor desafío es cuando tiene que buscar los productos en  Managua por que se expone a muchos peligros. Sus sueños son de establecer un negocio en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Santos del Pilar M. Hernández is 43 years of age and a single mother with four children, all of whom are still in school. Santos is a woman who really wants to better herself. She is a saleswoman for general merchandise and she's been in this business for more than 19 years. It was because of a nephew that she decided to get into this business. She's a very active woman who is always thinking about what her customers are requesting. As a result, her life has changed since she has attained economic stability. This money would help her to buy footwear, purses, underwear and cosmetics. Her greatest challenge is when she has to go to look for products in Managua where she is exposed to many dangers. Her dream is to set up a business in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For working capital.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Mrs. Touch Y. was born in 1959 and she now lives in Dei Eth Koh Pohs village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Sin Chhuon, are farmers who own a small piece of land on which they cultivate vegetables. In this, they face an obstacle because their field is infertile, which it is a bad enough to affect their plants. Thus, Mrs. Touch Y. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and she would use the rest of money to purchase pesticide.

Mrs. Touch Y. has eight children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while another is a vegetable seller; another three are fishers and help their parents’ work and the remaining two are attending the local school. Her husband is shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.en:
Emiliana raises pigs to help her husband support and improve their poor living situation. She is now 54 years old and a mother of five who are all married. Her husband is a local farmer in their community. They live in the rural area of Nabbotuan Solana, Cagayan.
 In order to support her hog raising feed supply, Emiliana is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders of PHP7,000. The amount will be of great help to her business. Aside from that, Emiliana sometimes sells vegetables in their village. 
Her dream is to make her business grow and she is thankful because Kiva came in the right time at the exact place. She hopes that Kiva loans will become successful in their mission to help the needy people, especially those who are small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Remario

texts.en:
Remario L. is a rice farm owner and father of four children.
