He admitts that its really hard being a father especially when the children are starting to ask for their school allowance, books, and money for projects. Good that he has a rice farm and the harvest that he gets helps a lot in providing the needs of his family.

He is asking for a loan of Php 10,000. He will use it to buy complete fertilizers and insecticides. Farming is his only way to pay everything in their home; he needs to at least improve his harvest to help his family more. CEVI helps him in growing his business. He receives loans, training, and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To buy complete fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria tiene 48 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 menores hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace más de 20 años se dedica a la ganadería, diariamente acude a su establo para alimentar a sus animales y en otras ocasiones los lleva a espacios abiertos con pastos frescos. Por las mañanas vende la leche que obtiene de sus vacas y cuando los becerros han crecido, los vende a muy buenos precios en las diferentes ferias ganaderas de su localidad. Su esposo y sus hijos la apoyan en estas tareas, ya que es una actividad familiar y la fuente principal de sus ingresos económicos, por lo que unen esfuerzos para lograr aumentar sus ganancias cada vez más. El deseo de Victoria a futuro es lograr que todo su ganado esté conformado por animales de muy buena raza, pues eso incrementaría su valor. Esta es la quinta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, sus ganas de progreso la han llevado a ser una de las integrantes más activas de su banco comunal y en esta oportunidad continuará  realizando un trabajo responsable. El dinero que solicita será utilizado en la compra de una vaquilla para incrementar la cantidad de animales que tiene.
texts.en:
Victoria is 48 years old. She lives with her husband and two minor children in their own house. For over twenty years she has worked with cattle. Daily she goes to the barn to feed the animals. On other occasions she takes them to open spaces with green pastures. In the mornings she sells milk that she gets from her cows. When the calves have grown she sells them for a good price at different cattle auctions near her home. Her husband and her children also work in this business. It is a family business and their main source of income. With a united effort they increase their income. What Victoria desires in the future is that all her stock of cattle is of a good breed. This is how it increases in value. This is the fifth time that she has had a loan with MFP, Her desire to progress has caused her to be one of the most active members in the community bank and with this opportunity she will continue to work responsibly. The money that she asks for will be used to buy a cow in order to increase her number of animals.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy a cow.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta B. is from the village of Lugait, Misamis Oriental. She is 36 years old, married and has five young children. To make a living, Julieta owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, her main source of income in the business is from selling specialty food products in the local community. Julieta has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Julieta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julieta is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Julieta from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Radjab

texts.en: Radjab is 57 years old and he makes a living buying and selling livestock. He's married with seven children who he must feed and educate. Over the years Radjab has become very knowledgeable about what is required to raise cattle, their feeding, their calving, etc. It should be noted that, in the past, this man endured hard economic times for a while but he's managed to come through, thanks to the help provided by IMON International. IMON International has granted loans that Radjab has used to buy calves, the reason, too, that he needs this loan now. The loan will greatly improve Radjab’s income and his family's living standards. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy more calves

loans.name: Leonito

texts.en:
Leonito B., 38 years old is a rice grower from Bunawan Agusan Del Sur. She has eight children, 13 years old the eldest which also helps her manage their own business. Currently, she owns am]nad manages a 1-hectare farm which she expects could provide her family enough income to buy their needs.

By buying the farming neccesities, she would be able to grow her business. She would like to apply for a loan of Php 12,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. The loan will help her achieve better harvest which she could sell to her neighbors for addtional income. 

She said that she likes the CEVI credit program because it has only 2 % interest rate whcih she thinks very low and very easy to repay.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Bernabé

texts.es:
El señor Bernabé H. esta muy agradecido por su cooperación en el crédito anterior el cual pudo comprar el material a un buen precio y su negocio ha crecido más.
Ha solicitado un préstamo para comprar más material ya que el que tenía ya se termino y quiere ir a la ciudad de Monterrey México a comprar por mayoreo y así no ir en todo el año.
Nuevamente espera su cooperación en este crédito y así su familia y negocio tendrá más ingresos, y con el cual pagara el préstamo.
texts.en:
Bernabe is very grateful for the cooperation he received on his previous loan, which enabled him to buy materials at a good price. And his business has grown even more.

He is requesting a new loan to buy more materials, since what he had is now used up. Bernabe wishes to go to the city of Monterrey, Mexico to buy enough at wholesale that he won't have to go again for the rest of the year.

He hopes for your renewed cooperation in this credit and, thus, his family and business will have more income with which he will pay off the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY MERCHANDISE

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more stock and rent a business premise.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
La socia Lourdes, pertenece al banco “ALLIN MUJU”; este banco se encuentra en la ciudad del Cusco en el distrito de Huanchac.

Nuestra socia tiene 34 años de edad, ella es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos, nuestra socia alterna sus diversas actividades del hogar con el comercio, la socia tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes, nuestra socia vende todo tipo de productos tanto de primera necesidad como insumos diversos para elaborar muchos productos alimenticios. Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para implementar y adquirir mayor mercadería, de este modo estará mas abastecido su negocio y por lo tanto venderá mas. 

Nuestra socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Lourdes is a member of the bank, “ALLIN MUJU”. This bank is located in the city of Cusco in the district of Huanchac. This member is 34 years old, she is in a domestic partnership and has 2 children. She alternates her many activities of the home with those of her business. She sells all kind of products such as basic necessities for the preparation of various dishes. She is asking for a loan to set up her business and acquire more goods to supply the business and be able to increase sales. She appreciates and values loans awarded in this way and in the same manner commits to complying with the established payment schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to set up her business

loans.name: Amarilis

texts.es:
Amarilis A. B., tiene la edad de 36 años, es casada, y tiene 5 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. Los hijos tienen 17, 15, 14, 11 y 1 años respectivamente. Ella quiere comprar almacigo de cafe para cultivar en el año que viene. Tiene varios años que se dedica a su finca y quiere crecer. Este prestamo puede ultizar para tener mas producción, gracias a que van a tener mas cantidad. Es el primer préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR.  FUDECOSUR le brindó el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de interés es mucho más baja. Ella no tenía problemas en su propiedad, pero si tiene el deseo de sea una finca productiva. Gracias al credito, ella puede mejorar la calidad de vida de todos los miembros de la familia. 

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Amarilis A. B., 36, is married and the mother of 5 children who are her greatest priority in life. Her children are 17, 15, 14, 11, and one-year old respectively. She wants to buy coffee seedlings to plant next year. She has tended to her farming for several years and whe wants to expand. This financing will be used to increase production since she will have more plants. This is the first loan she has gotten from FUDECOSUR. FUDECOSUR offered the loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate. She had no problems with her property but she does want her farm to be productive. Thanks to the loan, she can improve the quality of life of all her family members. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy coffee seedlings.

loans.name: John Baptist

texts.en: John Baptist K. is twenty-nine years old. He is a married man blessed with two children. John owns a motorcycle garage located in the Lyantonde trading center. He has been operating his business for over nine years. He is requesting a loan to invest in purchasing spare parts and other material for his garage business. John hopes to be successful and expand his business in the near future.

loans.use: To invest in purchasing spare parts for his garage business

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys de 43 años es una mujer muy sencilla y luchadora, vive en la casa de uno de sus familiares y lo que más desea es sobre salir en la vida.Auque es la propietaria de la combi (auto algo amplio de transporte público con capacidad para transportar varias personas), Gladys no tiene ningún problema en desempeñarse como cobradora, ha puesto a trabajar su auto  en una empresa de transportes, que brinda servicio urbano por las calles de la ciudad donde vive, su carisma y alegría han hecho que sea una de las cobradoras más conocidas de la empresa, lo cual le a ayudado a tener más pasajeros que el resto de vehículos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es que al tener su propia combi aprovecha para conducirla, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es permanecer todo el día parada al costado de la puerta soportando el frío que entra de la calle. Para el futuro, espera juntar el dinero necesario para comprar una combi nueva, y así mejorar sus ingresos económicos.Es el cuarto préstamo de Gladys con  MFP y al igual como lo hizo con sus anteriores préstamos, desea pagarlo a tiempo y sin dificultades; en su banco comunal es muy respetada, ya que es la socia más activa y comprometida.Con los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, mandará arreglar el techo de su combi en un taller de mecánica, ya que actualmente el vehiculo tiene el techo  muy bajo y no le permite recoger muchos pasajeros.
texts.en:
Gladys, 43, is a hard-working, unassuming woman who lives in a relative's house; what she most wants is to stand out in life. Although she's the owner of a combi (van-like vehicle used in public transportation of passengers) she doesn't shrink back from working as fare collector. She has placed her combi with a transportation company which provides urban transportation along the streets where she lives. Her charisma and pleasant disposition has made her one of the company's most recognized fare collectors which, in turn, has caused her to have more passengers than any other vehicle. What she likes best about her work is that, owning her own combi, she can sometimes actually drive it herself. She has been in this line of work for 10 years and she considers the most difficult part of it having to stand alongside the door all day in the cold draft that comes in from the street. For the future, Gladys hopes to save enough money to buy a new combi thereby improving her income. This is her fourth loan with MFP and, as she did with her former loans, she aims to repay this one on time and without any difficulties. She is highly respected in her communal bank because she is the most active and committed member. With the 2500 new soles requested, she will have the roof on her combi repaired because it is currently too low to allow for many passengers to ride.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve her vehicle in order to offer better service.

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es:
En el mercado Central de la ciudad de Chinandega la señora Rosa M. vende todo tipo de alimentos los cuales son preparados por ella misma a diario desde las Cuatro y media de la madrugada elaborados en su casa y con el fin de comercializarlos en el mercado a diario.
Ella se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajadora y por llevar siempre el sustento a su casa de habitación. La razón por la que solicita el crédito es para la compra de materia prima como aceite, arroz, frijoles, entre otros. Al obtener el crédito se beneficia grandemente porque aumenta sus ventas en el mercado ofreciendo más platillos de comida.
texts.en:
Every morning at 4:30 Rosa M. begins preparing a variety of foods in her home to later sell at Chinandega's central market. Rosa is very hard-working and always takes care of her household's needs. She is requesting a loan to purchase ingredients including cooking oil, rice, and beans. Obtaining the loan will help her increase her sales by increasing the amount of food she can offer for sale.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cooking ingredients

loans.name: Ney

texts.en: Mrs. Ney K. is a villager in Ping Pong village, located in Takeo Province. She is 61 years old and a grocer in the local village. Her husband, Mr. Tuk Torng, is a farmer who owns 2-hectare of land to cultivate rice to support their family. This family has some problem with their rice field being infertile soil and they do not have enough money to improve it. Mrs. Ney K. has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers, pesticide and pay for labour expanses. This couple is married and have two children, one is a laborer in Thailand country and the other helps Mrs. K. sell groceries.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticide and labour expenses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy hairdressing supplies

loans.name: J Trinidad

texts.es: El señor J Trinidad es un señor trabajador que opto por poner un negocio desde hace 9 años en una calle muy transitada de la ciudad llamado “Miscelánea G.” donde el tiene una venta de abarrotes en general. Este negocio lo atiende el y su esposa aunque ya son personas grandes quieren seguir trabajado para el sostén de ellos mismos, pues sus hijos ya se encuentran casados y no quieren ser una carga para ellos. Este negocio tiene de todo como refrescos, comida enlatada, botanas y mucho mas, solo que ahora el señor Trinidad quiere comprar mercancía para estar bien surtido.
texts.en:
J. Trinidad is a hard-working man that chose to open a store called, “Miscelánea G.,” 9 years ago on a very busy city street where he sells general merchandise. He and his wife tend the store; even though they are seniors they want to continue to work and support themselves because their children are married and they don't want to be a burden to them. The store has everything like: soft drinks, canned food, snacks and many more items. Trinidad wants to buy more merchandise so that he can be well stocked.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock his store.

loans.name: Nanci Judith

texts.es:
El banco Comunal María Monserrate se reúne en la ciudad de Montecristi en la provincia de Manabí, 
La señora Nancy de 54 años  es casada con 4 hijos lleva 35 años de casada su esposo es chofer ella es profesora y  también dedica su tiempo al comercio informal, desde siempre le ha gustado el mundo de las ventas, por ello decidió un día invertir en ropa, ella empezó con la fundación con la suma de 500 dólares para la mercadería, y desde hace 10 años viene trabajando así,  y en los actuales momentos ella esta solicitando un monto mas alto, debido a que su negocio también ha ido creciendo.

Con este nuevo crédito la señora Nancy invertirá todo en mercadería, como ropa, perfumes, shampoo, ropa interior, media y más, ella no pierde ni una sola oportunidad para trabajar por ahora  como es época de clases vende uniformes. 

La forma de trabajar de nuestra socia es dedicase en la mañana a la profesión de maestra y al mismo tiempo sus clientes son los compañeros de trabajo y amigos del sector donde vive, es así que puede mantener firme los dos trabajos, brindando facilidades de pagos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The María Monserrate Communal Bank meets in the city of Montecristi in the Province of Manabí.

Sra. Nancy is 54 years old and has four children. She has been married 35 years to her husband, who is a chauffeur. Nancy also devotes her time to an informal business, since she has always enjoyed the world of sales. For this reason, she decided one day to invest in clothing. When she started with the Foundation, she began with a total of $500 worth of merchandise and has been working ever since for the past ten years. At the moment, she is requesting a higher amount because her business has also grown.

With this new loan, Sra. Nancy will invest it all in merchandise such as clothing, perfumes, shampoo, undergarments, socks, and other items. She does not to miss a single opportunity to work because now is the school season when uniforms are sold.

Nancy works as a teacher in the mornings. At the same time, her customers are her co-workers and her friends from the area where she lives. She has a strong hold on both of her jobs and is able to provide payment options to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing, perfumes, shampoo, undergarments, socks, and other items

loans.name: Peris

texts.en:
Peris is 31 years old, married, and the mother of one child. She is a dairy farmer and has been in the farming business for the last two years. She stays in Nderi Estate which is near Kikuyu Town.

This area is a very favorable environment for both livestock and crop farming. Her clients are mainly residents of the area who buy milk for their domestic consumption.

She had no previous credit history before joining KADET, and this is her second loan from KADET. She hopes to buy more cows to produce more milk, which will generate more income for her family.

loans.use: Peris plans to buy another dairy cow for more milk production.

loans.name: Rushaka 1 Twimukye Group, Ibanda

texts.en:
N. Peregia, widowed at a tender age and left with her four children, has quite an extraordinary pedigree when it comes to lucrative business. She started her business eight years ago dealing in herbal medicines in Rushaka, Ibanda. The medicines that she supplies to her customers are meant for treating certain diseases like skin diseases and malaria.

Due to her commitment and hard work, Peregia was able to acquire a license for her business and got it registered. With this loan, she is looking forward to maximize her research into herbal medicines and also to expand her business by opening up more stores. This will make her medicines popular and gain her more customers.

Peregia belongs to a big group of members who are saving together but many are on recess though decided to appear in the photo to have a sense of belonging. Only ten members are taking a loan as shown in the list of names.

loans.use: To enhance her research about certain medicinal herbs and to open more stores

loans.name: Lilian Baraza

texts.en:
Lilian is a 34 year old mother of three children, aged between 2 years to 13 years of age. She is married to Haro, a teacher by profession. 

Lilian is in the business of transport, where she owns a motorcycle and employs someone else to operate it. Lilian is also employed in a hotel in Malindi. She has been in business for the last twelve years and earns a profit of KES 10,200 a month.

She hopes to venture into the clothes business and thus will spend KES 40,000 to source new materials for sale. She will use KES 10,000 for repairing the motorcycle and she can save KES 10,000.

She was introduced to KADET by an existing member in her group and this is her second loan, after successfully completing her first loan. Lilian also desires to have a cereals shop and will use the extra earnings from this loan towards this venture. She wants to be able to educate her children comfortably and to build rental houses on her plot of land.

loans.use: Source for materials(clothes), repair motorcycle and save

loans.name: Oscar Trinidad

texts.es:
Oscar Trinidad de 34 años de edad es un pequeño productor que habita en la comarca El Jicaro, es casado con la Señora Maria Robles, su familia la  intregan sus niños menores de edad, su esposa y el.  Desde muy pequeño se ha dedicado a la actividad agropecuaria  pues fueron sus padres quienes le enseñaron a trabajar y a ser responsable con sus compromisos. Posee una propiedad de 40 mzs, las cuales presentan buenas condiciones técnicas para el desarrollo de hato ganadero, con el credito anterior logro comprar un panel solar, pues el desea que su familia cuente con las condiciones basicas de un hogar.  En su comunidad es conocido como un hombre bien responsable, honesto y trabajador. 

Esta solicitando su 4to crédito para la compra de terneros para engordarlos y desarrollarlos y asi venderlos a un buen precio que le permita obtener ganancias que le proporcionen mejores oportunidades a su familia, y que le permita fortalecer su inventario ganadero.  

El mayor sueño que tiene es poder brindarle a su familia las mejores condiciones, que sus hijos estudien y sean hombres de provecho.
texts.en:
Oscar Trinidad is 34 years old and he is a small grower living in the El Jicaro region. He is married with Maria and his family is composed of his young children, his wife and himself. Since he was very young he has dedicated himself to the farming business, as his parents taught him to work and to comply with his commitments. He owns a property of 40 manzanas (approx. 70 acres), offering good conditions to the handling of his herd; with his previous loan he succeeded in buy a solar panel, as he wants his family to enjoy the basic living conditions at home. He is known in his community for a very responsible, honest and hard-working man. He is asking for his 4th loan to buy calves to fatten, breed and then sell them at a fair price that will allow him both to earn enough money to offer better chances to his family and to strengthen his cattle inventory. His biggest dream is to be able to provide the best living conditions for his family, and for his children to get an education and be good, hard-working men.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy breeding calves

loans.name: Montang

texts.fr: Monatng MANKANG est une femme de 31 ans, elle est mariée et mère de dix (10) enfants en charge. Elle est membre du banc Villageois de DIAOBE MANDING depuis le 10 juin 2002 et a 15 fois de suite reçu de crédit et n'a jamais eu de problème de remboursement. Elle fait de la production et vente de pâte d'arachide depuis plus de 7 ans. Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge des enfants et de toute la famille en général.
texts.en:
Montang Mankang is a 31-year-old woman, married and mother and caregiver of 10 children. She has been a member of the “Banc Villageois” Diaobe Manding since June 10, 2002. She has received 15 consecutive loans and has never had a problem paying back. She has produced and sold peanut butter for seven years. Her goal is to support her husband in providing for the children and the family in general.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To develop and promote her income generating activity.

loans.name: Rosemarie Beluso Group

texts.en:
Rosemarie B. is from the village of Biasong. She is 35 years-old and the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by Kiva partner PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Rosemarie is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Rosemarie owns and operates a manufacturing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from manufacturing and selling clay products to local businesses and community members. Rosemarie has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month.

In 2008, Rosemarie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosemarie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional raw materials to expand her product offering. Rosemarie is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and provide working capital. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Rosemarie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to provide working capital.

loans.name: Rochie

texts.en: Rochie M. is from the town of Trento. She is 22 years old and married. Rochie helps her husband maintain their rice farm, and has been involved in farming for over five years now. She rents a stall at their town's market where she sells their harvest. They have just prepared their land for planting and  need farm inputs. Therefore, Rochie has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, CEVI, where she is a member. She has asked for a loan of 9,000 PHP to purchase seeds, seedlings and fertilizers. This loan will be her third from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Nelita

texts.en: Nelita O. is a married woman who lives in Prk Pasil, Malabugas, Bayawan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: a sari-sari (general) store and a pig-fattening businesses. Her husband Federico O., who is 58 years old, works as a carpenter to earn his living, and also helps with his wife's business activities. They have six children who are 19 to 31 years old. Nelita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 15 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Nelita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 21,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 12,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 16th loan cycle, she is borrowing PHP 29,500, which she intends to use to purchase a refrigerator for her sari-sari (general) store and also to add to her revolving working capital, so that she can continue to save up for future additional capital for both businesses. Nelita O. is a Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable") woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team. http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator and for additional working capital

loans.name: Clara Guillermina

texts.es:
Clara de 52 años, vive en el Guasmo de Guayaquil (zona urbana, la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes informales), con ayuda de su esposo ella tiene un pequeño restaurante. 

Desde que liquidaron en la empresa que el esposo de Clara estaba trabajando, decidieron abrir el restaurante para poder solventar con los gastos familiares, poco a poco con esfuerzo pudo comprar sillas y mesas. Ahora ella en su restaurante vende platos típicos del Ecuador, como arroz con pollo, arroz con menestra etc. 

Ella quiere readecuar su negocio por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo cemento, arena y sing. En el futuro quiere expandir mas su negocio.
texts.en:
Clara is 52 years old and lives in Guasmo de Guayaquil, an urban area where most of the residents are informal merchants. She manages a small restaurant with the help of her husband.

When the company her husband worked for went out of business, Clara decided to open a restaurant to help cover the family expenses. With a little bit of effort, she was able to buy chairs and tables. Now she serves traditional Ecuadorian dishes such as chicken and rice, vegetable and rice soup, and other foods at her restaurant.

She wants to remodel her business, so she will use this loan to buy cement, sand, and sheets of zinc. In the future, Clara hopes to expand her business even more.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to remodel her restaurant

loans.name: Rufina

texts.es: La señora Rufina nació en la ciudad de Cochabamba,  Vive con el Sr.  Cipriano  ambos, tiene dos  hijos y hace 10 años que viven en el lugar de Puerto Rico a 2 km de El Torno. Tiene su propio terreno en el cual ambos trabajan en la agricultura pero el los ratos libres el esposo de la Sra. Rufina  se dedica a trabajar con moto,  en su terreno siembra  solo perejil,  y lo comercializa  en Santa Cruz,  ya son 7 secuencias que trabaja solo con Emprender, es una cliente muy antigua, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la siembra de perejil y los gastos que implica el preparado de la tierra, esta muy agradecida por la oportunidad que le brindaron.
texts.en:
Rufina was born in Cochabamba, lives with her husband Cipriano, and has two children. They have lived in Puerto Rico about two Km from El Torno for the past 10 years. She has her own land that they both work and where they plant only parsley which they sell in Santa Cruz. In their free time Rufina's husband works on his motorcycle. She is on her 7th loan cycle working exclusively with Emprender. She's is a long-time customer and will use the loan to plant parsley and for expenses related to preparing the soil. She is very thankful for the opportunity she has been given.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Planting of parsely

loans.name: Norov

texts.en: Norov T. is 62 years old and lives with her daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her daughter works as a professor in the National University of Mongolia while Norov manages her private hospital service in the city. They live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Norov's hospital was established in 1999  specializing in the treatment of venereal  disease- infections that are acquired and transmitted by sexual contact.  She is a hard working woman who is always looking for ways to increase her earnings. She hopes to one day have the  possibility of opening a big new hospital.  She is requesting a 4,000,000 MNT (2998 USD) loan to purchase medical equipment and tools for her hospital.

loans.use: To purchase medical equipment and tools

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To repair his taxi and purchase a new engine for it

loans.name: Roida

texts.en:
K. Roida is 38 years old and lives in the town of Mbarara in the Mbarara region of Uganda. She is widowed and has four children. All of her children are currently in school. Roida has been selling clothes for four years.  She also owns a clinic. 

To help expand her business, Roida has requested a loan of 2000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to start a new business. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Roida hopes to generate greater profits and pay for her children's school fees.  In the future, Roida hopes to expand more on her businesses and become a successful business woman.

loans.use: To start a new business

loans.name: Miguela

texts.en:
Miguela C. is from the town of Veruela. She is 61 years old, married, and has five children. Her eldest child is 37 years old, while the youngest is 25. Miguela is a farmer. She plants and harvests rice crops, which she sells to the market. She said it's tedious work but she is happy to be earning from her farm. She said she was able to provide for her family's needs because of her rice farm. Miguela also makes food like rice cakes that she sells around her neighborhood.

Miguela joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Miguela has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Miguela is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Carmen Dinora

texts.es: Carmen Dinora A. C. de 43 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Usulután, a pesar que ella  esta casada y tiene dos hijos de 16 y 14 años de edad, vive únicamente junto a su hija menor debido a que su esposo vive en Los Estados Unidos junto a su hijo mayor. Carme posee una tortillería, en la cual trabaja desde hace más de 2 años, la cual ha sido un negocio bastante rentable, debido a que la tortilla por ser parte de la dieta básica de los salvadoreños, posee mucha demanda. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y visionaria la cual a pesar que posee ayuda de su esposo, desea salir adelante y contar con una mejor estabilidad económica en la cual no le haga falta nada a ella ni a su hija. Carmen  solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para invertir en la venta de tortillas comprando maíz por mayor para obtenerlo a menor precios, así mismo desea poder comprar una cocina más grande llamada plancha, la cual se utiliza especialmente para hacer tortillas y pupusas, de esta manera ella podrá elaborar mayor cantidad de estas y así atender a más clientes.
texts.en: Carmen Dinora A. C., 43, lives in the Salvadoran "departamento" of Usulutan.  Although she is married and has two children--16- and 14-years old, respectively--she lives only with her younger child because her husband and older child are in the United States.  Carmen has a tortilla business that she has operated for more than 2 years.  The business is reasonably profitable because tortillas are a basic ingredient of the Salvadoran diet and, consequently, much in demand.  Carmen is deliberate and hard-working.  Even thought she receives help from her husband, she wants a steady, stable income of her own so that she can better support herself and her daughter.  Carmen is applying for a loan to raise the money she needs to support her tortilla business.  She will buy a bulk supply of maize to get the best price.  She also wants to buy a "plancha", a kitchen appliance that is used for making tortillas and pupusas.  The plancha will allow her to make more tortillas and serve more customers.

loans.use: Buy supplies for food business.

loans.name: Doris Yesenia

texts.es:
Doris es socia del Banco Comunal “Bellavista 1”  ubicado en el distrito Puno,  provincia de Puno y departamento de Puno, tiene 23 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente y tiene 02 hijos, la señora actualmente cursa estudios superiores.

Viene  trabajando con  el Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos desde hace 03 años, su   primer préstamo  fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizó para  incrementar el capital de  su negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de frazadas, colchas y mantas.

La señora solicitará un nuevo crédito por la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que  invertirá en la compra de frazadas y colchas al por mayor.

Su sueño para el futuro es tener un carro. Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  son las ganancias que generan sus ahorros.

En la foto se muestra junto a sus hijas.
texts.en:
Doris is a member of the VIllage Bank "Bella Vista 1", located in the district, province and department of Puno.  She is 23 years old, has a live-in partner and has 2 children.  She is currently pursuing higher education.

She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 3 years.  Her first loan was for S/. 300 nuevo soles.  She used that money to increase the capital of her business - selling blankets, quilts and bedspreads.  

Doris is asking for a new loan in the amount of S/. 500 nuevo soles, which she will invest in buying blankets and quilts in bulk. 

Her dream for her future is to have a car.  What she likes most about her Village Bank are the profits that she generates from her savings.

In this photo, she is shown with her daughters.

loans.use: Buy blankets and quilts in bulk.

loans.name: Frank Howard

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “PATRON DE SANTIAGO”; El banco está ubicado
en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Frank; el tiene 24 años de edad y es soltero y tiene 1 hijo; el socio
alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes el cual se encuentra
ubicado en su casa, el socio a la vez es estudiante universitario de la carrera de turismo
en la Universidad particular Andina del Cusco, el socio desea terminar de una vez su
carrera y así tener otro ingreso para poder vivir mejor.

El socio solicita el préstamo para los viajes que realiza con su carrera universitaria y
también para su uso personal.
texts.en:
Frank belongs to the “Patron de Santiago” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Frank is 24 years old.  He is single and has one child.  He divides his time between his daily activities and his grocery store business which is located in his home.  He is also a university student and is studying tourism at the Universidad Particular Andina del Cusco.  He would like to finish his studies and thereby have another source of income so that he can live more comfortably.

Frank is requesting this loan for the trips that he makes as part of his university course and also for personal use.

loans.use: To pay for the trips that he makes as part of his university course and for personal use

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua A. sells drinks, biscuits, toffees, doughnuts and other items at Abura. She is married and has six dependants. Her husband is a carpenter. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be added to her initial income to buy more groceries to sell to expand her business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a shop.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Ma. Violeta

texts.en: Ma. Violeta is 41-years old single and supports her family by operating two business ventures:  general store and personal collection businesses.  She lives in Toledo City, Cebu. Ma. Violeta joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 14 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Ma. Violeta has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 7,300, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 15th loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000, which she intends to buy stocks for the general store so that she could continue to save up for the future improvement of her business. Ma. Violeta is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team - http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines - on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to buy stocks for her general store

loans.name: Chuluunbaatar

texts.en: Chuluunbaatar is a 30-year-old single man who lives with his sister in Ulaanbaatar, a capital city of Mongolia. He and his sister's family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Chuluunbaatar operates a taxi service in the city using his own car. Before starting his business, Chuluunbaatar used to live in the countryside as a herder in the Bayan-Ulgii province. He sold his livestock to purchase a car, which enabled him to start operating his transportation business in 2006. For the future, he plans to continue running this business with stable operation to save more money so that he can marry. He is requesting a 500,000 Mongolian tugriks loan to repair his car engine as well as to buy medicine for his mother, who is under bad health conditions.

loans.use: To repair his car

loans.name: Agnes

texts.fr:
Cliente de 48 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants dont l'age varie entre 21 et 24 ans.Il y a de cela dix ans pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille avec la somme de 100.000 frs , elle se lance dans la fabrique et vente des beignets et bouillie de riz et de mais.
Pour faire accroitre son activité elle multiplie les stratégies pour aller vers l'avant.
A l'octroi du premier prêt elle  acheta des sacs de riz, de la farine, du sucre , des bidons d'huile pour faire ses beignets et satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle.

A l'avenir elle veut devenir grossiste et avoir des étalages de ventes un peu partout dans les différents quartiers et cela va la permettre de bien rembourser et de faire des épargnes considérables pour atteindre ses objectifs  celle de devenir un grossiste .
texts.en:
Agnes is 48 years old, married and mother of two children whose age varies between 21 and 24. Ten years ago, to meet the needs of her family, with 100,000 francs, she started making and selling beignets and boiled rice and corn. 

To grow her business, she developed strategies for moving forward.

With her first loan, she bought bags of rice, flour, sugar, and cans of oil to make beignets and to meet the needs of her customers.

In the future, she wants to become a wholesaler and to have points of sale across different neighborhoods. That will permit her to repay [her loan] and to build substantial savings towards attaining her objective of becoming a wholesaler.

loans.use: Purchase of flour, sugar, rice, milk, yeast, oil.

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en: Lucena is a married woman who lives in Toledo City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a general store. Her husband Elpidio, who is 52 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities. They have five children who are between 22 and 30 years old. Lucena joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2009 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past three loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Lucena has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 5,500, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her fourth loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000 to use as additional capital so that she can continue to save up for the future expansion of her business and to assist in her grandchildren’s education. Lucena is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: To purchase more stock items to resell

loans.name: Yaa Ataa

texts.en: Yaa Ataa P. sells baked bread at the Jukwa Market, a major market near Abura, Cape Coast. She has made her living this way for the past 15 years. Yaa is keen to expand her business and plans to use her loan to purchase more ingredients to bake more bread. She is married to a carpenter and they have three children. Her income helps pay the school fees and utility bills. She hopes to save up the extra earnings from her expanded business for her family’s future.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients to bake bread.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon K., age 22, is the sole proprietor of a spare parts shop in Grogan, Kagemi. He has been in this business for one year, and earns an income of KES.10,000 per month. He is unmarried and supports his parents.  

He has never borrowed from a microfinance institute before, and learned about KADET Ltd from a member of a group registered with the organization. He is applying for his first loan from KADET Ltd, which he plans to use to buy more spare parts, such as tires and tubes, to offer for sale.          

Simon intends to use the anticipated profit by increasing his savings and to start dealing in new spare parts from Dubai. In the future, he hopes to open an auto shop and connect with dealers in the area.

loans.use: to expand his stock for his spare parts shop with such items as tires and tubes

loans.name: Ruth Mery

texts.es: La Sra. Ruth Vive en la localidad D. la Guardia, su esposo se dedica a la construcción civil, ella se dedica a la venta D. ropa ambulante, y trabaja medio tiempo como domestica, hace unos dos años que se dedica a esta actividad, el destino del crédito es para comprar herramientas D. albañil para su esposo, vive en casa que la esta terminando D. pagar, tiene dos hijo a su cargo por lo que se le hace difícil el mantenimiento D. su colegiatura, es nacida en el departamento D. Beni considerada capital ganadera, se vino a vivir  su corta edad en busca D. nuevas oportunidades; es cliente antiguo D. la institución por lo que se siente satisfecha y agradecida con la institucion.
texts.en: Mrs. Ruth lives in the town of Guardia. Her husband works in construction, and she works part-time as a cleaning women and sells clothing door-to-door too. She has been selling clothes for two years. The loan will be used to buy mason's tools for her husband. They live in a house that they have almost paid off. They have two children, and it is difficult to pay for their school fees. She was born in the department of Beni, a cattle region, and she came to live in Guardia at a young age in search of more opportunity. She is an old client of the institution, and she feels satisfied and thankful for the support.

loans.use: Purchase of masonry tools

loans.name: Livingstone

texts.en:
Livingstone O. is a married man. His wife is a businesswoman and they have three children aged between nine years old and two months old. They hope to educate their children to the university level. Livingstone operates motorcycles in Kakamega. Kakamega is a rich agricultural region in the western part of Kenya. The region is known for its large-scale production of sugarcane and thus it is called the sugarbelt region. 

Besides this business, Livingstone runs a clothing sales shop. He has been running this business for ten years and has managed to give employment to one person. His motorcycle business is profitable and his major challenge is weather changes: during the rainy seasons, the roads become impassable and people prefer to use vans. However he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of Kes 80,000 to buy clothes and handbags to boost his clothing sales business. He hopes to grow his businesses and in the future buy a plot of land where he will build a house. He describes himself as focused and determined.

loans.use: to buy clothes and handbags for his shop.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva K. is 34 years old and lives in the town of Kinubi in the Hoima region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, two of whom are currently in school. Eva has a produce business, which she has run for less than one year.
To help expand her business, Eva has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more produce for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Eva hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more produce for resale.

loans.name: Lucio Jose

texts.es:
Lucio, es casado, vive con su esposa y tienen tres hijos de 17, 10 y 8 años de edad, tiene un taller de mecánica automotriz y estructuras metálicas, cuenta con 25 años de experiencia, además de poseer un camión de volteo, trabaja a tiempo completo durante todos los días de la semana.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar equipo para el taller de mecánica, como un taladro y compresor. Estas herramientas son muy necesarias para ejecutar sus tareas diarias.
Su aspiración es tener un taller más amplio y con todo lo necesario en herramientas, tener un vehículo para trabajar y en su familia pues contribuir al estudio de sus hijos para que se superen académicamente.
texts.en:
Lucio is married, lives with his wife, and they have three children ages 17, 10 and 8.  He has a workshop for auto repairs and metallic structures.  He has 25 years of experience.  He also has a dump truck.  He works full-time, every day of the week.

Currently, he is requesting this loan to buy some mechanical equipment, such as a drill and a compressor.  These tools are very necessary for him to have in order to carry out his daily work.

His aspirations are to have a larger workshop outfitted with all the required tools, to have a vehicle for his work, and, with relation to his family, to contribute to his children’s educations so they can succeed academically.

loans.use: buy a drill and compressor.

loans.name: Jekadi  E Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 femmes du groupe JEKADI E font partie de l’association JEKADI I de KAPALA. Elles sont toutes mariées et vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 33 ans, au moins 4 enfants. Le village fait partie de  SIKASSO troisième  région administrative de la république du Mali.  
Elles exercent la culture du pois sucré, un produit très convoité actuellement par des industriels de la région qui font sa transformation en jus et son exportation. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs activité agricoles, les membres du groupe ont donc décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y’a maintenant deux ans.
FATOUMATA  compte  utiliser  son prêt pour acheter  1 sac d’urée, 2 sacs de complexe et le reste comme frais de labour et de sarclage  Ces intrants seront achetés au grand marché de Sikasso. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues au grand marché de la même ville en détail (souvent en gros) à divers client.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 35.000 à 45 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The 10 women  of the “Jekadi E” group belong to the Jekadi 1 association of Kapala. They are all married and live in traditional expanded families. They average 33 years of age, with at least four children. Their village is in Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali.

They cultivate sweet pea, a product very sought after by the local manufacturers, who turn it into juice and export it.

With the goal of making their agricultural activities profitable, two years ago the group member decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program.

Fatoumata plans to use her loan to purchase one bag of urea [fertilizers], two bags of complex cereals, and to sue the rest to cover costs of manual labor and weeding. The agricultural inputs will be bought   at the big market of Sikasso. After the winter season, the harvested produce is stored until its value increases and it is then sol at the same market retail (often wholesale) to a diverse clientele.

Fatoumata plans to achieve a monthly income between 35,000 and 45,000 West African francs, which will be used to repay interest on her loan and cover  everyday family expenses.

loans.use: to  pay for agricultural inputs and the cost of manual labor

loans.name: Primitiva

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SR. DE TAYANCANI”; La socia vive en el distrito de Ocongate en la provincia de Quispicanchis,  departamento del Cusco.

La  socia Primitiva; tiene 34 años de edad; la socia es casada tiene 5 hijos y ella alterna sus actividades del hogar; la socia se dedica a la venta de adobe, ella tiene a su cargo la elaboración de adobes y la socia contrata peones para la elaboración a base de barro, agua, arcilla y paja los adobes para la contruccion de diferentes casas, la socia se encarga de hacer las contrataciones y de vender. La socia desea el crédito para la compra de materiales y pago a sus peones; La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales para la elaboración de adobes.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Primitiva is a member of the "Sr. de Tayancani" community bank.  She lives in Ocongate district, in Quispicanchis province, in Cusco department.

Primitiva is 34 years old, married, and has five children.  She divides her time between her household activities and her business selling adobe bricks.  She is in charge of the adobe making and hires laborers to make the adobe bricks from mud, water, clay and straw.  They are used in making houses.  Primitiva is in charge of hiring workers and selling her products.  She would like this loan to buy materials and pay her laborers.  She is requesting this loan to invest in buying materials for making adobe bricks.

Primitiva appreciates the loan that she has been granted and is infinitely grateful for it as it will enable her to grow her business and improve her quality of life.  For her part, she pledges to make her repayments according to schedule.

loans.use: to invest in buying materials for making adobe bricks

loans.name: Elie

texts.fr: Elie  est client d’ACB depuis 2009. Il est marié, il est  âgé de 40 ans. Il a  5 enfants entre 2 ans et 12 ans. Il a 3 enfants, vont à l’école .Il est né au  Rwanda.son niveau d’éducation est 6 ans de secondaire(A2). C’est son deuxième  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser le prêt pour acheter du ciment, brique, tôles et payer la main d’œuvre. Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire  est utiliser des matériels moderne pour sa maison et avoir une annexe qu’il peut faire loué. Dans l’avenir il voudrait devenir un grand homme d’affaire et construire d’autre maisons destine à la location  pour sa famille il voudrait éduquer ses enfants au moins au niveau de l’université, et prépare un meilleur avenir  pour sa famille
texts.en:
Elie has been a client of ACB since 2009. He is married and 40 years old. He has five children, aged 2 to 12 years. He has three children going to school. Elie was born in Rwanda and has a sixth grade education (A2). This loan cycle is his second one with ACB. He is going to use the loan to buy some cement, bricks, and sheet metal and to cover the cost of labor. His strategy for business growth is to use modern supplies and equipment for his house and to have an annex he can rent out. 

For the future, Elie would like to become a major businessman and to build more houses for renting out. As for his family, he would like to educate his children at the university level or higher and to make a better future for his family.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, and sheet metal and to cover the cost of labor

loans.name: Rahima

texts.ru: Рахима проживает в городе Куляб. Она замужем. У неё пятеро детей. Она имеет среднее образование. Уже как 15 лет Рахима шьёт женские национальные платья. Она берет заказы у себя дома. Целью получения кредита является покупка материалов. Она хочет сшить платья для продажи.
texts.en: Rahima lives in the city of Kulob.  She is married and has five children.  She has a secondary education.  Rahima has been sewing women's national dresses for 15 years.  She fulfills her orders at home.  The goal of obtaining this loan is a purchase of materials.  Rahima wants to sew dresses for sale.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed for sewing

loans.name: Nicanor

texts.es: Nicanor, es un hombre admirable y trabajador, tiene 56 años; que junto a su esposa Natividad, cuidó con amor y esmero de sus 9 hijos, de los cuales solo vive con 4 de ellos; en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Yanama Alto. Desde muy joven se dedicó al negocio de sus padres, “la agricultura”, tiene 30 años de experiencia en el rubro. En todo este tiempo logró obtener sus propios terrenos agrícolas, en donde siembra papa, arveja, olluco, zanahoria y flor de gladiolo; los que después de mucho esfuerzo, dedicación y trabajo, los comercializa en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, pero en campaña agrícola, los comercializa en la capital del país, donde obtiene mayores ganancias. Pero como buen hombre del campo, Nicanor también se dedica a la ganadería, donde gracias a sus 8 vacas, todas las mañanas saca leche y hace queso. Vendiéndolo a los comerciantes minoristas que visitan la zona; además de cuidar y vacunar a sus animales constantemente. Él está feliz de vivir en el campo por ello está trabajando para mejorar sus cultivos y así obtener mayor rentabilidad. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Manantiales de Yanama”, y este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, donde trabaja con empeño y dedicación. Por ello espera del apoyo de todos ustedes para continuar con sus objetivos. Además de comprometerse en pagar de manera puntual sus cuotas. Nicanor de obtener su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 3 bolsas de semilla de arveja que oscila entre los s/. 550 nuevos soles cada uno, además de varios sacos de abono orgánico para comenzar con éxito su próximo sembrío.
texts.en: Nicanor is an admirable and hardworking man. He is 56 years old and with his wife, Natividad, they have taken care of their 9 children with a lot of love and hard work, at present, only 4 live with them in their own home in the Yanama Alto hamlet. From a young age, Nicanor worked in his parents' business, agriculture, he has 30 years of experience in this field. During all this time he was able to have his own plots of land where he grows potatoes, green peas, olluco (a tuber), carrots and gladiolus flowers which after a lot of effort, dedication and work he sells them in the wholesaler market in the city of Tarma. During the harvest season he sells his items in the country's capital where he gets greater profits. As a good country man, he also is a cattle raiser, thanks to his 8 cows each morning he goes out, milks them, and makes cheese, which he sells to retail merchants in the area. Nicanor takes care and vaccinates his cows frequently. He is happy to live in the countryside which is why he works hard to improve his crops and have more profits. He belongs to the “Manantiales de Yanama” (Springs of Yanama) Communal Bank and this is his seventh loan with MFP, he works with determination and dedication. This is why he hopes for your support, to continue to meet his goals and is committed to paying his quotas on time. Nicanor with your support will use the money to buy 3 sacks of green pea seeds that range around s/. 550 nuevos soles each, as well as sacks of organic manure to begin the next harvest season successfully.

loans.use: buy three sacks of green pea seeds and sacks of organic manure.

loans.name: Ambe

texts.en:
She is single and she has four children. Only two are below 15 years of age and some are in school. She lives in Bamenda, Northwest region of Cameroon.

Her major challenges in life have been the difficulty of her children dropping out of school and  some being locked up in a police cell and inadequate capital to start up a business for herself before joining GHAPE. She has also suffered greatly from ill health. Given a loan she plans to buy Irish potatoes, cocoyams, yellow yams and local plums. She knows her business is going to succeed because she has acquired some basic training on finance management and marketing techniques from GHAPE and she has chosen to diversify business by also investing some of her capital in her farm and also, she has got support and hence success. The loan if granted will enable her to sell in her neighborhood at cheaper prices. She joined GHAPE in 2008, since then she has successfully borrowed and repaid loans two times.

She will plough back some of her profit into her business and use part to care for her family. She also will use the proceeds to pay her house rent. Her children’s school needs will be taken care of. She prefers GHAPE because of the training she frequently receives and the low cost in obtaining and paying back a loan.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: to buy Irish potatoes, cocoyams, yellow yams, and plums (a local fruit) for resale.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past 14 years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling household goods like wheat flour and maize flour. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of incorporating a restaurant business in the future.

With the KSHS 100,000, she wants to purchase sacks of rice, beans and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of rice, beans and sugar.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en: Pamela is a hardworking business-woman aged 38. She is married and blessed with two children. For the last year, she has been selling curtain blinds to earn a living. Through Faulu Kenya, she was able to open a video shop which earns her extra income.  In the next five years, she wants to buy rental houses.  She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy curtain blinds.

loans.use: To buy curtain blinds

loans.name: Simona

texts.es: La señora Simona nació en la ciudad de Cochabamba, convive con el señor Flavio  con el cual tienen 3 hijos, y viven en la comunidad de Huaytu de la provincia Ichilo, hace 9 años que ellos se dedican a la agricultura, siembran maíz, café y yuca, hace dos Secuencias  que están trabajando con la institución, el préstamo lo van a invertir en la ampliación de las plantaciones de café y lo que implica el preparado de la tierra para la siembra, por lo cual ellos agradecen todo el apoyo que la institución le ha brindado.
texts.en: Simona was born in the city of Cochabamba. She lives with Flavio and they have 3 children. They live in the community of Huaytu in the province of Ichilo. For the last 9 years they have been working in agriculture, growing corn, coffee and cassava. They have had 2 cycles with the communal bank. The loan will be used to invest in the expansion of the coffee plantations and getting the land ready for planting. They are grateful for support that the communal bank has provided.

loans.use: to expand

loans.name: Elna

texts.en:
Elna is married with three school-aged children. Elna is 27 years old and lives in Pana-on, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

To earn a living, she runs a sari-sari store selling various goods from grocery items down to a display of a few school and office supplies and hardware items like nails. Sometimes, she is vending fruits outside the store to increase her income. She has been doing this for three years. Each month, she earns approximately 3,500 Philippine Pesos (PHP). She has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP from GDMPC to purchase additional products to sell. 

Elna has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Elna hopes to expand and improve the business to gain more income. She plans to save some part of her monthly earnings in preparation for her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Siguidia Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Siguidia est un regroupement de huit   femmes de la ville de   SAN qui sont toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 44 ans et 4 enfants. 
Les membres du groupe Siguidia font la vente d’habits et diverses marchandises. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont pris l’initiative de collaborer avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leur commerce.  
Assan, assise au milieu compte acheter 12 complets habits pour enfants, 3 cartons de savons et diverses marchandises : déodorants, vernis, boucles d’oreilles et soutien gorges.  Elle effectue sa vente en ambulant et à domicile à une clientèle diverse et variée, en détail et généralement au comptant. Elle espère réaliser un  bénéfice de 20.000 FCFA par mois qui servira à rembourser le prêt et venir en aide aux conjoints dans les dépenses familiales. En ce qui concerne les autres femmes du groupe  celles-ci compte  sur  un bénéfice  de  15. 500 francs FCFA par mois. 
Les femmes du groupe Siguidia souhaitent continuer toujours avec le programme de Soro Yiriwaso pour pouvoir augmenter leurs capitales et agrandir d’avantage les activités.
texts.en:
The Siguidia group is a grouping of eight women from the town of San; they are all married and average 44 years of age with four children each. The members of the Siguidia group sell clothing and various other goods. In order to increase their businesses and make a success of them, they took the initiative to collaborate with the micro-finance institution, Soro Yiriwaso.

Assan, who is sitting in the middle of the photo, is planning to buy 12 outfits for children, three cartons of soap and other diverse goods: deodorants, nail varnish, earrings and bras. She sells her goods going from door to door and from home to a varied customer base, on a retail basis and generally for cash. She hopes to make a monthly profit of 20,000FCFA, which will be used to repay her loan and to help her husband with the family expenses. As far as the other women in the group are concerned, they are hoping to make a monthly profit of 15,000FCFA. The women in the Siguidia group would like to continue on the Soro Yiriwaso loan program in order to be able to increase their capital and expand their businesses.

loans.use: to buy various articles

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.ru: Дилором замужем имеет троих детей. Муж предприниматель. Воспитание малолетних детей требует больших вкладов. Надо уделить внимание их здоровью, начальному обучению, питанию. Она на рынке торгует детской одеждой. Для содержания семьи она тратит часть полученной прибыли. Для подготовки к зиме и расширения ассортимента товара она хочет получить займ в размере 1500 Сомони и закупить новый товар. Она надеется  на получение займа  который поможет обновить ассортимент и закупить зимнюю детскую одежду. Она заранее благодарна вам и надеется на ваше великодушие.
texts.en: Dilorom is married and has three children.  Her husband is an entrepreneur.  Raising small children requires large investments, such as paying attention to their health, early education and nutrition.  Dilorom sells children's clothing at a market.  She spends part of the received profit to support her family.  In anticipation of winter, Dilorom wants to obtain a loan in the sum of 1500 Somoni to buy new merchandise and expand her merchandise selection.  She hopes to get this loan, which will help her update her selection and buy children's winter clothing.  She thanks you in advance and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to purchase new merchandise

loans.name: Rehana's Group

texts.en:
Rehana is 29 years old. She has studied up to primary school and supports her husband financially by sewing clothes for her neighboring clients. Her husband sells wheat, cotton, rice, and other agricultural products. He is illiterate, but he has good business management skills and is running his business very well. Rehana is the mother of six children. None of them is getting an education due to the poor financial situation of Rehana and her husband. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her business sewing clothes. With the loan investment she will buy a new sewing machine because her current machine has grown old and needs to be replaced. By purchasing a new sewing machine she will be able to complete the orders on time and will also be able to run her business better. She has been operating her business for the past many years and is very confident about the success of her business after the loan investment. She is a new loan applicant of Asasah.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Elvin Roney

texts.es: El Joven Elvin Roney tiene 25 años de edad, vive en unión libre y es padre de un hijo, su actividad principal es el cultivo del cafe, tiene 5 años de experiencia en el manejo del cafe y gracias a esta actividad productiva ha salido adelante construyendo su propia vivienda, Elvin tiene muchos deseos de superación, el credito lo utilizara para la compra de un panel de energia solar, en su comunidad no se cuenta con el servicio de energía eléctrica y ahora que tiene su propia vivienda desea de este servicio para mejorar sus condiciones de vida y el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en: Elvin Roney, 25, lives in a common law relationship and is the father of a son.  His main activity is growing coffee.  He has five years’ experience growing coffee and thanks to this activity he’s gotten ahead and has built his own house.  Elvin very much wants to get ahead and will use the loan to buy a solar energy panel.  His community does not have electricity and now that he has a house of his own he wants to have this service to improve his living conditions and his family’s wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy a solar energy panel.

loans.name: Sabiniana

texts.en:
Sabiniana is a married woman from Baclayon, Bohol. She makes and sells "torta" (a baked product popular in the Visayas area). Sabiniana is able to help provide for her family's needs through her business.

Sabiniana has requested this loan to purchase flour, oil, eggs and other ingredients. Sabiniana hopes to have her own bakery someday. She also hopes for her family's living situation to improve.

loans.use: to purchase flour, oil, eggs and other ingredients?

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson has been in farming for 15 years in his hometown of Kitale, Western Kenya producing and selling maize and vegetables. He is married with five children who ages are between 17 and 6 years old. He carries out a cereals retail business in the local market for additional income. He is aged 46.

Nelson has requested a loan of 80,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo. This is his third loan request with Juhudi Kilimo. He says he will use the loan to venture into poultry farming by buying poultry and constructing a poultry unit. He says he hopes to build the business and focus on being the main supplier of eggs to the supermarkets in the local markets.

He says the challenge is poultry feeds which have become expensive.

loans.use: To buy poultry and construct a poultry unit for farming.

loans.name: Visión Hacia El Futuro Group

texts.es:
El grupo Visión hacia el Futuro está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es Lisbeth quien se dedica a la venta de ropa y juguetes de manera ambulante. Ella está casada con don Melvin quien es contratista y con el cual tiene 2 hijos.
Las otras integrantes son Bety Sofía  tiene un pequeño preescolar e invertirá en diplomas y algunas mejoras al preescolar y Carol se dedica a la venta de ropa y cosméticos.
texts.en:
The Visión hacia el Futuro [Vision Towards the Future] group is made up of three hardworking women. One of them is Lisbeth, who sells clothes and toys as a street vendor. She is married to Melvin, who is a contractor and with whom she has 2 children.

The other members are Bety Sofía, who has a small pre-school and who will invest in school certificates and some improvements to the school, and Carol, who sells clothes and cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, such as clothes and toys.

loans.name: Thay

texts.en:
Thay (in the photo) and his wife, Sokhon, are rice, hemp and lotuses farmers. They live in a village about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. The couple requested Kiva loans a few times already. They hope to continue their farming business because it is a business they have been in for almost thirty years. 

Hence Thay is applying for another loan in the amount of $600 to purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his farm.

Thay and his wife have been married since 1970 and have nine children-six sons and three daughters. Four are married and live in a separate home, two work in a garment factory, two have full-time employment and another one is in school.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his farm.

loans.name: Villa Granado Group

texts.es: El banco de emprendimiento Villa Granado esta compuesto por ocho integrantes todos viven en la zona de Villa Granado de ahí el nombre para el grupo, esta compuesto por  la siguiente mesa directiva:La presidenta del grupo  es la señora Viviana se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace ya varios años, su familia esta compuesta de 3 hijos de los cuales 2 son ya independientes y el menor se encuentra estudiando. El monto que solicito es para comprar  mesas y sillas para ampliar su negocio y brindar mayor comodidad a su clientela que este tiempo aumento por el buen sazón que pone a su comidas y por el trato amable que les brinda, se siente feliz por el apoyo brindado y por la confianza que le brindan.
texts.en: The “Villa Granado” communal bank has 8 members who live in Villa Granado thus the name of the group.  The members of the governing board are: Viviana, President, who has been selling food for several years.
